story:
The Goal

CorrectiveFeedback.com will improve the way English is taught and learned around the world. How? By helping teachers correct writing and speaking faster and better than before.

Better Teaching and Better Learning

CorrectiveFeedback.com is an incomplete but functional prototype online power tool for teachers. With it teachers will be able to correct more, better, and faster than ever before. The biggest benefits will be felt by students, who need access to pedagogically sound corrective feedback. The key missing features are as follows:

  • Fully automated correction tools
  • Documentation and support for teachers
  • Institutional accounts
  • Full-featured student module 

The Impact

$10 000 is needed by early May, 2015 to hire additional programmers and Applied Linguists to go from partial prototype to a fully-functioning corrective feedback system. Your backing will ensure full implementation of these much needed features by the December, 2015 launch date. 

The full impact will ultimately be felt by ESL students all over the world who will receive the immediate, focused, explicit, and sustained corrective feedback that they have been denied until now.  


The Problem

Recent research in Applied Linguistics has shown that corrective feedback is only effective if is explicit, focused, timely, and frequent. But ESL teachers tend to provide coded, unfocused, delayed and infrequent feedback. 


Current teaching practices 

Negative impact on students

Automated Solution
Teachers code errors in the margins and between lines. Students have trouble understanding the codes and how to correct the errors. CorrectiveFeedback.com will provide explicit and detailed explanations and corrections to over 5000 common errors.
College teachers often take two weeks to correct assignments. Delays reduce the impact  of feedback on  student achievement. CorrectiveFeedback.com will correct an assignment in seconds.

...but not without your help.



More Problems...


Current teaching practices 

Negative impact on students

Automated Solution
Tired teachers write short judgmental-sounding voice-of-authority comments. Voice-of-authority comments reduce students' motivation to re-draft a text. CorrectiveFeedback.com will  provide ways to  store and deploy voice-of-the-reader comments and voice-recordings, which have a positive impact on motivation.
Teachers return assignments with grades but without clear descriptions of issues with current performance. Students do not know how to improve their performance and grades on the next assignment. CorrectiveFeedback.com will make it easy to create and deploy rubrics containing criteria, grades and  descriptions of current performance.
Teachers teach target structures and students practice them, but there is no way to determine how many and how well target structures have been incorporated in an assignment without manually counting them. Students receive little or no focused feedback on target structure use. CorrectiveFeedback.com will  locate target structures and provide detailed feedback on target structures in an instant.
Teachers provide little feedback over the course of semester because of class-sizes and time constraints.  Students have trouble remembering how to correct errors when feedback is infrequent and unsustained. CorrectiveFeedback.com will make it easier to give feedback more often.
Foreign English teachers may not be able to correct pronunciation errors effectively because of their own strong accents. Students may not have confidence in their teacher's ability to correct their pronunciation errors. CorrectiveFeedback.com will  employ high quality Text-to-Speech pronunciation models. 
 Teachers correct students' pronunciation errors one-on-one or in front of the class.  Receiving feedback on pronunciation one-on-one takes too long. Receiving it in front of the whole class is humiliating.  CorrectiveFeedback.com will make it easy to give feedback on pronunciation by email.

...but not without your help.


The Team Leader

Nicholas Walker has an Master's in Applied Linguistics, specializing in Computer Assisted Language Learning and over 20 years of classroom teaching experience. Most importantly, Nicholas Walker has a track record of producing, successful pedagogically sound, and innovative educational websites. 

  • VirtualWrtingTutor.com is frequently cited as the best ESL grammar checker on the internet today. It's 100% free, fast, and comes with a fully integrated  MOOC.
  • FieldRelated.com is the first and only field-of-study vocabulary checker, helping students develop academic and work-related vocabulary.
  • Chatbotmaker.com is the first free speech-recognition enabled communicative pronunciation training system.
With the right backers and his leadership, CorrectiveFeedback.com is sure to be a huge success. 

Testimonials

VirtualWritingTutor.com

I feel I must congratulate you on your endeavours. Your Virtual Writing Tutor is an incredible tool and a significant advance for ESL learners and instructors alike. Thank you. 
--Best wishes, David Wilson (teacher)
I wanted to thank you for VirtualWritingTutor.com. As a college student who has dyslexia, I struggle with grammar, sentence structure and verb tense. In classes when a Professor grades my paper and in red, bold, underlined letters and says, "Didn't you proofread this?" it's soul crushing. I wish I could show how hard I work, how many times I've proofread that paper, how many tricks I've tried to change it in my brain so that I could fix those mistakes. I often wonder how dyslexia will affect my ability to work in a job where communication is important. When I post a discussion question I hope that I haven't embarrassed myself too much with my writing mistakes. Thank you and I can't wait to work with this website through this upcoming semester. 
--Sincerely, Nathaniel Kenny (student)
VirtualWritingTutor.com is quick and easy to use with good feedback.
--Leila Summers (author)

Virtual Writing Tutor one of the best free services out there. It catches errors that other online editors miss, and the explanations and suggestions for revision are good...I highly recommend people Virtual Writing Tutor as an initial check of their writing before handing their work in for a more through revision by an actual human.

Alan Withers (List.ly user)

FieldRelated.com

...a very useful tool for helping students to develop their vocabulary. Should be particularly useful for English for Academic Purposes (EAP) students.
--Nik Peachey (Learning Technology Consultant and Winner of 2012 British Council ELTon Award for Excellence in Course Innovation)

CorrectiveFeedback.com

Very interested in this, it is certainly a worthwhile area to tackle with tech. So many of my students' errors are similar and predictable (L1 is Japanese), I do feel that a lot of the time-consuming feedback that I give could be done more efficiently.

Oliver Rose (Assistant Professor at Kwansei Gakuin University)


I really liked the site and think it is capable of delivering an amazing service.
--Nik Peachey  (Learning Technology Consultant and Winner of 2012 British Council ELTon Award for Excellence in Course Innovation)
Risks & Challenges

There is no guarantee that teachers will jump on-board and use CorrectiveFeedback.com in droves. Teachers are notoriously conservative when it comes to technology. That is why the system needs to 100% robust and reliable before teachers are asked to put their faith in it.  

Timeline 

  • Expert review due in April, 2015
  • Usability testing to be completed by December 2015
  • Ph.D thesis research on theoretical strengths underway
  • User's guide in development and to be finished by July.
  • Conference proposals under review
  • Two Applied Linguists to be hire to write addional 1000 XML error detection rules by August bringing the total to 6000 learner-corpus-based rules
  • Fully automated correction tools, social sharing and peer-support modules to be added by September, 2015.
  • Full piloting with intact classes on two contintents from September to December, 2015.
  • Full launch in January, 2016. 

Other ways you can help... 

Be a pilot. Document bugs, usability issues, and your pedagogical aspirations for your students. Send the development team your observations on CorrectiveFeedback.com.   

Tell your friends about this project on social media.

CorrectiveFeedback.com

Very interested in this, it is certainly a worthwhile area to tackle with tech. So many of my students' errors are similar and predictable (L1 is Japanese), I do feel that a lot of the time-consuming feedback that I give could be done more efficiently.
Oliver Rose (Assistant Professor at Kwansei Gakuin University)
I really liked the site and think it is capable of delivering an amazing service.
--Nik Peachey  (Learning Technology Consultant and Winner of 2012 British Council ELTon Award for Excellence in Course Innovation)


Risks & Challenges

There is no guarantee that
teachers will jump on-board and use CorrectiveFeedback.com in droves. Teachers
are notoriously conservative when it comes to technology. That is why the system needs to 100% robust and reliable before teachers are asked to put their faith in it.  
Timeline 

Expert review due in April, 2015
Usability testing to be completed by December 2015
Ph.D thesis research on theoretical strengths underway

User's guide in development and to be finished by July.

Conference proposals under review
Two Applied Linguists to be hire to write addional 1000 XML error detection rules by August bringing the total to 6000 learner-corpus-based rules
Fully automated correction tools, social sharing and peer-support modules to be added by September, 2015.
Full piloting with intact classes on two contintents from September to December, 2015.
Full launch in January, 2016. 

Other ways you can help... 
Be a pilot. Document bugs, usability issues, and your pedagogical aspirations for your students. Send the development team your observations on CorrectiveFeedback.com.   
Tell your friends about this project on social media.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  We are the University of Wisconsin - Platteville Trumpet Ensemble.  Our teacher and director is David Cooper.  Recently, we made a recording and submitted it as an audition application for the honor of performing at an international music conference.  We just learned that we were accepted to perform at the International Trumpet Guild Conference!  For a trumpet player, this is five days of lectures, master classes and performances by the greatest trumpet players from all over the world.  There will also be vendors at the conference with every piece of music, or accessory having to do with the trumpet available for us to check out or buy.  And, perhaps coolest of all, every trumpet manufacturer from around the world will be there.  Try to imagine 500 trumpet players in a room trying out trumpets at the same time (usually playing as high and loud as they can!)  In other words this is trumpet heaven!

We are 8 music majors studying trumpet at UW-Platteville.  We love what we do so much that we created this ensemble and rehearse and perform without doing this for college credit.  We really enjoy getting together to hang out and listen to music, talk trumpet, and play cool trumpet ensemble music like the ones in our video.  There will be over 1,000 trumpet players in attendance at the conference in May.  Trumpet players are generally a very collegial group, and the information and camaraderie that is exchanged during this week simply cannot be duplicated.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a very prestigious conference and a HUGE deal for us to be able to not only attend but PERFORM at the event.  As you may have heard, the University of Wisconsin system is undergoing some pretty dramatic budget cuts ($300,000,000!).  What this means for us is that our school will not be able to help us with any travel costs.  They are very proud of us for getting invited to perform, but regret not being able to help us.  So, if we want to go, we need to raise the money for travel, hotel, meals and registration ourselves.

The conference this year will be held in Columbus, Ohio,  May 26-30.  Here are the financial details:

Hotel cost for the week = $2,400 ($160 per room for 5 days x 3 rooms)

Conference registration = $2,000 ($250 per person x 8)

Food for the week = $1,600 ($200 per person @ $40 per day x 5 days x 8)

Travel (gas & tolls) expense from Wisconsin to Ohio and back = $328  (gas $60 one way x 2 = $120, tolls $22 one way x 2 = $44, $164 per car x 2 cars)

Our total financial need for this trip for the eight of us is $6,328.

Like we mentioned above, attending a conference that is specific to our career and musical passion is an educational opportunity that is somewhat difficult to describe.  The value of motivating and inspiring us to become better music teachers and music performers will enrich our communities and the people and students we come into contact with the rest of our lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that contribution may not be possible for you.  That does not mean you still can't help!  Please share this link and help spread the word!  Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Potentially, we can depave up to10,000  square feet, considering that  fire truck/vehicular access must be considered.  The soil under the paving is not bad, it just needs to be enlivened by worms and compost. We would also develop a plan for replanting the yard with local species that will grow well in the area and provide more shade for the students.  The plan will also include the construction of an outdoor classroom in the part of the yard that does have trees right now.  We will also add play structures that allow a greater variety of recreational opportunities for students.  

What We Need & What You Get

The overall cost would be up to about $100,000 for such an endeavour if done properly by professional contractors (based on a rate of $4000 per 400sq. ft.). Costs include cutting up pavement, removing 18" of the paving and surface soil, hauling away the debris ( 900 cubic yards), and adding quality soil-compost mix. Removal of10,000 sq. ft. of pavement - probably the maximum that can be depaved, would cost under $50,000. Depave.com of course could do the work pro-bono, though they do not have the capacity to do the entire grounds, more likely under a 1000 square feet.   We would also factor in a planting budget of $10,000.  This is the cost for depaving the entire yard.  

The Impact

This will directly benefit the 140 students of St. Anthony School.  It will also make a significant difference to the community creating a creative growing space in a lower income urban environment.  Our school is a hub for the community.  It is also open to the Chinese community that uses the entire school facility on Saturdays, the Dalhousie Day Care that operates in the basement of the building, and the YMCA who run an after-school program during the week.  We are also in the process of connecting to other community groups and organizations to offer them space in our building.  All of these groups can benefit from our new naturalized school yard and they will have full access to this area. 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by volunteering - as we get into the spring, we will be looking for people who can actually help us with the depaving process.

See our new 'greening' website here:  http://www.stanthonygreening.com

story:
Hello family,

Through a lot of hard work over the past year and a half, I've been re-admitted to Texas A&M University this past semester. I am now in my second semester as a journalism major and my classes will soon require frequent field trips. To do my best in my major, I will need a dependable laptop to take notes and write reports on location during these field trips. My current laptop has a broken screen and a battery that lasts less than thirty minutes. 
I need a new laptop and would like to purchase a MacBook Air because it is durable, reliable and will last many years. It is, however, currently out of my budget as the model I want is $1,200. It would be great if you guys could help me out with this purchase. 
Any size donation would help!
(PayPal is preferred. I would get my funds more quickly.)
 A link to the MacBook Air laptop is included below.

story:
Short Summary

I am Catalin Rudolf, founder and head of the International Festival of Visual Arts VSLO (Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar). I have a 10-year long experience in film making and in photography having worked as a Cameraman. In 2010 I have started the VSLO festival which this year will be in its 7th edition.

This crowdfunding is dedicated to the project of my life which became important to many people in the domain of art.

The festival VSLO also known as "The Woodstock of Photography" does not compare to anything similar in the domain.

It unfolds during 10 days and the participants benefit from 14 different photography workshops, 5 film making workshops, daily classes of film and photography, painting, theater, daily concerts, photographic exhibitions, movies (short and long) screenings and much more. A cultural exchange is taking place among generations, professionals and amator, international and national actors.

VSLO means freedom of expression, a cultural and social melting pot. Participation is totally free of charge. All 400 photographers , film makers and passionate of visual arts (selected upon a portfolio) may take part to any activity at no cost. The build contacts, professional and social, forming a community and exchanging ideas and opinions.

There is a moment in life when each of us is thrilled to offer something that counts to the other people. It is the happiest moment.

Even if the financial part should not intervene in this context, it is essential for the implementation. 

I persevere, against all odds and pressures, to keep it a free of charge event. Nevertheless, its success and its exponential growth (in terms of subjects presented, of hours of courses, of number of lecturers and of participants) have been accompanied by an exponential growth of the production costs.

You can contribute in the development and the continuation of this unique festival. You can support and sponsor talented artists to get a free specialized training which otherwise they wouldn't  be able to afford. You can help young talents to reach out with their art. You can make people extremely happy and be part of this special community

What We Need & What You Get

The festival is unfolding over ten days and comprises several modules: photography, film, theater, painting and concerts.

Partnerships with various equipment manufacturers or other areas greatly help but the amounts are very far from the required value.

The Photo module includes daily theoretical and practical courses. Every day two or more themes are treated. The module over 12 seminars are scheduled on various topics related to photography. In total 14 lecturers from 7 countries will be present (many of them major international prize winners) and 10 special guests. Young artists are encouraged to present their photography and therefore 14 exhibitions are held. They are all dedicated to young artists who have not had the opportunity or did not have financial means to do so.

The Film making module includes theoretical and practical courses. The participants are encouraged to produce, during the 10 days of the festival, a short documentary or a story about the what is happening in the Vama Veche beach (and much is happening). Participants are passionate about this field but generally are people who can not afford expensive equipment or can not afford to attend classes delivered by world famous lecturers (a winner of an Emmy is among them) as these present at the VSLO. Every day there are projections in three different locations each one with its own specific: documentaries, short films and feature films. All these locations are chosen in open areas (beach) to be accessed by as many people as possible (the population in the Vama Veche sums up to many tens of thousands during August).

The Painting module takes place during the whole festival and aims to discover new talents both from Romania and abroad. The two speakers are Romanians making their living form painting in Germany and Finland. They can best express how and what to do in order to pass from an amatorial to a professional status. This year we will introduce also a new module: sculpture. 

The Theater module will be represented with 3 plays interpreted by young actors who are generally not accepted in big stages but they can express themselves freely in VSLO. Also module includes theoretical and practical courses about staging of a puppet show life size.

Outdoor concerts will take place over a period of three days and will be attended by foreign and Romanian groups. Some of them are already famous but some others are new in the Romanian and international music scene.
On music module we will have during of 4 days  drumming classes. The participants are encouraged to produce one show  which will be presented on the final day in front of all participants from all modules.

Funds will be needed to cover all the expenses for the lecturers (flights, general transport, accommodation, food etc). It will also finance the insurance for both the equipment put at the participants' disposal (professional cameras rental, lighting, computers for editing etc.) and the equipment necessary for the implementation of the event (screens, projectors, stage, lighting, etc.)

If this campaign will not raise the necessary funds, I will have to restrict some activities, to remove some modules and/or seek new partners.

Up to now it never happened and I have always collected the necessary financing. Someone up there is watching over me!


The Impact

Have you a talent that no one knows? Have you heard that a photograph of yours is not good? Have you ever wanted to have your own exhibition of paintings? Do you sing in a band but you have not been on a stage as everyone says "you're unknown"?

All these are possible at Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar!

One of the international languages, if not the most important, is art. Without art and culture, the world would be much poorer. Ideas, freedom of expression, talent are characteristics of individuals who can move freely around the world and for which there are no borders. It's incredible how this festival brings together people of art, young talents, open minded people who learn to express themselves. To free their imagination and to unveil what society and everyday life repress! The love for the beauty. The festival is already on the verge of its 6th edition. Over time the number of direct participants increased from a few dozen to a few hundred totaling many thousands. Thousands of friends in dozens of countries. Thousands of people who connected across borders through art.

All this happens in Vama Veche in Romania. Where, regardless where you come, you feel free, you feel important, you feel ... at home.


Risks & Challenges

The project started 7 years ago, at a time when nobody thought it would be possible to implement. A festival in which people interact 24/24 for 10 days it was hard to imagine. From this point of view, funding was a difficult obstacle. However there were few people who liked with the idea and helped me. I am talking about large companies that have sponsored or supported us through various forms (equipment, products ...). Nevertheless, the most important help came from the lecturers (photographers, film makers or visual art artists) who were invited to be part of this event. The were invited to hold a course of one day but in all cases they were present throughout the festival, answering questions, helping with various projects and being active in the community. This happens because they fall in love with the atmosphere of the festival, with Vama Veche, because they share the values of this event and ... of myself. Of my work, my dedication, my passion. I could say that I belong to the group of participants who are free to express their ideas, their wishes, their passion and which can come true. My passion is Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar.

Certainly the most difficult obstacle in achieving this dream is the lack of money. But I'm lucky to be surrounded by great people who helped me overcome the difficulties and helped me to make true this dream of mine and of hundreds other people!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that many people can not contribute financially. Nevertheless:

- if you feel part of the energy in this festival,

-if you are aware that you can help not one but hundreds of talented young people to fulfill their dream,

-if you realise that you contribute to the success of artists who are visible worldwide,

-if you are among those who want to express themselves freely, to be appreciated for their work, to be part of a huge community recognizing them,

then surely you can help me!

Any article written about this action, any share of the project to friends, friends of friends, any posting on any social network, any good wordsaid, qualifies you to be part of this community. And all the above together, help us to get known, to be present in people's lives, to be strong, to be ourselves.

The best example is Indiegogo, Inc., which helps us to express ourselves and show the world who we are! From now Indiegogo, Inc. is part of our community!

story:
What is Casa Mea?

Casa Mea (Romanian for "My Home") is a group home that currently houses seven children in Prejmer, Romania.  With one of the highest rates of child abandonment in Europe, Romanian children often find themselves in government-run institutions that overlook their basic need for love and affection.  That's the primary goal of Casa Mea:  to provide a home where the kids thrive, rather than simply survive.

What We Need

A breakdown of our financial needs:

  • Every month, the house needs to be heated, there needs to be electricity and hot water, and our kids need to eat.  These are, of course, the most basic necessities.
  • We have four full-time staff members who handle the care of the children and the house, and their salaries need to be paid monthly.
  • We have an administrator who runs the organization from Romania.
  • We have an educator who works with the children's school to ensure that they are performing to the highest standards academically.

The Impact

There is no way to measure the impact of changing a child's life, which has made fund-raising challenging for us.  Plenty of people like the idea of providing for children in need, but the burden of continuing to care for them year after year causes many to shy away from our organization when it comes time to donate.  Our kids participate in sports, art classes, and community events.  We have volunteers teaching them English on a constant basis.  We are now in the process of looking into high school for the older kids, and are even beginning to plan for their future once they've turned 18.  We'd like to form bonds with donors in the United States who wish to not only get to know the kids, but to stay in touch long term and keep track of their progress and growth.

Risks & Challenges

These kids, and all kids in similar positions, are at constant risk of becoming "street children."  It's very common for kids in foundations or government run housing to run away and live in communities that rely on begging and stealing to survive.  As such, it's incredibly important that we provide the kids with discipline and love, discouraging poor behavior and any desire to make the sorts of decisions that lead to living on the streets.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, consider helping in some of these other ways:

  • Like our Facebook page and follow our activity (click the link below)
  • Host a fund-raiser in your town--simple ideas like bake sales and book sales have been a great source of income for us in the past!
  • Let people know that we're out here and we're working tirelessly to provide for these kids
  • Contact us directly for more information, or if you have an idea!
story_txt:
What is Casa Mea?Casa Mea (Romanian for "My Home") is a group home that currently houses seven children in Prejmer, Romania.  With one of the highest rates of child abandonment in Europe, Romanian children often find themselves in government-run institutions that overlook their basic need for love and affection.  That's the primary goal of Casa Mea:  to provide a home where the kids thrive, rather than simply survive.


What We Need
A breakdown of our financial needs:

Every month, the house needs to be heated, there needs to be electricity and hot water, and our kids need to eat.  These are, of course, the most basic necessities.
We have four full-time staff members who handle the care of the children and the house, and their salaries need to be paid monthly.
We have an administrator who runs the organization from Romania.
We have an educator who works with the children's school to ensure that they are performing to the highest standards academically.



The Impact
There is no way to measure the impact of changing a child's life, which has made fund-raising challenging for us.  Plenty of people like the idea of providing for children in need, but the burden of continuing to care for them year after year causes many to shy away from our organization when it comes time to donate.  Our kids participate in sports, art classes, and community events.  We have volunteers teaching them English on a constant basis.  We are now in the process of looking into high school for the older kids, and are even beginning to plan for their future once they've turned 18.  We'd like to form bonds with donors in the United States who wish to not only get to know the kids, but to stay in touch long term and keep track of their progress and growth.

Risks & Challenges
These kids, and all kids in similar positions, are at constant risk of becoming "street children."  It's very common for kids in foundations or government run housing to run away and live in communities that rely on begging and stealing to survive.  As such, it's incredibly important that we provide the kids with discipline and love, discouraging poor behavior and any desire to make the sorts of decisions that lead to living on the streets.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help us financially, consider helping in some of these other ways:

Like our Facebook page and follow our activity (click the link below)
Host a fund-raiser in your town--simple ideas like bake sales and book sales have been a great source of income for us in the past!
Let people know that we're out here and we're working tirelessly to provide for these kids
Contact us directly for more information, or if you have an idea!

story:
About College Bound

I am Nikki, an AmeriCorps VISTA currently serving at the Boys & Girls Club of Venice in Venice, California. My assignment is to make college a reality for students who are historically underrepresented, who live in poverty, and who have bright futures ahead of them. 

This is made possible by a program called "College Bound" that was developed by another local Boys & Girls Club. Twice a week, we host workshops that teach youth about different colleges, the benefits of going to college, ways to pay for college, majors to choose from, careers to follow, and much, much more! Participants get the chance to win prizes that have been donated and they get the chance to visit local and semi-local college campuses. 

Because we are a non-profit organization and serve a large part of our community, our College Bound participants don't always get the chance to visit colleges due to lack of funding. With as little as $150, we could take 10 fortunate Club members on a trip to the University of California, Santa Barbara, or even San Diego; two prestigious universities that our Club members are eager to visit. Every dollar counts and this campaign will help us achieve the dreams of so many of our Club members. 

What We Need 

  • It costs the Club about $300 to go on a 6-8 hour College Tour, which includes commuting time, gas costs, and paying for a van/bus driver. Unfortunately, this is money the Club absolutely does not have! 
  • We want to go on a total of 4 college trips this year, which means we need to raise $1, 200. 
  • In order to raise more money for our Club members, for every dollar we raise, our board members are willing to match that amount! 

The Impact

College tours make a real difference on the lives of Club members. For some, a visit to the campus of their dreams can really motivate them to do their best in school and succeed in college as well. Our Club members will be so inspired by other college students that they see who look like them and by the pure joy that comes from visiting college campuses. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Non-Profits are always facing funding challenges which is why this campaign is so important. We are not just a non-profit. We are a successful program that runs within a non-profit that seeks to inspire and motivate teens to pursue their dreams. 
  • If we do not adequate funding through this campaign, we will start another campaign! We will fundraise until we can't fundraise anymore. We are dedicated and committed to the futures of these Club members. 

Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't give us money now, that doesn't mean you can't help: 

  • Volunteer your time and help out with our organization! 
  • Share our campaign with your friends and family members!

story:
A little something about us Flag Football (in Slovenia)

Flag Football - It's a sport where speed, agility and tactics play the most important role at the end of the match. It's played 5v5 and it's popularity is rising day by day. There are currently more than 500 teams (male and female) in Europe. 

Slovenia is a small country in Europe which few years ago  knew only tackle version of American Football. But in last few years the level of understanding the game has raised to a whole new level. And soon after that Flag Football emerged as the alternative to the previous mentioned version of sport. And it started to grow. 

Today we have 12 Flag Football teams in Slovenia (more than in tackle football) and everything is almost set for start of the 3rd national championship. This season we want to go one step higher. This year we started compiling a national team which is led by head coach Dejan Sovilj. Dejan is in this sport already 15 years and is one of the first guys who helped raise american football in Slovenia. Dejan went under three ACL torn injuries (2 in right, 1 in left knee) and always came back to the top which only describes his dedication to the sport. 

He is also having a great support in Jernej Pavlic (president of ZANS) and Luka Uvodić (Flag Football comissionar). Jernej has been involved in tackle football for several years, but at the end of season 2013 he decided to put aways his cleats and took over presidental spot at ZANS. With Flag Football developing in year 2014, Luka came into the storyline. In Slovenia he is known as one of the pioneers of Flag Football. As a player he is probably the most experienced slovenian Flag Football player with over 250 officially played matches. 

These are just few facts that tell you what is the dedication level of guys "who run the show" in a beautiful small country near the Alps. 

And this year, year 2015, is special for us. It's special because we want to show our dedication and hard work to the rest of the Europe. We want to show that in Slovenia, we play fair, good and high-level of Flag Football. And we would like to show this at the European Championship in Madrid (Spain), from 16th to 20th september 2015. 

Seeing video of Flag Football World Championship 2012 got us goosebumps... Just imagining to represent our country on a similar competition... What an honor... Take a few minutes and watch the video bellow so you will understand, what we are talking about: 


Awesome. Isn't it? It pumps adrenaline through our veins and for a second we see ourselves already there. 

But unfortunately, things are not so easy. 

What We Need 

Unfortunately, everything starts and ends with money. Every practice, every field renting expenses and the traveling costs are currently financed by each individual player. Unfortunately, some expenses are too high for us and in case we do not collect enough money, we will not be able to attend IFAF European Championship that will take place from 16th to 20th september 2015 in Madrid (Spain). We are facing a few mandatory expenses that need to be paid in order for us to attend the championship: 

  • IFAF yearly membership - 1.000€ (cca. $1100)
  • IFAF Flag Football European Championship entrance fee - 1.000€ (cca. $1100)
  • IFAF Flag Football officiating fee - 800€ (cca. $880)
  • Gear costs (three Footballs, 12 Flag sets) - 350€ (cca. $380)
  • Jerseys (12 sets jersey+shorts) - 350€ (cca. $380)
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, they will at least help us get closer. We will try to find other ways to get the funds, but we really hope that won't be necessary.

What You Get

  • Those who donate $35 or more will receive a T-shirt with all the autograph of players and head coach, with logo "Team Slovenia".   
  • Those who donate $55 or more will receive a hoodie with logo "Team Slovenia". 
  • Those who donate $80 or more will receive a T-shirt with autographs + hoodie with logo "Team Slovenia". 

Where do we compete in 2015?

  • 11th of april 2015 - Radomlje near Domžale, a friendly tournament with first official home match
  •  5th to 7th june 2015 - BigBowl IX, Frankfurt, Germany
  • 16th to 20th september 2015 - IFAF European Championship, Madrid, Spain.

You can't contribute? It's OK. You can still help us.

We understand not everybody can make a donation. But you can still help us by spreading the word about our project. Please share this project to your friends, parents, people who are active in sports, media, etc. Every donated dollar will go to a good cause.  

Still having a question? Drop us an email at flag@zans.si. Thank you for your help.

Drop us an email at flag@zans.si. Thank you for your help.

story:
"In the end, we'll all become stories."

-Margaret Atwood              

Did you know that there are over 7.125 billion stories in the world right now? Everybody has a story to tell! Help us teach local kids how to tell theirs. As filmmakers, we're passionate about telling stories and we want to share that skill with the next generation.

We are a group of graduate students in the Media, Film and Journalism program at the University of Denver. Between the five of us, we have over 30 years of video production experience and believe stories have the power to change the world. We are excited to share our skills with kids in our community.

It is important for children to develop a creative outlet and exercise their voice. We'll be partnering with a local after school program for kids that live on Colfax Avenue to share our filmmaking and storytelling skills through a series of workshops. Your generous donation will provide equipment so these kids will have access to tell their own stories for years to come.

Where the Money Goes

Your donations will enable us to buy 3 kid-friendly filmmaking kits. Each kit consists of the following: 
-1 HD handheld camcorder priced at $300.00
-1 lightweight detachable shotgun microphone priced at $100.00
-1 collapsable tripod priced at $30.00
-1 pair of earbuds priced at $10.00
-1 equipment bag priced at $60.00

Sustainable Change

Our favorite thing about this project is knowing that your gift will enable these kids to continue telling stories long after we're gone. Having the opportunity to continue to apply the storytelling skills we teach them by having cameras of their own is fundamental to ensuring longterm change. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us some dough, don't stress, bro! You can:
  • Donate an old camera or camera equipment you're not using. Get in touch with one of us and we'll figure out details.
  • Spread the word of our campaign around.
  • Be on the look out for our film! 

Thanks for checking us out! 
With love, 
Kaitlin, Katie, Ellie, Kyna, and Lyndsay

story:
http://www.student-savers.co.uk
http://www.student-savers.com





Student Savers, at a glance...

Student Savers Ltd was incorporated in the UK over 2 years ago and began actively operating in early September 2015. We are the world’s only dedicated online student grocery retailer with over 3,000 active customers registered with us today, reaching a peak order-rate of 420 weekly grocery orders throughout Edinburgh & The Lothians in 2015 (Sept 14 - May 15). 

We currently employ 6 direct members of staff, who operate as warehouse operatives and delivery drivers, as well as a further 6 students who promote our business as campus brand ambassadors.
Our objective is to provide our customers, the student community, with the best online shopping experience in terms of service, range and price, which builds a strong business and delivers long term value and savings.


We have developed a unique end-to-end operating solution for online grocery retail based on proprietary technology and IP, suitable for operating our own business and those of our commercial partners.  We aim to achieve an average of 800 weekly customers and offer a range of 4,000+ products (fresh/frozen/ambient goods) by year end - May 2017.
The world is changing fast, driven by different shopping habits and ever more advanced technology for the consumer. Grocery is the largest of all retail segments and is moving online. Moreover, the rapid growth of shopping using mobile devices opens new opportunities. We are well positioned to take advantage of these long-term structural trends for the benefit of our customers, university partners, wholesale/direct suppliers and shareholders

What We Need & What You Gain

  • Reaching our £20,000 target would enable us to combine these funds with the outstanding profits from the previous year and grow the business to deliver to all students whom reside within Edinburgh & The Lothians in Scotland, UK. Investing in the purchase of an additional Multi-Temperature delivery vehicle, Marketing material/campaigns and Website Design and Development. This will allow us to not just provide our unique service to more students, but also improve on our current processes, providing a rounded, complete and customer-centric service to all.
  • Pledging funds to our campaign will entitle you to a variety of different perks, from being given inside access to the company performance moving forward, becoming a member of the student savers team as an adviser to receiving exclusive advertisement distribution to our growing student customer base, in the form of both physical marketing material and online advertisements.

Strategic Objectives - Driving Growth

Growing Customer Numbers
Massive annual increase in UK Student Population, now reaching upwards of 2.4 million students across the country. Growth this big needs lots of feeding...



We use a wide range of marketing channels to broaden and deepen understanding of our proposition, building loyalty amongst our existing customers, and extending our reach to potential new ones. These convert in significant numbers into engaged, frequently-shopping customers; further adding to our active customer pool.
Growing Customer Spend
We improve our range, quality of goods, product pricing and service to encourage customers to buy more of their weekly requirements from us. This, combined with increasing customer loyalty and shopping frequency, drives the size of customer basket, generating growth in the business.

Developing Proposition to Customers
Our proposition to customers is to “make shopping easy”. We do this by continually improving their shopping experience in three key areas, in some of which we are increasingly competitive in the market:
  • Impeccable service and unrivalled reliability
  • Competitive value
  • Growing range and freshest products

Risks & Challenges

The growth of city-centre convenience stores and Increase in Online Grocery Shopping at leading Supermarkets both pose challenges to our growth in customer base during 2016/17.

  • We shall tackle the convenience store growth through adopting a focus on providing competitive pricing across thousands of product lines. Through establishing long-term purchasing agreements with our main suppliers, we minimise stock holding, dramatically reducing overall shrinkage and product waste, allowing us to offer a competitive price point on popular product lines across our store.

  • We shall tackle the natural adoption toward leading supermarket chains online platforms by offering our users competitive product pricing, free delivery on any order over £30 in value, a NO minimum order spend policy, 10% off each customer's first grocery shop and a further 20% OFF loyalty code following every £100 a customer spends in our online store.

Our Campus Brand Ambassadors
After proving successful in 2015, we employ current university students as what we like to call commission based 'campus brand ambassadors'



Our confident and strategically placed ambassadors often reside in 1,000+ person student accommodation blocks and have full access to their university residence.
We strongly believe that students respond much better to other students and friends who are advertising a service than they do to the 'unknown salesman'.
Our commission based program plans to employ a further 20 students throughout Edinburgh & The Lothians.
This will allow us to offer flexible part time work opportunities, create earning opportunities for students, increase our customer pool and organically enhance our business exposure throughout the student community.

Our University Partnerships

We have established strong relationships with the University of Edinburgh, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh Napier University and Queen Margaret University whom operate a 65,000+ person student population in total.
Their support allows us to establish well placed order collection points within student accommodation residences, grants us exclusive entry to distribute pre-semester marketing material throughout Student Accommodation blocks, advertisement exposure across all campuses throughout the university year and sponsorship agreements with University sports teams and other societies.

Our Supplier Partnerships

Big brands are important, but we like to look out for the little guys too. We don’t have stores and we’re not limited by shelf space as much, allowing us to stock an extensive range – brimming with many hard‐to‐find products.
We work with both UK-Leading Large Wholesale Suppliers under unique supply agreements as well as Direct with both Big UK Brand Names as well as smaller organic goods providers and local producers.

Our competitive price point to our customers is achieved through securing long-term purchasing agreements with our major suppliers, allowing us to purchase thousands of branded products on an "As Required" basis, reducing unnecessary stock holding and ELIMINATING ALL WASTE expenditure associated with the bulk purchase of fresh and short shelf life products.
These agreements partnered with our inexpensive and direct delivery routes, give us a competitive advantage which allows us to compete with the purchasing power of large UK supermarket chains. 

Our Values

Going the Extra Mile
We always give our customers the kind of service we’d like to receive. We deliver on our promises, even when it comes trudging through snow to deliver precious Christmas orders in the winter months. 

Deliver Happiness
We aim to find the best and simplest way to help our customers, to make shopping easy and convenient for them, and give them more time to spend on more important things throughout their student years.
You might call it “feel good shopping”.

We are Hungry
We want to do so very much; our work has only just begun. We are driven to do better; to find new, smarter ways to solve problems. That's how we’ll continue to delight our customers and thrive as a business moving forward.

As a result, we’ve developed practically all of our own processes, systems and software in-house, including:

  • Our modern and easy-to-use website
  • A fully transactional grocery mobile website
  • User interfaces and applications
  • Solutions for real-time delivery route optimisation, vehicle tracking, and customer e-mail alerts.
  • Machine-learning techniques that drive our consumer demand forecasting

This has given us an improved platform of intellectual property and operating knowledge, which we use to improve efficiency and operations.

Our Infrastructure                                               

Regional Distribution Centre Based In Edinburgh, allowing easy access to the growing 65,000+ person student population.
Our Multi-Temperature delivery vehicles are used to transport goods direct from our distribution centre to our customers door.

Strategically Positioned Distribution Centre, no more than 10-15 minutes from the four heavily student-populated university accommodation areas. This allows for inexpensive and efficient delivery of orders to thousands of customers across Edinburgh and The Lothians.
We believe that due to the financial status many students share, this infrastructure and model can be replicated in many other large cities across Scotland and eventually the rest of the UK, such as Glasgow, Aberdeen and Dundee, exposing our services to the UK's growing 2.4 million person student population.

Who are we?






Helping the Cause

It's not just about the money. Yes, we obviously need it - but we also need to build up excitement and momentum behind the service so that lots of people will go and choose Student Savers for their grocery needs. If you're not in a position to contribute financially you can still make a big difference by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter or via blogs.

Thanks for your time!


E-mail: enquiries@student-savers.co.uk
Office Address: 10 Colinton Road, Edinburgh, Scotland, UK, EH10 5DT
Website: http://www.student-savers.com
Company Number: SC483774 (VAT REGISTERED)

Developing Proposition to CustomersOur proposition to customers is to “make shopping easy”. We do this by continually improving their shopping experience in three key areas, in some of which we are increasingly competitive in the market:


Impeccable service and unrivalled reliability
Competitive value
Growing range and freshest products








Risks & Challenges  The growth of city-centre convenience stores and Increase in Online Grocery Shopping at leading Supermarkets both pose challenges to our growth in customer base during 2016/17.  We shall tackle the convenience store growth through adopting a focus on providing competitive pricing across thousands of product lines. Through establishing long-term purchasing agreements with our main suppliers, we minimise stock holding, dramatically reducing overall shrinkage and product waste, allowing us to offer a competitive price point on popular product lines across our store.







We shall tackle the natural adoption toward leading supermarket chains online platforms by offering our users competitive product pricing, free delivery on any order over £30 in value, a NO minimum order spend policy, 10% off each customer's first grocery shop and a further 20% OFF loyalty code following every £100 a customer spends in our online store.



Our Campus Brand Ambassadors

After proving successful in 2015, we employ current university students as what we like to call commission based 'campus brand ambassadors'Our confident and strategically placed ambassadors often reside in 1,000+ person student accommodation blocks and have full access to their university residence.

We strongly believe that students respond much better to other students and friends who are advertising a service than they do to the 'unknown salesman'.Our commission based program plans to employ a further 20 students throughout Edinburgh & The Lothians. This will allow us to offer flexible part time work opportunities, create earning opportunities for students, increase our customer pool and organically enhance our business exposure throughout the student community.



Our University PartnershipsWe have established strong relationships with the University of Edinburgh, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh Napier University and Queen Margaret University whom operate a 65,000+ person student population in total.
Their support allows us to establish well placed order collection points within student accommodation residences, grants us exclusive entry to distribute pre-semester marketing material throughout Student Accommodation blocks, advertisement exposure across all campuses throughout the university year and sponsorship agreements with University sports teams and other societies.


Our Supplier Partnerships
Big brands are important, but we like to look out for the little guys too. We don’t have stores and we’re not limited by shelf space as much, allowing us to stock an extensive range – brimming with many hard‐to‐find products.We work with both UK-Leading Large Wholesale Suppliers under unique supply agreements as well as Direct with both Big UK Brand Names as well as smaller organic goods providers and local producers.







Our competitive price point to our customers is achieved through securing long-term purchasing agreements with our major suppliers, allowing us to purchase thousands of branded products on an "As Required" basis, reducing unnecessary stock holding and ELIMINATING ALL WASTE expenditure associated with the bulk purchase of fresh and short shelf life products.These agreements partnered with our inexpensive and direct delivery routes, give us a competitive advantage which allows us to compete with the purchasing power of large UK supermarket chains. 

   
Our Values

Going the Extra MileWe always give our customers the kind of service we’d like to receive. We deliver on our promises, even when it comes trudging through snow to deliver precious Christmas orders in the winter months. 
Deliver HappinessWe aim to find the best and simplest way to help our customers, to make shopping easy and convenient for them, and give them more time to spend on more important things throughout their student years. You might call it “feel good shopping”.
We are HungryWe want to do so very much; our work has only just begun. We are driven to do better; to find new, smarter ways to solve problems. That's how we’ll continue to delight our customers and thrive as a business moving forward.




As a result, we’ve developed practically all of our own processes, systems and software in-house, including:

Our modern and easy-to-use website
A fully transactional grocery mobile website
User interfaces and applications
Solutions for real-time delivery route optimisation, vehicle tracking, and customer e-mail alerts.
Machine-learning techniques that drive our consumer demand forecasting

This has given us an improved platform of intellectual property and operating knowledge, which we use to improve efficiency and operations.


Our Infrastructure                                               



Regional Distribution Centre Based In Edinburgh, allowing easy access to the growing 65,000+ person student population.Our Multi-Temperature delivery vehicles are used to transport goods direct from our distribution centre to our customers door.


Strategically Positioned Distribution Centre, no more than 10-15 minutes from the four heavily student-populated university accommodation areas. This allows for inexpensive and efficient delivery of orders to thousands of customers across Edinburgh and The Lothians.We believe that due to the financial status many students share, this infrastructure and model can be replicated in many other large cities across Scotland and eventually the rest of the UK, such as Glasgow, Aberdeen and Dundee, exposing our services to the UK's growing 2.4 million person student population.




Who are we?






















Helping the Cause
It's not just about the money. Yes, we obviously need it - but we also need to build up excitement and momentum behind the service so that lots of people will go and choose Student Savers for their grocery needs. If you're not in a position to contribute financially you can still make a big difference by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter or via blogs.





Thanks for your time!




E-mail: enquiries@student-savers.co.ukOffice Address: 10 Colinton Road, Edinburgh, Scotland, UK, EH10 5DTWebsite: http://www.student-savers.comCompany Number: SC483774 (VAT REGISTERED)

story:
Inova Educação

500 km inland from the capital of the northeastern state of Brazils Bahia. Lençois is a small town of less than 10,000. Well known for its beautiful national park, trails and waterfalls, a major national tourist attraction. Since diamond mining was abolished the only source of income is tourism. Like most of Brazil it´s not enough to sustain its population.

With virtually no resources to draw from we have decided to do something about the dreadful education situation, by starting our own school.

The idea is to make something where children of all backgrounds will benefit, which can serve as a model to the wider community.

Creation of a school where children of all creeds, races, ages and socio economic backgrounds can learn and grow in an unhurried, relaxed atmosphere; where enrollment would be limited so that the children, staff, and parents would all get to know one another; and where parents would share intimately in the life of the school and in the education of the children.  All would be respected as thinking, feeling human beings and treated humanely. The issues affecting their lives daily— the environment, war and peace, poverty, corruption and world issues— would be part of the curriculum. Every aspect of a student’s growth— physical, spiritual, mental and psychological— would receive attention. Inova students would be free to resolve the conflicts that inevitably arise in the workings of a group.

As well as traditional subject development, we will also have special focus on arts, music, language, culture and environment, teaching healthy eating habits, working with plants and gardening.

This school is a democratic school, with mixed age groups where subjects are built into larger all round personal or group projects; the students chose their projects based on their own interests.

Students with learning difficulties will be given extra time, attention and support to find their most productive learning paths.
 

Goals & Objectives

 

Goal  – Provide a quality educational facility for a deprived community that not only leads the way towards successful professionals but also well rounded and confident community members.

 Objective #1.1 – Provide an environment where students can develop, explore and define their own expertise in education.

Objective #1.2 – Stimulate and encourage cultural and community spirit.

Objective #1.3 – Teach students to be confident and independent learners

Objective #1.4 – Provide small ratio of student teacher numbers creating strong and confident links between students and mentors.

 

 

Fundraising goals for 2016

 

Consolidate our internal financial structure  so that in 2017 we have a strong base to build from. We believe that with a boost of 5000 euros we would be able to fulfill our commitments for the 2016 year and also add to our stock of materials and playground equipment. 
The Inova team would be committed to showing every advancement we make with your support, providing updates and photos, we would encourage and support any visits from our supporters
 

Education is the door to the future, when given such opportunities and support, the possibility of a future with choices, tools and the realty of success can change the pathway of not just an individual but a whole community.

story:
Improve your business, whatever it is

Congratulations! You’re in business, whether you're an independent artist, lawyer, mechanic, or you have or work for a bigger company. That said, your BUSINESS or YOU can always be improved. That’s why I’m bringing you the essence of an entire MBA in an extremely accessible (read: great, easy, fast, & cheap) e-course to help you start up more solidly, improve your current business, improve your own skills as a business leader, and more. In this course, you will learn about the 8 key business domains:

  1. strategy
  2. organization
  3. people mobilization
  4. innovation & startup
  5. leadership & entrepreneurship
  6. quality & improvement
  7. finance
  8. management

I have plotted these 8 domains in a super-logical grid that relates everything, making sure anyone can understand business. Through this e-course, you’ll receive 100’s of proven insights ranging across marketing & sales, matching competition, scrum, business models, lean six sigma, change management, ways to improve yourself, and much, much more.

The course will be online, consisting of slides (300-400), video (10-15 hours), and weekly new input to keep you going. See our ‘Perks’ for the different possibilities!

 

Supporting this campaign = getting the course

The course already exists. Offline. This project is an online and drastically price-reduced version of my seminar SpeedMBA. Running since 2013, the SpeedMBA seminar has been a proven success helping hundreds of happy participants to improve their business.

What I want to do now is translate all of the amazing insights from the face-to-face seminar into an e-course anyone around the world can access at an affordable price. But, as you can tell from the pitch video above ;), I can use some professional support here. That’s why I’m offering you a range of options to help yóu improve your business and turn SpeedMBA into an e-course.

By backing this campaign, you can receive:

  • Entire course in an extensive text Slide format (over 300 slides!) with a 30 minute intro video to get you started
  • Entire course in Video format (10-15 hours) plus the entire slide deck format
  • Video course + Slide course + My weekly business book summary (1 year subscription, condensing insights from 52 of the most prolific business books
  • Video course + Slide course + Offline SpeedMBA seminar in Dutch or English

Don’t wait! If you’re considering following this e-course, sign-up for one of our perks today to get the course at a drastically reduced price we’re only offering to those supporting this campaign.

SpeedMBA has received top-reviews. Participants have said things like: “I'm amazed * This has been a game-changer in understanding my business * True value for money * Immediate benefit * Massive amount of info, yet easy to follow and well-structured * Super-interesting * Worth every penny * etc. See more of the nice things they’ve said on LinkedIn.

Most tax authorities will even regard this as tax-deductible. Also, consider gifting this e-course to somebody else who can use these insights - an original and considerate gift. Maybe you’ve already followed the SpeedMBA seminar and want to share the magic.

 

Let's disrupt "business exclusivity" and provide insight for all!

Business studies like MBA’s have many notorious drawbacks: they take a long time and provide abstract or overly detailed concepts, while not showing entirely clearly how all the insights relate and can be put into practice, and...they are expensive! So, even for most people in developed countries, MBA’s are not the right choice - rendering business knowledge as a domain for the fortunate few.

Now think of the great many people in less developed countries. Such studies are simply far out of reach for them. This is not right! Everyone in their pursuit of building up their lives and business should have easy access to knowing HOW ANY BUSINESS WORKS. Therefore, we are making the full range of core insights easy, fast, and cheap to ensure they are accessible to anyone around the world.

 

Who am I? Not your typical business guy, but I know my stuff

  • I have a PhD in economics and business administration
  • I've worked over 10 years as a business consultant, lecturer, and coach
  • With corporates, government, and 100+ smaller ventures and startups
  • I've written 3 business books and 100+ articles
  • People appreciate how I select, organize, improve, and convey seemingly complex content (check out all the nice things people are saying on LinkedIn).
  • I’ve taken all the insights I’ve learned over the years and put them into this course!

 

Immediate insight in your inbox: Get the Cheat Sheet!

Still need some convincing or want to get a taste of what the course will offer?

I’m sharing a free “Cheat Sheet”; two pages packed with tons of insights to get you started improving your business! This cheat sheet will also give you a feeling for the content you can expect from the e-course.

Click here to get the Cheat Sheet!

 

Share the opportunity: who else would want to improve their business?

You can’t be the only one that would benefit from super-accessible business insight at the price of a lunch. Like us on Facebook and please share this with the relevant people in your network, to help them improve their business, support us even more, and realize our mission to get business insight for all!

 

Questions, suggestions, remarks are all VERY welcome ... thanks for your attention & interest!

story:
Skills Africa Centre Project: Creating Opportunities that Reverse Negative Economic Migration of African Youths

Let's help the next generation of prospective economic migrants pursue meaningful opportunities in their home countries.

The Skills Africa Centre project is an initiative of Knowledge and Productivity Education for Africa Initiative (KPEAI). KPEAI is a registered education charity (CAC/IT/NO/87520 ) geared towards setting up functional and well-resourced experiential learning empowerment education centres across Africa starting with Nigeria.

The Skills Africa Centre project aim to create an institution that will focus solely on the teaching of experiential learning based empowerment education which aims to transition, the youth of Africa from the four walls of academic learning into the real world of the labour market and entrepreneurship.  This kind of formal work ready learning opportunity does not exist currently in any African country.  KPEAI therefore wants to help bridge this gap, starting from Nigeria.

View the KP Africa website, Learn more about Our board of trustees, Learn more about the project team. We are supported by a large enthusiastic group of local and international accomplished academics and professionals ready to volunteer their services to Skills Africa Centre.

Some of the Skills Africa Project team members 

              

 

Our Quest

Our quest now is to set up a centre that will be dedicated to solely teaching this work ready academic to work transition programme to help reduce unemployment and illegal economic migration. The troubling part is that a large population of the next wave of economic migrants are in the classrooms of secondary schools and lecture halls of universities in Africa. Without the work ready academic to work, transition skills set, to navigate the real world of work,  upon graduation, and wrongly believing that all hope for the future lies in Europe or the USA, they will make the journey - which, very often, ends badly for everyone. 

The current out of control migration crisis is a clear example. 

We are aware that daily an average of 1000 African youths make this treacherous and dangerous journey abroad in search of a better life which most times does not end well as shown in the picture above but with your intervention these numbers can be drastically reduced.

What we have done so far 

Our research in the last five years that culminated in the setting up of this project  suggest that, this lack of work ready - academic to work transition programme has increased the number of unemployed, frustrated young adults and  youths who end up becoming illegal economic migrants.  Because we understand the root cause of the problem, we put together 13 weeks Skills Africa programme, which adopts the booth camp style tutoring pedagogy, we have pilot tested and started deploying the programme, see documentary link posted by graduates of the programme.

Skills Africa ELB 420 Documentary

Below is photo speak of recent Skills Africa Experiential Learning ELB 420 programme.

Some graduation pictures of Skills Africa participants of the tagged ELB 420 in May 2016


Above are pictures of some students receiving their Experiential Learning  in Entrepreneurship and Employ-ability Training Certification. 

Why Skills Africa Centre Project

Helping us set up this Skills Africa Centre in Lagos Nigeria, will enable us scale up the deployment and teaching of Skills Africa experiential learning programme and be in a position to reach out to more youths of Africa starting from Nigeria.

We therefore need your help to scale this project.

  1. Beyond the pilot, and  reach every University  in Nigeria
  2. Beyond Universities, and reach Secondary schools as well as every unemployed youth.
  3. And finally beyond Nigeria, and reach the whole of Africa.

The Skills Africa Centre will provide enabling environment that will produce enlightened, confident, entrepreneurial African youths with labour market and innovative acumen with capacity to participate in the mass self-empowerment opportunities available in their home countries. 

What you will help us Achieve

Helping  us meant giving an opportunity to these African youths to gain education that will enable them  unleash their creative innovation across Africa, thus becoming a large army of entrepreneurs, job creators and not just job seekers, creative thinkers contributing wealth and prosperity to Africa and the world and not just takers or illegal economic migrants. Please also Meet this South African Graduate that would benefit from participating in Skills AFRICA Project Click Here.

The Impact you will be helping us to make

You will be helping these youths create the prosperity and stability that would arrest or reduce the scourge of illegal economic migration with all its associated problems for the countries of origin and destination. Prosperity in developing countries create the "emerging market" phenomena, which  increases global prosperity, promotes peaceful co-existence, reduces inequality and  mass illegal migration.

Financial Highlights

The total amount required to set up is  $300,000.00.

Breakdown of what your given will be used for:

1)  Lease of 650 sqm one storey building with parking lot  $66650.00,

2) 100 Computer Equipment, Server +  Installation $58200.00   

3) Teaching Materials and Licences $25500.00

4) Network and Satellite Equipment $23920.00

5) Project Vehicles (Lease)  $ 16000.00 

6) Furniture and Fittings $15150.00

7) 25KVA Generator and Security Equipment $7586.00

8) Library Equipment + Accessories $9358.00.

9) Property renovation works $19180.00

10) Project HR & Admin Staff $25800.00

11) Project Ins. + Legal Fees $8656.00   

12) Tutors Fees  $24000.00.

Note: Cost items 1 - 9  cover 60 months period while items 10-12 cover 24 months period 

Future Plan

We aim to start the North Africa Skills Africa Project Centre by January 2019, Work on the centre will commence in December 2018. We aim to be in all 5 regions of Africa by 2022. All we need is for you to help us start the Lagos Nigeria West Africa Skills Africa Project Centre.

What you get

Every investor of this project is a change champion and will be rewarded with perks as stated on the side bar.  Thank you for  helping to change the life story of a real person.

Other ways you can help us with this project

We need you to please help spread the word about this project to people you know can help us Share it on Facebook, Blogs, Twitter and every other social media platform, Every little helps.  Help us raise this $300,000.00.  

Africa needs you now.

Every investor of this project is a change champion and will be rewarded with perks as stated on the side bar.  Thank you for  helping to change the life story of a real person.
Other ways you can help us with this project
We need you to please help spread the word about this project to people you know can help us Share it on Facebook, Blogs, Twitter and every other social media platform, Every little helps.  Help us raise this $300,000.00.  
Africa needs you now.

story:
*Don't forget to click "GET THIS PERK" if you're donating $10 or more! ​

If you are curious to see a layout of exactly where your money is going, click here.

--------

About Project Cyma and Our Project

At Project Cyma, we strive to directly engage local populations in development projects that sprout prosperity and self-reliance within their very own communities. After all, "Cyma" is Latin for "sprout"! We've decided to team up with the American University of Nigeria’s (AUN) Peace Through Sports program. We are developing 3G and WiFi-capable tablets to be used by the program’s participants. The primary activities of Peace through Sports are to identify vulnerable youths, organize a Peace and Conflict Resolution workshop for the young people involved, organize the participants into unity teams, conduct training sessions, and organize sporting events. The initiative provides participants with an alternate route, as Boko Haram often lures young Nigerians to join their group through offers of loans, paychecks, and stability. One Peace Through Sports participant put it best: "it was this or Boko Haram." 

With funding to support this effort, AUN plans to reach an additional 5,250 beneficiaries from all seven local governments in Adamawa. Adamawa is a state in Nigeria that has been severely impacted by Boko Haram's violence. The Peace through Sports initiative provides an opportunity for young people from vulnerable and marginalized communities to demonstrate their roles in the mission of global friendship, peace, and development through participation in sports and relevant workshops.  

The Impact

It is our conviction that Cyma's tablets combined with Peace Through Sports' existing program will have a tangible impact upon the young people in northern Nigeria that have been affected by Boko Haram's violence, largely because it has already been proven to work. In past years of Peace Through Sports, 216 participants have secured employment through this program and 91 have gone back to high school or college. Some of the participants (29 thus far) have gone on to play for state teams in Adamawa, Gombe, Taraba, and Yobe. Participants also receive ICT training, free college entrance exam tutoring, business and entrepreneurship training, and peace and conflict resolution training.

Others continue in the program where they can constructively fill their otherwise empty days and continue to learn the values of teamwork, discipline, tolerance, and respect for and greater understanding of their teammates and opponents’ culture and religion. For some, this program is the only alternative to turning to a life of crime and violence. 

The Challenges

We realize the risks and challenges involved in such an endeavor, and we are actively consulting professionals in the realms of humanitarian aid, international development, counterterrorism and counter extremism, nonprofits, and the private sector. We know what we’re attempting to tackle is no easy task, so please feel free to reach out if you'd like to get involved in some capacity — we welcome the help.

Your donation, your time, and/or your efforts to assist our project in any way is symbolic of the exact thing we’re trying to do on a larger scale: get individuals involved at the most fundamental levels and create a ripple effect with a far-reaching impact. Join us in challenging the existing concept of social responsibility and what it means to bring about lasting peace.

Where Your Donation is Going

With over 5,000 estimated participants in 2017, the task of providing a sufficient number of educational tablets is not an easy one, but we think we can do it (with your help). To start, we are hoping to raise enough money for the first 100 tablets, or $22,000.  

Donations will be put towards the tablets which enable participants to learn crucial and fundamental skills regarding peace, conflict resolution, and countering extremist narratives. Additionally, a small percentage of the donations (6.5%) will go to Social Good Fund, which sponsors and develops projects that will help positively impact and develop local communities into healthier and happier places to live, work, and be. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn’t everything! If you want to contribute to international development and security efforts and help people in a tangible way, please share our mission with your friends, family, and social media connections.

Connect with us

Our website: http://projectcyma.org/

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/projectcyma

Instagram: @projectcyma

Twitter: @projectcyma

To sprout conversation about our organization and mission, please use #projectcyma in your social media posts!
