story:
Full Membership
This will allow you full access to play 25 in public and private rooms with a membership that lasts until the end of 2016.

Get Now
Family Pack
Be an awesome friend or family member and grab a Family Pack of memberships. This perk gives you 6 full memberships up until the end of 2016. Perfect for a private table of friends and foes, and a great saving as well. 		Get Now





The Vision

We want to build the ultimate home for 25 – an online version of the game that is great for beginners and veterans alike.  

A haven where beginners can learn, safe in the knowledge that they will not have obscenities screamed at them for playing the wrong card at the wrong time.  And then the others – those who are experts and those that think they are experts!


We will be offering members an online place to learn and play on any internet connected phone, tablet or PC.  


There will be options for public and private rooms. Daily, weekly and all-time leaderboards will provide excellent bragging rights for best in the county, country or world.

Private rooms will have the option for open chat – after all, what fun is there if you can’t tell John what you thought of him not "playing for the table"

Our vision is to be the most comprehensive, all inclusive go-to site for 25.


10,000 Members


To make this happen we need people. Lots and lots of people.  We are aiming for at least 10,000 members so that when you go online there is a vibrant community waiting to play.  

Let’s be clear here - we are not just looking to build a niche online game - we want to build a community that is big enough and active enough to keep 25 alive - and let it take its rightful place amongst the great card games of the world.


What can I do to help?

  1. Grab one of our great perks offering membership at reduced prices.  Also getting in early, secures your membership until the end of 2016.  So get involved now and show your support for 25, your appreciation for a good card game or simply your love for all things Irish.

  2. Share this page with as many of your friends and family as you can.  Put it on your Facebook page, Tweet about it, put our flyer (A4 format - Letter format) up in your local pub and community centre.

Even if you are not interested in playing, but think this is a great cause - then please use your goodwill to help us put Ireland’s National Card Game on the International Map.


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


25 or 45?

The game will allow for as many versions of this great game as possible.  It will start out with the basic 25 and 45.  The competitions will work in a Progressive 25 format.  In time we will have other versions such as Auction 45 and Reverse 25,  and probably other versions we have not even heard of yet.  One of the advantages of being a member is that you will be able to give your input on the rules, variations and versions as we go forward. 

When will I be able to play?

The game is already in a closed beta.  We have been playing with friends and family for months so the core of the game is already good.  Once the crowdfunding ends we will open up the beta to the people who contributed to this campaign as soon as possible.  


Why Crowdfund?

The Help Save 25 Crowdfunding initiative is about encouraging people to become part of the largest 25 community ever!

The groundwork for Play25 Online is already in place, people have been playing for months, and feedback extremely positive, but there is still work to do.  Additional development is required to build the infrastructure for public and private rooms, leaderboards and competitions.

The more members we can encourage to be a part of the world’s largest 25 community, the more we can do with and for the game.  As we develop the online product, we want to offer regular competitions and introduce Inter-County and All Ireland Championships and already have our sights set on hosting the inaugural 25 World Cup.


25 is too difficult! Will this help me learn?

It’s an Irish game ... not a game for fools.  This adds to the appeal of the game and once you learn the rules you will be part of an exclusive club.

We will help you by

  • showing card rankings when you need them
  • disabling cards you are not allowed play
  • having other visual cues to help you feel like a pro 


I am a 25 expert, is this the place for me?

This place is made for you – unless of course you doubt your own 25 ability!  With leaderboards and statistics this community will make you fall in love with the game even more.  Imagine the bragging rights by being able to share that you are the best player in your Town, County or even all of Ireland.  Who knows, you might be able to prove you are the best player in the world.


What are memberships?

Memberships give you full access to all aspects of the site - public rooms, private rooms and competitions.

The Indiegogo early bird offer of €10 (and €15 thereafter) for a membership until the end of 2016 offers incredible savings.  It's our way of saying thank you for getting us started.


What are private tables?

Private tables are ideal for families or groups of friends and foes alike.  They allow you to create a table with people you know.

There will also be the option for full chat so the banter and insults can fly. 

Is this a gambling site?

No.  We want to build a community where enthusiasts of 25 can come together and play.  Our aim is to build our worldwide membership to enable live games across countries, continents and time zones.  We hope to be in a position to run sponsored competitions with prizes but not the facility to gamble.  So put your shilling back in your pocket! 


Isn't stuff on the internet usually free?

We want to offer the best online game experience of 25 possible.

No pop-up adverts, no in-app purchases, no distractions, just cards and this iconic game at its best.

The game deserves it, our members deserve it! 


Thanks,

Padraig Gorry - Kilbeggan, Co. Westmeath
Rebecca Stevens - Sligo, Co. Sligo



"You haven't played 25 till you played it down in a country pub with a crowd of auld timers. Make one mistake and you could be ate. You could be coming last when you score a trick and you think you're great only to get a clatter across the head and be never let play again. Not a game for fools." - Anonymous

story:
WELCOME TO SENSORY STREET PEDIATRIC OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY, 

 

      Sensory Street Pediatric Occupational Therapy (SSPOT) is a specialized OT practice for children. Our doors first opened on July 26, 2011 to provide OT to children who are diagnosed with physical and cognitive disabilities (i.e. Autism, Attention Deficit Disorder, Neurological and Genetic Disorders, etc.’). 


     A typical day for me is getting up each morning to get my kids ready for school, go to my OT day job, pick up the kids from school, drop them home (family support) then head out to my business in Brooklyn. I have been following this routine 3 times per week for the past 3 ½ years and have never lost the drive to pursue and accomplish running a successful OT practice.

Sensory Street has steadily grown and is ready to move to a larger space to continue the great service to children, parents and neighboring communities. The demand and need for OT services in New York City have grown. Children are often left with no OT due to the growing demand for qualified pediatric Occupational Therapists. Sensory Street has successfully been providing the best OT treatment to children at its clinic. Big things have been happening at the small "SSPOT".

Parents are happy with their children’s progress and show great interest in other programs we offer. Just recently, Sensory Street had its 2nd annual “Spooky Sensory Haunted House Experience” which featured fun interactive activities and games.  We offer movement classes and have all year round Sunday handwriting classes that help improve children’s penmanship.



     We bridge the gap by connecting with families, communities and other health professionals. Too often, people are not sure what OT is and how it will help improve the way of living.  The American Occupational Therapy Association defines OT as: "The therapeutic use of occupations, including everyday life activities with individuals, groups, populations, or organizations to support participation, performance, and function in roles and situations in home, school, workplace, community, and other settings."

      Sensory Street promotes the profession by increasing awareness about its service.  Our therapists combine their clinical skills, natural talents and passion for the profession to make sure everyone experiences the “Buzz”!   Sensory Street changes lives.

WE ARE A PART OF THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE
 

       SENSORY STREET IS A TEACHING FACILITY



Sensory Street is located across the street from the Barclay Center. The new development helped boost business. We’ve outgrown the space and NEED YOUR HELP & SUPPORT in raising enough funds for the move. The high cost of real-estate in the Downtown Brooklyn area makes it very difficult to find an affordable suitable space. Your funding will help us find the right “SSPOT” and maintain normal business operations and transition without interruption of service to our young clients.







Working on improving EYE-HAND COORDINATION

      

      What's hidden in the "RAINBOW RICE BOX"?                          This is a great SENSORY activity!


             FUN CREATIVE WAY TO INTRODUCE HANDWRITING!


        

        CONTRIBUTION GIFTS




      Ms. Bea's very own book,

            "Ooh That's Icky!" 




ABOUT THE OWNER OF SENSORY STREET

Beatrice C. Hector is  a Haitian American Occupational Therapist born and raised in Brooklyn NY.  She received her degree from Howard University (1993) and gained her experience working at Hospitals, Home-care, Early Intervention, School Base and Private Practice settings. She is also the  author of a children’s book titled, “Ooh That’s Icky” (2010) which can be found on Amazon.com.  On July 18th 2010 Beatrice was honored with a citation   by Nassau County Executive (Ed P. Mangano)  for her contributions to the Literary Community.  Her practice (Sensory Street) is a New York City Certified M/WBE  business.  Beatrice is a mother of 3 beautiful children and considers all of her young clients as her very own. They all, lovingly, call her, "Ms. Bea".

story:
Who We Are

The Down Town Glee Club, established in 1926, is a men's chorus that represents a unique sound and emphasizes four-part male vocal harmony.  Their music typically includes a wide array of songs: Broadway, sacred, folk, traditional choral music, and selections from the American Songbook.

For 90 years, the Club's mission has been to foster the tradition of male choruses through performance, charity, and community outreach.  As part of this outreach, The Down Town Glee Club is offering scholarships to students who are interested in singing.  

Your contributions will help support three current goals of our mission:  Providing Musical Scholarship for Young Singers, Supporting Local Artists, and continuing our own musical traditions through performance and community engagement.

Each scholarship winner will receive musical training through our group, have opportunities to showcase their talents, and will receive a monetary stipend of up to $250 for singing with us for either the Fall or Spring season.  

Local artists are welcome to apply to our "Afterglow Artists Series," a monthly function where we feature musicians who emulate and embody the spirit of the Great American Songbook. 


What We Need & What You Get

Your tax-deductible contributions will help us fund  one scholarship winner or one Local Artist.  We plan cover up to $250 of each recipient's scholarship.   This money will be presented to the student once they complete a concert or performance with us.  The money will be used to cover the students' financial expenses as they relate to his or her education.

If you can donate... every bit counts towards our goal to support the arts and revive this beautiful music!  As a token of gratitude, we will offer perks to our donors.  These perks include:


  • Any donation over $25 will get you one complimentary ticket to our concert, with a FREE reception afterwards!  
  • Any donation over $50 automatically earns you a free ad space in our program.  You can use ad space to advertise your business or simply a place a friendly message to someone you are supporting!  Please contact downtowgleeclubnyc@gmail.com so we can help you list your ad. 
  • Any donation over $100 will automatically be listed for 2 tickets to our concert.  If you do need additional tickets, we are happy to accomodate.  Just contact us at downtowngleeclubnyc@gmail.com.
  • Free listing as a "Booster" for any donation amount given!
  • Any donation over $250 earns you special perks, such as free recordings of your favorite song as performed by the Glee Club, and even performances for your next party, featuring members of our Club (where applicable)!
  • Special thank you/birthday song videos featuring the Club!
IMPORTANT NOTE:   To be included in the Winter program, you must donate and send the ad to downtowngleeclubnyc@gmail.com by December 8.  Otherwise, your ad will be placed in our next season's program.)

The Impact

We all know that students and musicians in New York City face great challenges.  Breaking into the "music biz" is not easy.  Making money as a musician can be competitive.  Your contributions help these students focus on what matters: making beautiful music.

Additionally, your contributions impact our ability to continue our organization for years to come.  Part of our mission is to preserve the Great American Songbook.  By keeping our organization running, you have enabled us to reach more students and local artists who will benefit from our mission!


Other Ways You Can Help Our Club

If you can't contribute, we would still love any help that you can provide!

  • Let people know about this campaign via Facebook and other social media
  • If you are a guy in NYC and you like to sing, come and join us as a singer!  Brothers in song!  Dues are waived for our newest singers.
  • If you are a professional singer, and would like to apply for a spot in our "Afterglow Artists Series," go to www.downtowngleeclub.org and fill out the "Contact Us" form.    
  • Help us at our concerts as an usher, volunteer, videographer, lighting designer, or photographer  (free admission to our shows, as a result!)
Contact us at downtowngleeclubnyc@gmail.com,  or visit www.downtowngleeclub.org so we can contact you regarding future opportunities, concerts, and events!
story_txt:
Who We Are
 The Down Town Glee Club, established in 1926, is a men's chorus that represents a unique sound and emphasizes four-part male vocal harmony.  Their music typically includes a wide array of songs: Broadway, sacred, folk, traditional choral music, and selections from the American Songbook.
For 90 years, the Club's mission has been to foster the tradition of male choruses through performance, charity, and community outreach.  As part of this outreach, The Down Town Glee Club is offering scholarships to students who are interested in singing.  
Your contributions will help support three current goals of our mission:  Providing Musical Scholarship for Young Singers, Supporting Local Artists, and continuing our own musical traditions through performance and community engagement.
Each scholarship winner will receive musical training through our group, have opportunities to showcase their talents, and will receive a monetary stipend of up to $250 for singing with us for either the Fall or Spring season.  
Local artists are welcome to apply to our "Afterglow Artists Series," a monthly function where we feature musicians who emulate and embody the spirit of the Great American Songbook.     What We Need & What You Get Your tax-deductible contributions will help us fund  one scholarship winner or one Local Artist.  We plan cover up to $250 of each recipient's scholarship.   This money will be presented to the student once they complete a concert or performance with us.  The money will be used to cover the students' financial expenses as they relate to his or her education.
If you can donate... every bit counts towards our goal to support the arts and revive this beautiful music!  As a token of gratitude, we will offer perks to our donors.  These perks include:

 Any donation over $25 will get you one complimentary ticket to our concert, with a FREE reception afterwards!  

Any donation over $50 automatically earns you a free ad space in our program.  You can use ad space to advertise your business or simply a place a friendly message to someone you are supporting!  Please contact downtowgleeclubnyc@gmail.com so we can help you list your ad. 

Any donation over $100 will automatically be listed for 2 tickets to our concert.  If you do need additional tickets, we are happy to accomodate.  Just contact us at downtowngleeclubnyc@gmail.com.
Free listing as a "Booster" for any donation amount given!

Any donation over $250 earns you special perks, such as free recordings of your favorite song as performed by the Glee Club, and even performances for your next party, featuring members of our Club (where applicable)!


Special thank you/birthday song videos featuring the Club! 

IMPORTANT NOTE:   To be included in the Winter program, you must donate and send the ad to downtowngleeclubnyc@gmail.com by December 8.  Otherwise, your ad will be placed in our next season's program.)

Let people know about this campaign via Facebook and other social media If you are a guy in NYC and you like to sing, come and join us as a singer!  Brothers in song!  Dues are waived for our newest singers.

story:
Short Summary

KATANA FLIGHT FOUNDATION  was founded in 2012, with the conviction that all children deserve the chance to fly. By offering that opportunity we can teach the lesson of unlimited possibility; enabling children to unlock the power to change their lives - and their world. 

KATANA teaches accountability and empowerment through flight, offering aerial acrobatics and circus arts education to underprivileged children. 

Your donation does more than support our school. Your contribution helps give children a chance at a better life, opening up their imaginations, inspiring their aspirations, and unlocking the joy and passion of flying together.

  • Aerial Acrobatics
  • Circus Arts
  • Public Performances
  • Free Classes for Kids
  • Donation-Based Classes for All Age
  • Local Community Projects
  • International Outreach
  • Global Program Development

www.katanaflightschoolnyc.com

www.katanaflightschoolinternational.com



What We Need & What You Get

We've been officially operating since 2013, and your previous support - as well as the continuous financial flow of support from our LLC Company, Urban Circus NYC, have kept the school alive, financing our current studio space, safety equipment, mats, insurance, and aerial apparatus. But in order to expand our reach and help more kids, we need your help.

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES:

  • SPACE - Although we are currently operating out of a loft in Bushwick to keep expenses as low as possible as we continue to build our program, we will be seeking a new building in 2016, where we can expand our impact and maximize the potential of KATANA NYC to be the Flagship School for the global Model. 
  • INTERNATIONAL OUTREACH - We have been developing our team and program in LEBANON since 2014, as well as putting down roots and building foundations in Malaysia, Cambodia, and BANGLADESH in 2015. We offer classes to children in need from street kids to refugees, completely free - your donation supports the opportunity to continue to serve countless young souls who's lives can be transformed by the experience of going upside down.
  • INSURANCE - Insurance Costs for Aerial Acrobatics are incredibly high - it costs thousands of dollars a year to maintain safe coverage for our students.
  • SUPPORT STAFF - our current instructors and performers pour their heart and soul into this company, but they have to eat! Finances raised will help support fair pay and salary for the staff who support the school, and who could not continue to do so without all of you. 
  • EQUIPMENT - additional funds will provide much needed equipment, including a new trapeze, mats, and rigging essentials to maintain and improve our existing system while upholding the highest standards of safety for our kids.



The Impact

By supporting our school, you are helping support the structure that empowers not only underprivileged children but also our creative community of Aerial Educators, Performers, and Producers - together, we can, and do, make a difference.

In order to reduce operating costs and maximize resources, our company creates a collaborative platform for our LLC and our Non-Profit (501(c)3) to share space, equipment, instructors, and infrastructure. By donating, you facilitate: 

  • INTERNATIONAL OUTREACH - Katana Aims to Work With Syrian refugees in Lebanon, child prostitutes in Cambodia, sweatshop victims in Bangladesh, and impoverished communities in Zimbabwe as well as building foundations in Papua New Guinea, French Guiana, and former Yugoslavia.
  • Free and Donation-Based Classes for both Children and Adults
  • Creative Choreography, Act Development, and Performance
  • Upper Level Arts Education that Sustains Industry Standards 
  • Full-length Theatrical Productions and Immersive Experiences
  • Cutting Edge Aerial Arts Performance, Production, and Education


Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face in entering the next phase of our development of a company is SUSTAINABLE SUPPORT. Every little bit helps - we need your one-time donations and dollars, but we also need the government grants, annual income, and sustainable infrastructure that will help our company stay balanced as we continue to grow.

Other Challenges include:

  • SPACE. We are outgrowing our current space, and although we have had a wonderful two years at the Urban Circus Loft, it is time to expand!
  • STAFF. We have an amazing staff of instructors and performers, but as we expand, we need more support in the administrative department - we will be in need of MARKETING, PR, ACCOUNTING, LAW, and REAL ESTATE for 2015
  • SUPPORT. No matter how well we do as a company, we always need the support of our audiences, our peers, our public, and our community!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to make a financial donation, we are ALWAYS seeking the following: 

  • SHARE! Spread this Campaign to your friends and family - as well as passing along the websites for further information!
  • GRANTWRITERS. It can take countless hours - and even YEARS of work - to qualify for the support we will need to succeed; email thecircustentialist@gmail.com to join our team.
  • VIDEOGRAPHERS, Photographers, and editors for documentation
  • TECHNICIANS - Lighting, Sound, and Stage for our Shows!
  • INSTRUCTORS - We are always accepting application for QUALIFIED and insured instructors in the fields of Aerial Arts, Acrobatics, Gymnastics, Martial Arts, Theatre, or Dance
  • VOLUNTEERS - although most of our volunteers are part of our work-study program, we can always use qualified help with the studio and the school!
THANK YOU ALL for your past, present, and future support. Together, we can help build a better world - with and for the children.
SPECIAL THANKS to all of you who have supported this project and this vision from the beginning, and as it grew - and to those all over the world who will make the global vision come to fruition.
Dedicated to Katana, Who Lives on through This Vision;
And To All Mothers Everywhere, WIthout Whom None of This Would Be Possible.

story:
Who we are

One World Project (OWP) is a nonprofit organization based in Brooklyn, New York. We run a unique one-of-a-kind preschool and after school programs that integrate Spanish language immersion, play-based pedagogy, and positive discipline techniques. Our curriculum is designed to encourage children to become global citizens and stewards of the environment.

We believe that children are powerful teachers and the key to creating change. Our teaching philosophy fosters understanding, openness and empathy towards different cultures and people to cultivate healthy families and communities. We teach children about sustainability and how to take better care of our planet, and we help them develop their natural curiosity and interest in the world around them.

OWP also believes in being a committed, active member of the community it serves. We offer programs that build on our principles to strengthen and support all families in our community.

In 2014, we became a part-time Universal Pre-Kindergarten site with the Department of Education as part of New York City’s expansion of preschool - this has put us on the path to achieve our vision of making our programs accessible to all New Yorkers regardless of socio-economic background.

What we are trying to do

OWP started in 2012 in Windsor Terrace with just eight students aged between two and five. Today, we serve over 56 students in four programs and a growing waitlist. We have completely outgrown the small commercial space that we have been renting over the last 2 years, where we were limited to just two classrooms with no dedicated space for events or community programs.  

After spending more than a year looking for a bigger space to meet our needs, we finally found one that would allow us to add classrooms, conduct our after-school programs and hold regular community events such as adult language classes, film screenings and art shows.

What we need

We have had to invest a significant sum to do basic renovations to get the space ready. Unfortunately, this amount falls short of what we need to make the space fully functional. So far, we have converted bathrooms to preschool specifications, changed damaged ceiling tiles, expanded classrooms and upgraded the kitchen.  We need additional funds to renovate the outdoor space, add a bathroom, repair the front entrance, and add a handicap lift.

This is estimated to cost $50,000.

Outdoor space renovations = $5,000

Handicap Lift = $22,000

Front Entrance = $8,000

Bathroom Addition = $15,000

How you can help

Please consider supporting our campaign! Whether $5, $20 or $1000, every little bit helps and lets us know that you believe in our efforts. We also hope you will help us get the word out - share our campaign as widely as you can across your social networks both online and offline.

Help us make our One World Project home a welcoming space for all New Yorkers!

story:
Let's Illuminate Chicago's TIFs!

The TIF Illumination Project is a work of the CivicLab, America's only co-working space dedicated to collaboration, education and innovation for social justice and civic engagement. Watch this one minute video introducing us.

Tax Increment Financing districts (TIFs) are a BIG deal in Chicago and across the USA. They take YOUR property tax dollars FROM the units of local government that rely on property taxes for operation (public schools, public libraries, public park, basic municipal services) and deliver those dollars to private developers with virtually no public discussion or recourse.

We want to raise $2,000 in order to produce a 20 minute video that continues the story we started with our first TIF video, "TIF 101." Watch it here...



"The Resident Association of Greater Englewood, also known as R.A.G.E., has been work diligently to unwrap and understand the impact TIF districts has on our community, specifically the Englewood Neighborhood TIF.  Although many of our members are knowledgeable, there is still a vast majority of residents who simply do not get it....Our thanks to the TIF Illumination Project who presented us with their analysis of the this TIF. We appreciate the "TIF 101" video, as well.The video is a great visual tool we can use to help educate residents in Englewood of how TIFs currently work and how it's supposed to work.  We hope to use this video as a learning tool as we launch our public awareness campaign around the Englewood Neighborhood TIF." - Asiaha Butler, President, R.A.G.E.

NOW - We want to produce "The TIF Hall of Shame."

You won't believe who we've showered hundreds of millions of property tax dollars in Chicago. Mega corporations, billionaire developers, corrupt operators, companies that have fled the city, and much more.

This second video will explore the ways that Chicago's TIF program has gone off the rails. We'll take you all around the city and visit sites that have received TIF dollars and continue to talk to experts and organizers who know this subject very well.

The simple URL for this campaign = http://tinyurl.com/TIF-crowdfunding-2

The TIF Illumination Project has been using data mining, investigatory journalism, map making, graphic design and community organizing to explore and explain the impacts of Chicago's 151 Tax Increment Financing (TIF) districts. We do this on a ward-by-ward basis.

When we visit a ward - as we do in a public town forum we call an "Illumination" - we reveal:

  • an overview of TIFs in Chicago and Cook County
  • how many TIFs are in the ward
  • how much property taxes those TIFs took FROM that ward
  • how much money was left over in TIF accounts from the ward
  • what projects were funded by TIFs
  • if any money was transferred in or out of those TIFs
  • how much money the Chicago Department of Planning and Development skimmed to cover their own internal costs

We do a one hour presentation that explains all this and we pass out a map that summarizes this information. Here is one we did for the 21st ward:

No one else can tell this story in the level of detail and clarity that we provide. 

Sine we launched this effort in February of 2013 we have been invited all over the city to make these presentations. As of January 9, 2015 we have done 27 public meetings that have Illuminated 134 TIF districts across 30 wards in front of over 4,000 people! You can see the full record of these presentations here.

Public education is critical to exposing and opposing the massive abuses we've seen in the TIF program. We are producing five short videos and post them online so anyone can watch and learn.

Here are the five videos we wish to produce:

(1) TIF 101 - What are TIFs, how do they work and what is their history in Illinois, Cook County and Chicago. Already done!

(2) The TIF Hall of Shame - see above

(3) TIFs and Public Schools - Every dollar of property taxes that goes missing from the treasury is one less dollar to fund local government. In Illinois we rely heavily on property taxes to fund public education. In Chicago we are supposed to direct about 56 cents of every dollar in property taxes collected to fund the Board of Education. That is not happened because of TIFs. We'll break it down in detail in this video.

(4) TIF Organizing - As of the launch of this campaign we've been in 16 wards for TIF Illuminations and so we've met dozens of neighbors who are organizing around TIFs. Who are they and what did they learn from the TIF Illumination Process and what are doing now? 

(5) Alternatives To TIFS: Grassroots Community Development Innovation - Chicago is a hotbed of innovation in hyper local community development efforts. The problem is most of this work is not recognized or seriously funded. We'll meet some key local organizers who are really making a difference in their communities. Their work shows us clear and compelling alternatives to the TIF Program.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $2,000 to produce each video. The videos will be free to watch online and we will sell DVDs of them that will contain spreadsheets and other material we use in our work, including a PDF of a "TIF Primer."

The production team consists of Tom Tresser, the co-founder of the CivicLab and the Lead Organizer of the TIF Illumination Project. Tom was the co-organizer of the No Games Chicago campaign which worked to defeat Chicago's bid for the 2016 Olympics. He was the Green Party candidate for Cook County Board President in 2010. He teaches classes on civics, leadership and public policy at four local universities. He was recently named a Purpose Prize Fellow by the Encore Foundation.

The video team is Ed Pitts and John Sheehan of The TIF Illumination Project (http://www.tifreports.com) is seeking to raise $2,000 per video to produce five 20 minute videos to cover the subject of Tax Increment Financing in Chicago. This video was produced by Ed Pitts and John Sheehan of Absolute Video Services. John is a grassroots videographer who documents protest and social change organizing all over the city his Video Catalyst Project at YouTube has racked up over 6 million views!

Part of the money we raise will go to the videographers and part will go to the CivicLab to pay our operating bills and provide technical support for the TIF Illumination Project and it's web sites.

The Impact

TIFs are a BIG deal in Chicago. We have 151 TIF districts and in 2013 they extracted $422 million in property taxes from Chicago property owners. Since TIFs were first started here in 1986 they have made off with over $6 BILLION. What happened to all that money? The TIF Illumination Project is answering that question.

Our work has Illuminated hitherto-fore unknown details of city financing and insider deals and has done so in way that educates and activates people all over the city!

We've been to 24 public meetings, many of them focusing on one particular ward. Each meeting has been organized by a different team of community members. Over 3,600 people have attended these meetings. Here a few images from these Illuminations. The full record of all these meetings is here.

Not to brag, but over 50 stories have been written about this work over the past 15 months, including being featured in a cover story article for The Nation, "Chicago Rising!"

We demanded that TIF impacts be placed on our property tax bills - along with the other units of government that take our property taxes. Believe it or not, up to this July - if you lived in a TIF district your property tax bill was LYING to you by putting a ZERO ext to the TIF district - meaning that it took none of your property tax dollars. In July of 2014, for the first time, Cook County Clerk David Orr added this information to over 220,000 property tax bills in Cook County! We can take some credit for this long overdue reform.

Now, due to the work of the TIF Illumination Project, TIFs are popping up in local races for City Council here. This is a huge issue for Chicago and we're keeping it in the spotlight!

TIFs are a BIG deal throughout Illinois and the USA. In Illinois some 1,200 TIF districts strip about $1.1 BILLION in property taxes from 550 municipalities every year. Since TIFs came to Illinois they have made off with $14 BILLION. What happened to all that money. All that public money. Every single dollar was a dollar of property tax that SHOULD'VE gone to fund local government.

We have no idea how many TIF districts there across the entire USA. We estimate that they collect on the order of $20 BILLION every year. That's a pretty big slush fund that is mostly off the books, opaque and unaccountable to local tax payers.

Eventually we want to expand this project to communities across the country where they are burdened with TIF districts. We are working with civic coders to build a web tool that will allow organizations to create their local versions of the TIF Illumination Project. You can see the alpha version of it here.

Ways You Can Help

Please consider making an investment in the TIF Illumination Project. Everything we've done so far has been volunteer powered. We now need to ramp up this work and hire some folks to make this work scalable, accessible and easy to use. This series of videos will help us start the next level of this work.

You can get further details about the project and the five videos we are seeking to make at our home site at www.tifreports.com.

Please help spread the word by using your own social media networks and telling your friends and colleagues about what we are trying to do.

Email us at info@civiclab.us.

Let's get Illuminated!

this video as a learning tool as we launch our public awareness campaign
 around the Englewood Neighborhood TIF." - Asiaha Butler, President, R.A.G.E.NOW - We want to produce "The TIF Hall of Shame." You won't believe who we've showered hundreds of millions of property tax
dollars in Chicago. Mega corporations, billionaire developers, corrupt
operators, companies that have fled the city, and much more.This second video will explore the ways that Chicago's TIF program has gone off the rails. We'll take you all around the city and visit sites that have received TIF dollars and continue to talk to experts and organizers who know this subject very well.The simple URL for this campaign =

http://tinyurl.com/TIF-crowdfunding-2 
The TIF Illumination Project has
been using data mining, investigatory journalism, map making, graphic design
and community organizing to explore and explain the impacts of Chicago's 151
Tax Increment Financing (TIF) districts. We do this on a ward-by-ward basis. 
When we visit a ward - as we do in a public town forum we
call an "Illumination" - we reveal:

an overview of TIFs in Chicago and Cook County
how many TIFs are in the ward
how much property taxes those TIFs took FROM that ward
how much money was left over in TIF accounts from the
     ward
what projects were funded by TIFs
if any money was transferred in or out of those TIFs
how much money the Chicago Department of Planning and
     Development skimmed to cover their own internal costs

We do a one hour presentation that
explains all this and we pass out a map that summarizes this information. Here
is one we did for the 21st ward:No one else can tell this story in
the level of detail and clarity that we provide. 

Sine we launched this effort in
February of 2013 we have been invited all over the city to make these
presentations. As of January 9, 2015 we have done 27 public meetings that have
Illuminated 134 TIF districts across 30 wards in front of over 4,000 people! You
can see the full record of these presentations here.Public education is critical to
exposing and opposing the massive abuses we've seen in the TIF program. We are producing five short videos and post them online so anyone can watch and
learn.

Here are the five videos we wish to
produce:
(1) TIF 101 - What are TIFs,
how do they work and what is their history in Illinois, Cook County and
Chicago. Already done!
(2) The TIF Hall of Shame - see above
(3) TIFs and Public Schools -
Every dollar of property taxes that goes missing from the treasury is one less
dollar to fund local government. In Illinois we rely heavily on property taxes
to fund public education. In Chicago we are supposed to direct about 56 cents
of every dollar in property taxes collected to fund the Board of Education.
That is not happened because of TIFs. We'll break it down in detail in this
video.
(4) TIF Organizing - As of
the launch of this campaign we've been in 16 wards for TIF Illuminations and so
we've met dozens of neighbors who are organizing around TIFs. Who are they and
what did they learn from the TIF Illumination Process and what are doing
now? 
(5) Alternatives To TIFS:
Grassroots Community Development Innovation - Chicago is a hotbed of
innovation in hyper local community development efforts. The problem is most of
this work is not recognized or seriously funded. We'll meet some key local
organizers who are really making a difference in their communities. Their work
shows us clear and compelling alternatives to the TIF Program.
What
We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $2,000 to produce each
video. The videos will be free to watch online and we will sell DVDs of them
that will contain spreadsheets and other material we use in our work, including
a PDF of a "TIF Primer."

The production team consists of Tom
Tresser, the co-founder of the CivicLab and the Lead
Organizer of the TIF Illumination Project. Tom was the co-organizer of the No
Games Chicago campaign which worked to defeat Chicago's bid for the
2016 Olympics. He was the Green Party candidate for Cook County Board President
in 2010. He teaches classes on civics, leadership and public
policy at four local universities. He was recently named a Purpose Prize Fellow by the Encore Foundation.
The video team is Ed Pitts and John Sheehan of The TIF
Illumination Project (http://www.tifreports.com) is seeking to raise
$2,000 per video to produce five 20 minute videos to cover the subject of Tax Increment
Financing in Chicago. This video was produced by Ed Pitts and John Sheehan of Absolute Video Services. John is a grassroots
videographer who documents protest and social change organizing all over the
city his Video Catalyst Project at
YouTube has racked up over 6 million views!

Part of the money we raise will go to the videographers and part will go to the
CivicLab to pay our operating bills and provide technical support for the TIF
Illumination Project and it's web sites.
The
Impact
TIFs are a BIG deal in Chicago. We
have 151 TIF districts and in 2013 they extracted $422 million in property
taxes from Chicago property owners. Since TIFs were first started here in 1986
they have made off with over $6 BILLION. What happened to all that money? The
TIF Illumination Project is answering that question.

Our work has Illuminated
hitherto-fore unknown details of city financing and insider deals and has done
so in way that educates and activates people all over the city!
We've been to 24 public meetings,
many of them focusing on one particular ward. Each meeting has been organized
by a different team of community members. Over 3,600 people have attended these
meetings. Here a few images from these Illuminations. The full record of all
these meetings is here.



Not to brag, but over 50
stories have been written about this work over the past 15 months,
including being featured in a cover story article for The Nation, "Chicago Rising!"

We demanded that TIF impacts be placed on our property tax bills - along with
the other units of government that take our property taxes. Believe it or not,
up to this July - if you lived in a TIF district your property tax bill was
LYING to you by putting a ZERO ext to the TIF district - meaning that it took
none of your property tax dollars. In July of 2014, for the first time, Cook County Clerk David Orr added this
information to over 220,000 property tax bills in Cook County! We
can take some credit for this long overdue reform.

Now, due to the work of the TIF Illumination Project, TIFs are popping up in
local races for City Council here. This is a huge issue for Chicago and we're
keeping it in the spotlight!

TIFs are a BIG deal throughout Illinois and the USA. In Illinois some 1,200 TIF
districts strip about $1.1 BILLION in property taxes from 550 municipalities
every year. Since TIFs came to Illinois they have made off with $14 BILLION.
What happened to all that money. All that public money. Every single dollar was
a dollar of property tax that SHOULD'VE gone to fund local government.

We have no idea how many TIF districts there across the entire USA. We estimate
that they collect on the order of $20 BILLION every year. That's a pretty big
slush fund that is mostly off the books, opaque and unaccountable to local tax
payers.

Eventually we want to expand this project to communities across the country
where they are burdened with TIF districts. We are working with civic coders to
build a web tool that will allow organizations to create their local versions
of the TIF Illumination Project. You can see the alpha version of it here.

Ways
You Can Help
Please consider making an investment
in the TIF Illumination Project. Everything we've done so far has been
volunteer powered. We now need to ramp up this work and hire some folks to make
this work scalable, accessible and easy to use. This series of videos will help
us start the next level of this work.
You can get further details about the project and the five
videos we are seeking to make at our home site at www.tifreports.com.


Please help spread the word by using your own social media networks and telling
your friends and colleagues about what we are trying to do. 

Email us at info@civiclab.us.

Let's get Illuminated!

story:
THE BLASPHEMY LAW PROJECT

Engage is a nonprofit  research and advocacy organization working on Pakistan’s blasphemy law. The mass support for this narrative makes it  a potent legal instrument for intimidation, violence and enacting personal vendettas, and specific persecution of minorities.  We are attempting to deconstruct the law and its surrounding social narrative through the framework that informs it--the first attempt of its kind. Please take the time to go through the rest of our profile and the introductory video above which summarizes the problem and how we propose to address it.

The Law

The law (section 295-C of Pakistan Penal Code) holds that anyone convicted of the offense of blasphemy against the prophet Muhammad is to be awarded a fixed death penalty, with no possibility of a pardon or waiver.

            1. Impact of the Problem

Mobs rampaged through the Joseph Colony neighbourhood of Lahore in March last year after blasphemy allegations against Sawan Masih emerged. —AFP

1.1. Exponential Increase in Blasphemy Accusations


Angry Pakistani demonstrators torch Christian's belongings during a protest over a blasphemy row in a Christian. 

1.2. The Impact: Increase in Accusations by 17,500%

Since the introduction of the more stringent form of the law, blasphemy accusations increased by around 17500 %. This staggering increase in the number of individuals accused of the offence shows that the law has been used as a tool of persecution and oppression. People did not simply become dramatically more 'blasphemous'. Rather, these numbers show that the blasphemy law has been understood to be a viable legal means to target groups and individuals, and has been used as such.

Alleged blasphemy: Mob burns scores of Christian homes in Lahore – The Express Tribune

1.3. The Impact: Increase in Vigilante Violence by 2750%

  The social narrative attached to the perception of blasphemy, and perpetuated by the law, has resulted in an increase in extra-judicial or vigilante killings, by 2750%.  


Couple Beaten, Burned By Mob For Alleged Blasphemy

1.4. The Impact:  Persecution of Religious Minorities

Disproportionate number of cases registered particularly against religious minorities, that represent a small percentage of the total population, fostering a climate of extreme religious intolerance in the region.


2. Defining the Problem

2.1. Perception of the Law as Divine

The law has gathered mass support through its conceptualization as a divine decree that cannot be tampered with. The strength of this law is rooted in this conviction as well as the perpetual promotion of this idea through legal and socio-political institutions of religious authority.

3. Solving the Problem

4. Why us?

4.1. Why previous attempt at reform have failed

4.2. How are we different?


   5. What are you funding?    

Fatwa Drive

Local: Going to every major Madrassah (Seminary) and collecting Fatwas (Legal Opinion) and traditional texts that state the authentic Hanafi stance and echo our findings. This includes community-level dissemination of these fatwas to prayer leaders of local mosques.

International:  A similar fatwa collection campaign from authoritative fatwa-issuing institutions around the world.

Workshops

De-radicalization workshops in major colleges and universities by traditional ulama (clerics) over the first 6 months.

Workshops with other non-profit organizations and activist groups highlighting the need to engage through culturally relevant frameworks.

Legal Handbook

Improving quality of legal counsel available to those charged under the blasphemy law by publishing a legal guidebook for advocates defending them. 

Library

Establishing a comprehensive library of modern and classical texts that further clarifies and solidifies the intellectual foundations of our narrative. Commission translation of these works from Arabic to Urdu.

Establishing Research Wing:

Ongoing research into the historical and political context of the law for developing informed strategies for countering radical narratives through a team of dedicated and qualified research personnel.

Regularly publishing research geared towards academic circles, to stimulate further independent inquiry into the subject.

To frame and present research for the layperson via well regarded local as well as international media.

                 6. WHO ARE WE?

Our core team consists of religious academics, lawyers, a psychologist and development sector professionals. Through our advisory panel, we have access to a diverse network of resources, from orthodox ulama from across Pakistan to progressive scholars and academics around the globe. 

7. WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?

  • Groundbreaking research that uncovers factual inaccuracies in the foundation of the law
  • Research presented at:
  • "IAS-LUMS Conference - New Horizons in Islamic Area Studies: Encounters, Reflections & Collaborations" - Lahore, Pakistan, Organized by NIHU Program for Islamic Area Studies, Waseda University. November 2nd-4th, 2013
  • "Freedom of religion and expression in the Islamic tradition" - Istanbul, Turkey organized by Oslo Coalition on Freedom of Religion or Belief, University of Oslo. August 22nd-24th, 2014
  • Research being published by Norwegian Center for Human Rights 
  • An ongoing five part series "The Untold Story of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law" published by a leading news daily (Dawn.com).
  • The Untold Story of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law
  • The fatwa that can change Pakistan's blasphemy narrative
  • The Politics of Pakistan's Blasphemy Law
  • Work commended by Nicholas Kristoff in New York Times
  • Our team advised Justice Project Pakistan (a non profit organization)  on a Supreme Court blasphemy case.

8. Long Term Vision

  • Creating space for dialogue and debate, strategically engaging all stakeholders working towards a society where the minority segment are not systemically targeted using Legal Devices or Religious Instruments.
  • Countering the increasingly radical impact of “Otherising” narratives.
  • Limiting the influence of attempts to encroach upon the values of an integrated society through Research, Dialogue and Reform. 
For queries please contact arafat@engagepakistan.com

story:
Onondaga Historical Association (OHA) is more than a museum filled with artifacts. OHA preserves our community's memories, traditions, and stories and uses them to add value our neighborhoods, towns, and cities. Whether you're taking a stroll down the Onondaga Creekwalk, reading the Post Standard, or enjoying an event at the Onondaga County War Memorial OHA is there adding context and perspective. 

OHA also works with educational institutions throughout our region to support children's understanding of the world around us and how our history can teach us valuable lessons for our future together. Central New York Regional History Day has grown, encompassing schools from around Onondaga County. This past year, 200 students submitted projects, papers, exhibits, and presentations on the topic of Leadership and Legacy in History, our best turnout yet for this event with more and more students submitting every year.

Finally, our community "Ghost Walks," featuring characters from individual neighborhoods past, continues to be one of our most popular events. Each fall, OHA works with a town in Onondaga County and creates a historic Ghost Walk based on individuals who lived there, teaching those who may not know the important or historic people who once called their neighborhood home. 

All of this comes down to one thing - creating pride in place. 

In order for us to continue our efforts using history to support our community's growth, we're asking for your help. 

Every dollar goes to creating educational programming, exhibits (at our museums and around Onondaga County), publications, and, most importantly, preserving the items that help tell the stories we share with all of you. 

Remember, companies match donations made by employees to a wide range of nonprofits. Be sure to ask your company how to get your donation doubled. Click here to find out if your company will match your contribution.

story:
I'm going to India to study yoga. Will you be a part of my story by helping to fund my dream?

Yoga has great potential to help many people. I am planning a trip to the source where yoga practice originated, so that I may learn a deeper approach to yoga and bring back a wealth of new knowledge to my community.

There is so much more to yoga than the physical. The purpose of my trip is to study yoga therapy, which goes beyond the physical practice that is common in studios. In yoga therapy, I will be able to work with individuals suffering from health problems or physical ailments to manage stress and make healthy lifestyle changes. This can include physical sequences tailored to the individual, manual adjustments or gentle bodywork, guided meditation, and emotional counseling during practice. Read on to discover my vision that I hope to fully manifest with your support!

I plan to arrive in India by late February 2015, in time to witness Holi in March. Holi is a playful festival in which people throw colored powders on one another, celebrating the mischievous aspects of the loving deity Krishna. I am excited to be able to witness this unique cultural event and hope to share some amazing photos.

I am enrolled to study yoga therapy at Paramanand Institute in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. My course begins March 2, 2015. Paramanand is a member school of the International Association of Yoga Therapy, and also offers certificates in naturopathy, Ayurveda (Indian healing), and conscious awakening techniques. If enough funding is raised, I would love to continue my studies into some of these areas. These skills can help many people, but there are course fees to consider. That is why your help is so important!

I may also have opportunities to do some exploring, hiking, and backpacking with a friend who will be joining me after completing my studies. This will be a great opportunity to hone my new skills and share them with people across a few different countries before I bring it all back home. I will be quitting my job and taking a leap of faith in order to fulfill this vision. Your support and belief in me means so much in addition to helping me actualize this dream. Thank you!

Your contributions will help cover airfare, travel expenses, tuition, accommodations during my training, and necessary supplies. Just to give an idea as to how I have set my fundraising goal, the tuition for the yoga therapy training will cost $1900, and the additional courses I mentioned start at $760 each. There are some additional fees for accommodations and of course there is also airfare. The course prices are amazing compared to studying in the US, so I hope to take advantage of them while I am there. It is really up to you, my supporters, to help bring it all in!

My ultimate dream is to nurture this practice during graduate school for art therapy, and to integrate all of my skills into a mindfulness-based practice with a lighthearted and playful approach to holistic healing. If this is something that you wish to see happen for the world, then please consider contributing.  Many thanks and blessings!

The light in me honors the light in you. Namaste.

Some links to learn more about my plans:

IAYT Yoga Therapy Definition

Param Yoga Institute of Yoga Sciences & Research

Yoga Therapy Teacher Training Course

Holi Festival

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We're ShadowMe Inc. and we're law students working on a project called ShadowMe. ShadowMe is meant to help those who never discovered their passion. There are so many people, especially teenagers, who will never know about different professions in this world that they would excel in. ShadowMe will change that! ShadowMe will help those in all communities and walks of life discover paths they may not have ever known were even a possibility for them. People will now be able to discover their passion and see others who have done the same. Most of all, we want to help children/teenagers in underprivileged neighborhoods realize that they have other options other than what they see around them. We want to create a world where people can envision themselves doing what they love and seeing what it takes to get there. ShadowMe will begin that process. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the money will all go towards development and marketing for ShadowMe. It will increase awareness and begin placing the technology needed to get ShadowMe to market while also keeping the cost for all users free. If we do not reach our entire goal, the money will still go towards development as much as possible to pay those who are working hard behind the scenes to get this project off the ground.

 

The Impact

If you contribute to this project, you will be helping people around the world discover their passion and happiness. You will help children, teens and adults realize that they have other options in this life and they can decide their path. Help save money for kids in college that keep switching majors because they're terribly confused and unhappy with the path they've chosen.  But ShadowMe can also help you as well if you think that you have never discovered your passion either!

 

Risks & Challenges

There's not too many risks for this project besides making sure that we are able to reach our targeted audience. We also have to be sure that we have legitimate professionals helping to guide those that use our site. But we have a plan for that! We will make sure we have a system that verifies each one of the professionals that apply. We will also make sure that we keep the cost down on this project so that everyone who uses it will still be able to use it, no matter how successful it becomes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then please help spread the word about this campaign so that people can help donate. It would be extremely helpful and we would be so grateful. Those who you are helping through this app will be grateful as well! You can also offer your help as one of the professionals to be featured! Please contact us if you want/need more information.

 

Thanks so much everyone!

People will now be able to discover their passion and see others who have done the same. Most of all, we want to help children/teenagers in underprivileged neighborhoods realize that they have other options other than what they see around them. We want to create a world where people can envision themselves doing what they love and seeing what it takes to get there. ShadowMe will begin that process. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
All of the money will all go towards development and marketing for ShadowMe. It will increase awareness and begin placing the technology needed to get ShadowMe to market while also keeping the cost for all users free. If we do not reach our entire goal, the money will still go towards development as much as possible to pay those who are working hard behind the scenes to get this project off the ground.
 

The Impact
If you contribute to this project, you will be helping people around the world discover their passion and happiness. You will help children, teens and adults realize that they have other options in this life and they can decide their path. Help save money for kids in college that keep switching majors because they're terribly confused and unhappy with the path they've chosen.  But ShadowMe can also help you as well if you think that you have never discovered your passion either!
 

Risks & Challenges
There's not too many risks for this project besides making sure that we are able to reach our targeted audience. We also have to be sure that we have legitimate professionals helping to guide those that use our site. But we have a plan for that! We will make sure we have a system that verifies each one of the professionals that apply. We will also make sure that we keep the cost down on this project so that everyone who uses it will still be able to use it, no matter how successful it becomes.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, then please help spread the word about this campaign so that people can help donate. It would be extremely helpful and we would be so grateful. Those who you are helping through this app will be grateful as well! You can also offer your help as one of the professionals to be featured! Please contact us if you want/need more information.
 
Thanks so much everyone!

story:
All About Robots sets – setting new standards in STEM education

 

 

Knowledge in luxury packaging

A booklet, packed with large, colorful illustrations for the easy understanding of the principles of physics, electronics and robotics and a refined selection of electronic components, which instantly allows you to make what you’ve learned about.

 

 

 

Completely new approach to STEM learning

  • Refined selection of electronics components – carefully selected electronic components that are ideal for learning and building. You’ll find only these components in the boxes.
  • Booklet contents – large, colorful illustrations that explain everything at a glance, making for faster learning for everybody. We believe illustrated books are the future in STEM, for both kids and adults.
  • Not a second wasted – Every component in the box has its name written next to it, so as you play, whether you’re taking out a part or putting it back, you’re learning the components’ names. Every second is put to good use!
  • Look/Understand/Remember – Look at the illustrations / Understand them in a second / Anything you understand you’ll be able to remember.
  • Hands-on experience – Once you understand, build!
  • Parts arranged in the box – All the parts are fitted into slots and compartments inside the box. Everything is easy to take out and put back – so zero mess after playing!
  • Chronology of experimenting – Every experiment is numbered: No. 0 Magic Light, No. 1 Timer, etc. so you always know what comes next. Each successive experiment increases the user’s knowledge.
  • Packaging – The beautiful, sturdy box guarantees its contents will survive for many years. The magnetic flap prevents the lid from getting torn and makes the box always easy to open.
 

 

All About Robots kits bring you the joy of discovering and learning in a contemporary way. They inspire teamwork, socializing and friendship.

All About Robots provides a way to understand what’s happening in the world of robotics in the 21st century.

You usually get a closed box with a limited scope of activities – we give you the chance to open the box, to see and to understand technology.

We believe that in the 21st century understanding robotics and electronics is as important as literacy. However, children who want to learn about robotics do not have access to adequate material. When the material contains useful knowledge, it is usually just presented with a bog-standard ‘letters on paper’ approach, which is a turnoff for both adults and children. Other materials that are adapted for kids explain trivial things, but not the specific challenges that all those who want to learn about robotics face. We need a more effective way of explaining and presenting phenomena from the fields of physics, electronics and robotics so that everyone can learn quickly and easily. All About Robots gives everyone the chance to learn about and understand electronics and robotics.

Magic Lights Kit – For anyone completely new to the world of robotics and electronics who doesn’t plan to delve too deeply into it. This set is the easiest and most wonderful way to carry out some fun electronic experiments with LED lights and to learn the basics. Buy it now!
Light Pack – For beginners interested in electronics but without any experience in the field. It is a 3-in-1 box: the Magic Light, Timer, and Blinking kits. This set will also help you understand the basic electronic components and learn enough to be able to use the Sound Pack, Sensor Pack, Motor Pack or Game Pack. Buy it now!
Sound Pack – For all those who have worked through the Light Pack and want to continue experimenting with sound. Buy it now!
Sensor Pack – For all those who have worked through the Light Pack and want to continue experimenting with temperature and light sensors and with infrared lights. Buy it now!
Motor Pack – For all those who have worked through the Light Pack and want to continue experimenting with DC motors. Buy it now!
Game Pack – For all those who have worked through the Light Pack and want to make fun electronic games. Buy it now!
All the sets – For anyone who wants to leap into the world of robotics. This is a great chance to learn everything you need to know about electronics and to prepare yourself for the field of robotics.
Custom perks. Would you like to choose your own combination of sets? We will prepare perk just for you! Send us your wish by e-mail and we will prepare offer that's fits you!

Your language is available:

All materials and instruction booklets are in English at the start of the campaign. When 10 or more perks have been sold in a country, we’ll provide an instruction booklet in the local language.
For example: When we’ve sold 10 perks in Spain, we’ll translate the instruction booklet into Spanish and send it to our Spanish backers.
We’ll update this list when a new language becomes available.
Available languages at present:
- English
- Serbian (update 23.11.18.)

If we reach 5.000USD we will provide next set series: Integrated circuits
If we reach 10.000USD we will provide next set series: Programing microcontrolers
If we reach 15.000USD we will provide next set series: Mechanical robotic parts
If we reach 20.000USD we will provide next set series: Robotics
If we reach 50.000USD we will provide next set series: Flying robotics
If we reach 100.000USD we will provide next set series: Underwater robotics

Share All About Robots with your friends!
Please use share options on the beginning of the page, next to the video. Spread the world!

Thank you!
All About Robots Team

 

Some of our activities:

story:
SPONSOR A CLASSROOM IN YOUR COMMUNITY!

One thing that all of us have in common is the fact that we all went to school at some point of our life. Learning math, science, and many other topics has always been the foundation of education and we are grateful for the skills and knowledge that we have learned.

But what if we had a stronger FOCUS on learning how to be a great human being and the best version of ourselves?

What would happen if schools across the nation provided classes on how to be a better person, how to care for others, love one another, be honest not only with others but with yourself as well? 

Imagine if schools provided lessons on kindness, honesty, perseverance, social and emotional skills, responsibility towards, and how to be more empathetic!

For the past 7 years, S.T.O.R.M. has been on a mission to inspire people to be role models at home, school, work, and local community.

2017 school tour - Over 100 schools - 100,000 students!

The experience was extremely effective and we are thankful for the opportunity to be able to spread positivity and love across our nation but we want to do more and need YOUR HELP!

This year, our goal is to inspire and educate students in every city

and work with schools all over the world!

 

BUT HOW DOES IT WORK?

 

A classroom or school of your choice will receive a STORM Role Model Box that will include everything necessary to successfully run a week long program. Teachers and students will begin by watching an inspirational introductory welcome video that will explain the program and the journey.

Starting on day 1, students will begin the process and be guided through a video lesson experience and then be asked to complete a daily "mission" on that topic before they move on to the next assignment!

At the end of the week, students will have an opportunity to graduate from the course and earn a certificate of graduation and a role model wrist band, welcoming them to a worldwide community of positive role models.

The joy of building a community of role models!

- FAQ -

How long has STORM been working with schools and local communities?

We have been working with schools for over 7 years

 

Can I decide what city and school will receive the program?

Yes! We encourage you to pick a city that is dear to your heart.

 

Can I select a school where the program

Yes! Almost every sponsor selects a school that they would like to sponsor.

 

How do I make sure that the school I choose gets the program

The delivery will be shipped directly to you and you can take it to the school that you choose or we can mail it to the school that you provide.

 

What happens after I donate?

You package will be prepped for shipping and delivery and go in the mail at the beginning of August for the 2018-2019 school year.

 

Can this program be offered in different languages?

Yes! Our program is offered in English, Spanish, and Sign Language.

 

Is there an additional program available?

Yes! We have year long programs available to schools or individuals that are interested in continued coaching and education

story:
Nuestra Historia         

El Centro Comunitario Yira Castro es una organización social sin ánimo de lucro, de naturaleza comunitaria tanto en su conformación como en su acción, que ha venido trabajando de manera ininterrumpida desde hace más de 36 años con la comunidad.

A través de nuestros programas de desarrollo promovemos el aprovechamiento del tiempo libre en espacios alternativos de formación integral. 

Nuestros Programas

Generamos espacios de encuentro, participación y formación de personas bajo una perspectiva de desarrollo humano y en la transformación del estado actual en el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida individual y social. 

  • Mujer y Familia 
  • Artístico Cultural
  • Convivencia y Ciudadanía 
  • Biblioteca Comunitaria 

 

¿Que buscamos con nuestra campaña?

Buscamos garantizar recursos para la continuidad del trabajo comunitario que hemos realizado en nuestra comunidad por muchos años, este se ha sostenido gracias a la semilla que personas como tu han depositado para  aportar en la formación integral de muchos niños, niñas, adolescentes y mujeres. 

Con tu aporte podremos sostener nuestros cuatro programas y atender las problemáticas sociales que afectan nuestro sector.

¿Como lograr el objetivo de nuestra campaña?

Necesitamos recaudar 7000 USD, recursos con los que iniciaremos el trabajo del año 2018.

El Impacto de tu aporte 

  • El Programa de Biblioteca Comunitaria, inicia Jornadas Educativas Complementarias, con niños y niñas de tercero de primaria que presentan déficit de aprendizaje, este programa permite estimular el aprendizaje a través de la ludica. 
  • El Programa de Convivencia y Ciudadanía, realizara su trabajo en los grupos infantil y adolescente. Promoviendo valores que faciliten la convivencia y las relaciones pacificas, transformando positivamente sus realidades. 
  • El Programa de Mujer y Familia, continuara promoviendo el empoderamiento de la mujer para que incida en la transformación de sus espacios, ademas posibilitar el almuerzo de muchas familias de bajos recursos económicos del Distrito de Aguablanca en Cali Colombia. 
  • El Programa Artístico Cultural, convocará a los niños y niñas para aprovechar su tiempo libre en actividades artísticas y culturales que les permita desarrollar sus habilidades, talentos y potencialidades. 
 Riesgos y desafíos
 

Los años de trabajo que llevamos han sido significativos en la vida de muchas personas que han pasado por nuestros procesos. Sin embargo en estos momentos hay otros seres que también desean tener un espacio diferente al que su entorno le ofrece, en donde pueda sentirse valorado por lo que es, como agentes de cambio en su comunidad.  ​

Tu puedes ser parte de este gran desafío. 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

  • Te extendemos la invitación para que compartas nuestra campaña en las redes sociales y ayúdanos a causar eco para poder cumplir con nuestra meta. 
  •  Si deseas ser parte de la familia del Centro Comunitario Yira Castro, visita nuestra pagina de Facebook https://www.facebook.com/CentroComunitarioYira/o envianos un correo electrónico a centrocomunitarioyiracastro@gmail.com 

¡Gracias por tu donación!
