¡Gracias por tu donación!

story:
Welcome to the crowd fund launch for the brand new,

SEMPI Social Communication Model!

Hi, my name is Alyse Price-Tobler. The last four years of my life have been dedicated to designing a completely original, ground breaking stigma reduction model for the world! I can guarantee you that there is no other model like this one anywhere, and it has the power to positively change communities!

What is the ‘SSCM’ and why was it designed?

SEMPI teaches community members the steps to take if someone is not OK in that very moment. The ‘SSCM’ teaches adult community members how to easily move into deeper, more empathetic conversations, enabling everyone to feel heard & understood, through the acronym known as SEMPI. Each letter within the acronym SEMPI covers all aspects of daily mental and physical health in an easy to use system. Children from age three can use the specifically designed children’s model, to learn how to speak about and understand themselves. They can also gain personal insight about how their bodies and minds are feeling from an early age, thereby reducing stigma and normalising talk around mental health. Children can speak about anything they choose, be it good or not so good, in their daily routine. They can share this model with adults, or other children, allowing everyone to reciprocally have a voice and feel heard!

The ‘SEMPI Social Communication Model’ has been written for ALL community members, from all walks of life! This new model teaches everyone from aged three to adult, the art of having a heart to heart conversation, so that competing with each other stops, and real listening can take place. This model is designed as a community aid to reduce loneliness, stigma, and bullying between community members, while increasing altruism through a ‘pay it forward’ philosophy.

This idea matters because people need personal equality and freedom to thrive. The silence and imbalance of power within our society needs to be stopped, so that we all feel heard, validated and understood, while honouring each other.

Imagine if people could learn to speak freely and honestly with a strong voice, about why they feel the way they do and what their individual needs are, while also believing that they will be heard when they do this.

This concept has the power to change the world!

The ‘SEMPI Social Communication Model’ (pronounced Sem-pie) has been developed primarily with the purpose of reducing ''the tribal stigma of race, nation, and religion" (Goffman, 1963) within our communities. ‘The SEMPI Social Communication Model’ will be known as the ‘SSCM’ for the remainder of this project.

My background

I am a professional Psychotherapist/Counsellor with a Masters Degree in Psychotherapy and Counselling (MCAP). I have worked in front line Community Mental Health & Disabilities, for the past 32 years. I have walked with thousands of struggling community members and I have seen a lot! These amazing souls are the reason why I get out of bed every day. My passion is deep and I am a very driven and serious advocate for many of my clients. Giving my clients a voice to feel heard and empowered is why I have written this model.

Successful track record

 In my previous position, I was the Specialist Mental Health Disability Employment Services Area Manager for the Macarthur Region (West Sydney, Australia) for the Schizophrenia Fellowship of NSW (now known as ‘One Door.’) I created this arm of the business from scratch, to a five star rating. My position included finding, placing and supporting 200 plus clients with a mental health issue and or a disability to stay in employment with my team. I also employed and trained staff, liaised with affiliated community organisations, designed and maintained monthly budgets, advocated for our clients and worked closely with employers. I extended the initial DES contract to include a new ESS contract, bringing in another 500 clients, and making sure that the DES now had a bright future with long term viability. My proven background within the community, and my confidence in the ‘SSCM’ to be a ground-breaking new way for society to become empowered, is extremely exciting my current team and I. The ‘SSCM’ is a culmination of my 32 years of professional experience. I am not stranger to hard work, and I have heard people tell me many times what they need to be the best person that they can be, and achieve their own personal goals, especially if they have a mental health issue and or a disability. Always, time and time again, it is the NEED TO FEEL HEARD.

Why my campaign is important to me

There is no other model like the ‘SSCM’ in the world!

It is very clear to me, that mental illness has become more prevalent and community resources are now at breaking point! Every day, I see extreme levels of loneliness, low self-esteem and loss of hope. I see class division, segregation, judgemental behaviour, inequality, stigma, and discrimination. I have also designed the ‘SSCM’ as a preventative measure, so that we as a society do not become mentally or emotionally unwell. It is my life’s mission to change this!

What is the ‘SSCM’ and why was it designed?

The ‘SSCM’ teaches adult community members how to easily move into deeper, more empathetic conversations, enabling everyone to feel heard & understood, through the acronym known as SEMPI. Each letter within the acronym SEMPI covers all aspects of daily mental and physical health in an easy to use system. Children from age three can use the specifically designed children’s model, to learn how to speak about and understand themselves. They can also gain personal insight about how their bodies and minds are feeling from an early age, thereby reducing stigma and normalising talk around mental health. Children can speak about anything they choose, be it good or not so good, in their daily routine. They can share this model with adults, or other children, allowing everyone to reciprocally have a voice and feel heard!

The ‘SSCM’ can also be quickly adapted to help anyone within community to know what to do if they ask someone if they're alright, and the other person answers NO. 

This is a question that I have seen play out daily across all ages, and sections of the community. Sometimes I see people move to a deeper level and ‘hold space’ for the person answering ‘NO’, but more often than not, I see avoidance and stigma shown toward the person who has been brave enough to speak their truth.

I asked the question, ‘do you know how to stop what you're doing, and have a deeper, more real, empathic conversation with another person, allowing them to feel heard, validated and understood, if they answer ‘NO?’

I know from my work within community that not many people know how to comfortably address this issue. Not knowing the basic skills to take a conversation to a deeper level and sit with someone when they are needing to express themselves, often leads to communal disconnection. Communal disconnection may lead to people feeling awkward, vulnerable, isolated, unworthy, depressed, suicidal and lonely, no matter what their age or situation They may also stop answering truthfully and say the standard answer of ‘I’m good thanks’ knowing that they won’t be heard anyway. This term has also become a social norm and I am contesting it!

Is there a better question than ‘are you alright?’

While I was writing the ‘SSCM’, I decided to include a new solution to the question ‘Are you alright?’ I created a whole new angle, and a brand new replacement question!

Introducing the question, ‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?'

Replacing the question, ‘are you alright?’

'HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?' is a deeper, more real invitation, asked by one person to another, (between ages three to adult). This question is asked if it comes from a genuine place of interest for another person.

‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?’ comes with an in built offer to take the time out to listen, and walk with the other person, consequently moving the conversation to a deeper level of empathy, care and understanding for each other’s perspectives!

‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?’ is a totally unique question that no one is used to hearing, so they cannot equate it to the question ‘ARE YOU ALRIGHT?’

What benefits to community members will your contribution help us to achieve?

Most importantly! Knowing this model could save someone’s life!

Members may also experience the development of closer communal bonds, reduced loneliness and depression, heightened feelings of inclusion, and higher values of self-worth. This may have a positive impact on community member’s levels of empathy and happiness. It may also influence communal policing budgets, resources allocated to health care programs, and professional community workers burn out rates. Money saved can be used to improve communities health and wellbeing overall.  

The 'SSCM' is created to be an aid for the community (not a replacement for professional help). Every day, I see a HUGE gap in the area of self-care in the community due to escalating living costs and cuts to social services. This model is created with this in mind, to assist the community to work with their difficulties together, and be able to identify them early, so that their problems don't escalate to higher unmanageable levels, and community money can be better spent! 

The ‘SSCM’ is designed to work across all levels of stigma, including workplace stigma, mental health stigma, social class stigma, disability stigma and social stigma (physical, behavioural, intellectual and group). It teaches each person an easy to remember sequential task that they can adapt the model exactly to suit their own personal stories, and then pay it forward.

Can people with a disability use the ‘SSCM’?

People living with all types of disabilities can use the ‘SSCM’ to feel heard! I have used the “SSCM’ within the community to gain feedback and advice as to how to improve the model, from client’s who have downs syndrome, autism, who are experiencing homelessness, have an intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, hearing impairment and within a palliative care unit. Most of my feedback has been very positive, however, working with the prototype booklets has been challenging, but I believe that I have now created a version that works well and has all of the emergency service numbers included within the format for extra support.

The ‘SSCM’ also assists the carers and nursing staff who work with the elderly, to have a voice and feel heard around the experience that is real for them as well, reducing burn out rates within this area as well.

Can professionals use the ‘SSCM?’

Absolutely! This model has the same format for everyone across the community, including professional workers. I include rescue personnel within this group as I was a fully accredited first responder Road Rescue Officer with the NSW State Emergency Service and I know full well what emergency responders need when it comes to feeling heard!

What research has been performed to validate the results of the ‘SSCM?’

I initially tested the ‘SSCM’ with women in Sydney who were experiencing primary homelessness, and lived with mental and physical health issues in 2016. I chose this group as they knew me well and trusted me from when I was researching my Master’s degree thesis on stigma, known as, ‘A qualitative analysis to investigate the varied responses from the female primary homeless as evident in demonstrations from the general public’ in September 2016. The response to the ‘SSCM’ was amazing from the women, and once they had learnt the model they then ‘paid it forward’ and taught the person next to them from my prototype booklets. I made changes according to their recommendations, and then went back for a review and further changes as necessary. The women reported that this model is the answer to their feeling heard, listened to, and validated. I was thrilled! We had cracked the code together!

What funding is needed and where is it going?

This project is a culmination of 32 years of my professional life and I am giving the community and children’s model away for FREE. I am making the children’s and community version FREE so that it can get out to where it’s mostly needed. However, even though it’s free for the community, it will cost a lot to get it out to where it's needed!

We are asking for a donation of $25,000.

  1. We are raising funds for an informative, professional, in depth FREE training video ($5,000) to use in accompaniment with our face to face talks for when we speak to schools and community organisations.
  2. Training and paying staff to go out into the grass roots community will cost a further $10,000.
  3. Part of the money raised will also contribute toward printing our community resource brochures ($5,000) so that they can be handed out, for free, to hospitals, community centres, libraries, work places, schools, nursing homes...basically anywhere they are needed.
  4. Day to day running of the office will consume the remaining portion of the money (phone calls, office printing, mail outs, petrol, and meals while providing training ($5,000).

The money that we raise through our crowd fund campaign, will allow our model to be available for FREE to everyone from aged three to adult, within their communities!

Where will the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?

Any funds that have been kindly donated will go toward the filming of our training video so that at least we can put it up on YouTube, and what is left after that will go toward brochures for the community. We will not be able to employ staff to go out into the field and teach the model. The teaching of the model to key community personnel is imperative if we want the community members to be able to use it properly, how it was meant to be designed, for themselves.

Our unique perks! (See perk page!)

Challenges we may face

With an extensive background in business and community mental health, the challenges we may face, are about a lack of money. A lack of money will lead to a major restriction on how much we can get out into the community.

Call to action!

We know that not everyone has the spare money to fund our project, so we would REALLY appreciate it if you could use the Indiegogo ‘share tools’ and get the word out about our free community enhancing, stigma reducing campaign! Please make as much noise as you can!

Social Media

Watch us, like us, share us on Instagram, Twitter, emails and Facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/sempisocialcommunicati...
instagram https://www.instagram.com/alysetobler/
twitter https://www.instagram.com/alysetobler/

We even have our own You Tube Channel now!

Just go to YouTube and punch in SEMPI Social Communication Model and we will pop up magically! There are many more videos about the ‘SSCM’ there for you to watch!

Thank you from the bottom of our big red hearts! Alyse Price-Tobler
story_txt:
Welcome to the crowd fund launch for the brand new,
SEMPI Social Communication Model!
Hi, my name is Alyse Price-Tobler. The last four years of my life have been dedicated to designing a completely original, ground breaking stigma reduction model for the world! I can guarantee you that there is no other model like this one anywhere, and it has the power to positively change communities!
What is the ‘SSCM’ and why was it designed?
SEMPI teaches community members the steps to take if someone is not OK in that very moment. The ‘SSCM’ teaches adult community members how to easily move into deeper, more empathetic conversations, enabling everyone to feel heard & understood, through the acronym known as SEMPI. Each letter within the acronym SEMPI covers all aspects of daily mental and physical health in an easy to use system. Children from age three can use the specifically designed children’s model, to learn how to speak about and understand themselves. They can also gain personal insight about how their bodies and minds are feeling from an early age, thereby reducing stigma and normalising talk around mental health. Children can speak about anything they choose, be it good or not so good, in their daily routine. They can share this model with adults, or other children, allowing everyone to reciprocally have a voice and feel heard!
The ‘SEMPI Social Communication Model’ has been written for ALL community members, from all walks of life! This new model teaches everyone from aged three to adult, the art of having a heart to heart conversation, so that competing with each other stops, and real listening can take place. This model is designed as a community aid to reduce loneliness, stigma, and bullying between community members, while increasing altruism through a ‘pay it forward’ philosophy.
This idea matters because people need personal equality and freedom to thrive. The silence and imbalance of power within our society needs to be stopped, so that we all feel heard, validated and understood, while honouring each other.
Imagine if people could learn to speak freely and honestly with a strong voice, about why they feel the way they do and what their individual needs are, while also believing that they will be heard when they do this.
This concept has the power to change the world!
The ‘SEMPI Social Communication Model’ (pronounced Sem-pie) has been developed primarily with the purpose of reducing ''the tribal stigma of race, nation, and religion" (Goffman, 1963) within our communities. ‘The SEMPI Social Communication Model’ will be known as the ‘SSCM’ for the remainder of this project.
My background
I am a professional Psychotherapist/Counsellor with a Masters Degree in Psychotherapy and Counselling (MCAP). I have worked in front line Community Mental Health & Disabilities, for the past 32 years. I have walked with thousands of struggling community members and I have seen a lot! These amazing souls are the reason why I get out of bed every day. My passion is deep and I am a very driven and serious advocate for many of my clients. Giving my clients a voice to feel heard and empowered is why I have written this model.
Successful track record
 In my previous position, I was the Specialist Mental Health Disability Employment Services Area Manager for the Macarthur Region (West Sydney, Australia) for the Schizophrenia Fellowship of NSW (now known as ‘One Door.’) I created this arm of the business from scratch, to a five star rating. My position included finding, placing and supporting 200 plus clients with a mental health issue and or a disability to stay in employment with my team. I also employed and trained staff, liaised with affiliated community organisations, designed and maintained monthly budgets, advocated for our clients and worked closely with employers. I extended the initial DES contract to include a new ESS contract, bringing in another 500 clients, and making sure that the DES now had a bright future with long term viability. My proven background within the community, and my confidence in the ‘SSCM’ to be a ground-breaking new way for society to become empowered, is extremely exciting my current team and I. The ‘SSCM’ is a culmination of my 32 years of professional experience. I am not stranger to hard work, and I have heard people tell me many times what they need to be the best person that they can be, and achieve their own personal goals, especially if they have a mental health issue and or a disability. Always, time and time again, it is the NEED TO FEEL HEARD.
Why my campaign is important to me
There is no other model like the ‘SSCM’ in the world!
It is very clear to me, that mental illness has become more prevalent and community resources are now at breaking point! Every day, I see extreme levels of loneliness, low self-esteem and loss of hope. I see class division, segregation, judgemental behaviour, inequality, stigma, and discrimination. I have also designed the ‘SSCM’ as a preventative measure, so that we as a society do not become mentally or emotionally unwell. It is my life’s mission to change this!
What is the ‘SSCM’ and why was it designed?
The ‘SSCM’ teaches adult community members how to easily move into deeper, more empathetic conversations, enabling everyone to feel heard & understood, through the acronym known as SEMPI. Each letter within the acronym SEMPI covers all aspects of daily mental and physical health in an easy to use system. Children from age three can use the specifically designed children’s model, to learn how to speak about and understand themselves. They can also gain personal insight about how their bodies and minds are feeling from an early age, thereby reducing stigma and normalising talk around mental health. Children can speak about anything they choose, be it good or not so good, in their daily routine. They can share this model with adults, or other children, allowing everyone to reciprocally have a voice and feel heard!
The ‘SSCM’ can also be quickly adapted to help anyone within community to know what to do if they ask someone if they're alright, and the other person answers NO. 
This is a question that I have seen play out daily across all ages, and sections of the community. Sometimes I see people move to a deeper level and ‘hold space’ for the person answering ‘NO’, but more often than not, I see avoidance and stigma shown toward the person who has been brave enough to speak their truth.
I asked the question, ‘do you know how to stop what you're doing, and have a deeper, more real, empathic conversation with another person, allowing them to feel heard, validated and understood, if they answer ‘NO?’
I know from my work within community that not many people know how to comfortably address this issue. Not knowing the basic skills to take a conversation to a deeper level and sit with someone when they are needing to express themselves, often leads to communal disconnection. Communal disconnection may lead to people feeling awkward, vulnerable, isolated, unworthy, depressed, suicidal and lonely, no matter what their age or situation They may also stop answering truthfully and say the standard answer of ‘I’m good thanks’ knowing that they won’t be heard anyway. This term has also become a social norm and I am contesting it!
Is there a better question than ‘are you alright?’
While I was writing the ‘SSCM’, I decided to include a new solution to the question ‘Are you alright?’ I created a whole new angle, and a brand new replacement question!
Introducing the question, ‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?'
Replacing the question, ‘are you alright?’
'HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?' is a deeper, more real invitation, asked by one person to another, (between ages three to adult). This question is asked if it comes from a genuine place of interest for another person.
‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?’ comes with an in built offer to take the time out to listen, and walk with the other person, consequently moving the conversation to a deeper level of empathy, care and understanding for each other’s perspectives!
‘HOW IS YOUR SEMPI?’ is a totally unique question that no one is used to hearing, so they cannot equate it to the question ‘ARE YOU ALRIGHT?’
What benefits to community members will your contribution help us to achieve?
Most importantly! Knowing this model could save someone’s life!
Members may also experience the development of closer communal bonds, reduced loneliness and depression, heightened feelings of inclusion, and higher values of self-worth. This may have a positive impact on community member’s levels of empathy and happiness. It may also influence communal policing budgets, resources allocated to health care programs, and professional community workers burn out rates. Money saved can be used to improve communities health and wellbeing overall.  
The 'SSCM' is created to be an aid for the community (not a replacement for professional help). Every day, I see a HUGE gap in the area of self-care in the community due to escalating living costs and cuts to social services. This model is created with this in mind, to assist the community to work with their difficulties together, and be able to identify them early, so that their problems don't escalate to higher unmanageable levels, and community money can be better spent! 
The ‘SSCM’ is designed to work across all levels of stigma, including workplace stigma, mental health stigma, social class stigma, disability stigma and social stigma (physical, behavioural, intellectual and group). It teaches each person an easy to remember sequential task that they can adapt the model exactly to suit their own personal stories, and then pay it forward.
Can people with a disability use the ‘SSCM’?
People living with all types of disabilities can use the ‘SSCM’ to feel heard! I have used the “SSCM’ within the community to gain feedback and advice as to how to improve the model, from client’s who have downs syndrome, autism, who are experiencing homelessness, have an intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, hearing impairment and within a palliative care unit. Most of my feedback has been very positive, however, working with the prototype booklets has been challenging, but I believe that I have now created a version that works well and has all of the emergency service numbers included within the format for extra support.
The ‘SSCM’ also assists the carers and nursing staff who work with the elderly, to have a voice and feel heard around the experience that is real for them as well, reducing burn out rates within this area as well.
Can professionals use the ‘SSCM?’
Absolutely! This model has the same format for everyone across the community, including professional workers. I include rescue personnel within this group as I was a fully accredited first responder Road Rescue Officer with the NSW State Emergency Service and I know full well what emergency responders need when it comes to feeling heard!
What research has been performed to validate the results of the ‘SSCM?’
I initially tested the ‘SSCM’ with women in Sydney who were experiencing primary homelessness, and lived with mental and physical health issues in 2016. I chose this group as they knew me well and trusted me from when I was researching my Master’s degree thesis on stigma, known as, ‘A qualitative analysis to investigate the varied responses from the female primary homeless as evident in demonstrations from the general public’ in September 2016. The response to the ‘SSCM’ was amazing from the women, and once they had learnt the model they then ‘paid it forward’ and taught the person next to them from my prototype booklets. I made changes according to their recommendations, and then went back for a review and further changes as necessary. The women reported that this model is the answer to their feeling heard, listened to, and validated. I was thrilled! We had cracked the code together!
What funding is needed and where is it going? 
This project is a culmination of 32 years of my professional life and I am giving the community and children’s model away for FREE. I am making the children’s and community version FREE so that it can get out to where it’s mostly needed. However, even though it’s free for the community, it will cost a lot to get it out to where it's needed!
We are asking for a donation of $25,000.

We are raising funds for an informative, professional, in depth FREE training video ($5,000) to use in accompaniment with our face to face talks for when we speak to schools and community organisations.
Training and paying staff to go out into the grass roots community will cost a further $10,000.
Part of the money raised will also contribute toward printing our community resource brochures ($5,000) so that they can be handed out, for free, to hospitals, community centres, libraries, work places, schools, nursing homes...basically anywhere they are needed.
Day to day running of the office will consume the remaining portion of the money (phone calls, office printing, mail outs, petrol, and meals while providing training ($5,000).

The money that we raise through our crowd fund campaign, will allow our model to be available for FREE to everyone from aged three to adult, within their communities!
Where will the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?
Any funds that have been kindly donated will go toward the filming of our training video so that at least we can put it up on YouTube, and what is left after that will go toward brochures for the community. We will not be able to employ staff to go out into the field and teach the model. The teaching of the model to key community personnel is imperative if we want the community members to be able to use it properly, how it was meant to be designed, for themselves.
Our unique perks! (See perk page!)
Challenges we may face

We know that not everyone has the spare money to fund our project, so we would REALLY appreciate it if you could use the Indiegogo ‘share tools’ and get the word out about our free community enhancing, stigma reducing campaign! Please make as much noise as you can!

Watch us, like us, share us on Instagram, Twitter, emails and Facebook!

story:
Our Story

The 12 hour drive to University of Maine this summer brought tears to my eyes.  Yes, I cried ...lol.  I was happy for my son, Isaiah, because he truly earned his football scholarship.  However, the long drive allowed me to reflect on the struggles of our journey.  When I shared my feelings with my business partner James Burrell, he told me about his personal journey as a Division 1 basketball player and that of his daughter who is currently a track star at Fresno State.  I know what you are thinking…. We should be happy that our children were lucky enough to be in that top 1% of high school athletes to receive a college scholarship.

After hours of conversation, it hit us like a ton of bricks.  SmartJock!! There are millions and millions of families just like ours dedicating so much time, energy, and money into sports and will not realize the impact of that time being taking away from education until it’s too late.  SmartJock will create the culture to make it cool to be smart.

 

Did You Know?

  • High School Sport participation has increased for 28 straight years*

  • High School sport participation reached an all time high of 7,963,535*  

  • There are only 480,000 Collegiate Athletes in the United States**

  • 1 in 4 student athletes suffer from depression after high school**

 

SmartJock IQ

SmartJock is the Premier Sports Education company that focuses on the growth and development of athletes, parents, and coaches.  Our team has created the perfect blend of new technology, education, and real-life experiences.  The SmartJock IQ is hand crafted from the minds of Professional Athlete, Coaches, and Educators.  We recognize that in today's world the athlete must be intelligent both on the field and off the field.  We are changing the culture so that it's NOW cool to be a SmartJock!

We wish that we could share with you more details about this awesome app, however we know that our competition is watching.  SmartJock is the new BUZZ in the world of sports and we can't wait for you to download the app and experience the power of the SmartJock IQ during our launch, March 2018. 

 

Highlights 

  • Our Mission: Our company's mission is to make every athlete better!
  • Target Market: Student athletes grades K-12, parents, coaches & fans.  
  • Targeted Size: 36.2 million student athletes in grades K-12 in the United States
  • Big Business: It is estimated that $15 Billion will be generated from the Youth Sport industry in 2017. 

 

Our Goal for this Campaign: $50,000

 

Where is the money going? 

The Impact

Next 3 to 5 years: SmartJock will be a household name, making it cool to be a smart athlete by having athletes, parents and coaches using the following tools:

  • SmartJock IQ
  • SmarkJock Mobile App
  • SmartJock Workshops
  • SmartJock Online Classes
  • SmartJock Media
  • International Expansion 

Projection: 25 million app download

In the Future: 10 years from now, we can’t wait to see the SmartJock athletes that come through our program and they are now in their professional careers as successful Doctors, Lawyers, Politicians, Teachers, Sports Agents, Entrepreneurs, etc.  They will have the opportunity to come back and share their story to impact and inspire future generations. 

Risks & Challenges

 

Meet the Team

Here at SmartJock our dedicated team has created the perfect blend of new technology, education, and real-life experiences to revolutionize the sports world by leveling the playing field for everyone.

 

Mr. Erik Robinson

Chief Executive Officer

  • 30 years of successful sales experience in multiple industries
  • 15 years in executive management experience 
  • 11 years full time entrepreneur
  • 6 years of coaching entrepreneurs
  • Built and developed sales forces of over 10,000 distributors

 

Dr. Meri Robinson

Vice President of Education

  • 21 years of experience in education
  • 18 years of experience of integrating technology into schools at the district level.
  • Noted author of 5 books with a focus on technology and education.
  • Prominent National speaker
  • Successful entrepreneur

 

Mr. James Burrell

Vice President of Player Development

  • Former Division 1 basketball player
  • 15+ years of mentoring athletes
  • 14years of Management and Leadership Experience
  • 6 years as a business coach

 

Mr. Jacques Vaughan

Director of Marketing

  • 30+ years in the music industry
  • 25 years of marketing and promotion and branding on a local and national level
  • 20 years mentoring at risk youth in the DMV area
  • Crazy ability to connect people and groups

 

Mr. Al Seyoum

Vice President of Technology 

  • Over 20 years of programing and coding
  • Successful entrepreneur
  • High level security clearance
  • Projects are top secret

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word.  You can take part in our SmartJock Challenge.  Just copy and paste the following onto your social media pages:

 

**************************

SmartJock Challenge

**************************

I stand in support of our youth athlete’s growth & development both on and off the field. 

I am tagging 15 people who who I know will stand with us and go to www.smartjock.net. 

If you accept this challenge copy and paste this post on your page and tag at least 15 people including me who you believe will do the same.  www.smartjock.net

#smartjock  #ChildrendAreTheFuture

 

_________________________________________________________________________

 *** Also, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

References

*National Federation of State High Schools Associations (nfhs.org)

**National Collegiate Athletic Association (ncaa.org)

story:
NYC needs us and we need you.

The Shakespeare Forum is dedicated to providing services to all members of our New York community. Isolation, lack of federal funding and personal financial constraints should not prohibit New York community members from gaining the tools and confidence they need to make their way in New York, both as conscious artists and as parts of a greater artistic alliance.

The Shakespeare Forum, in our 11th year, therefore continues to offer free and low-cost workshops, school residencies, classes, readings, open rehearsals, productions, after-school programming as well as the annual El Barrio Shakespeare Festival in East Harlem. We use these programs, with Shakespeare's words, to create empowered communities through education and performance. 

No, really. We need you now more than ever.

The need for community like this is now more important than ever. The Shakespeare Forum strives to be the constant in a changing world and in order to remain constant, we need constant support. 

How you can help us:

  • Donate to our campaign
  • Tell people you love about the work we do and encourage them to donate
  • Tell people who you expect to love in the not-too-distant-future that they should consider donating and then come to an open workshop together. Many a relationship has blossomed at The Shakespeare Forum.
  • Tell people who you like but who don't have money to pay for classes, that they should come to a workshop (since they are free). Then they might love it and ask people to donate.
  • Share our campaign far and wide with friends and strangers alike.

 

 

The Shakespeare Forum, Inc. is a 501(c )3 charity and, as such, all donations are fully tax deductible. If a perk is chosen with your donation, the value available for tax deduction is mentioned in the description.
story_txt:
NYC needs us and we need you.The Shakespeare Forum is dedicated to providing services to all members of our New York community. Isolation, lack of federal funding and personal financial constraints should not prohibit New York community members from gaining the tools and confidence they need to make their way in New York, both as conscious artists and as parts of a greater artistic alliance.The Shakespeare Forum, in our 11th year, therefore continues to offer free and low-cost workshops, school residencies, classes, readings, open rehearsals, productions, after-school programming as well as the annual El Barrio Shakespeare Festival in East Harlem. We use these programs, with Shakespeare's words, to create empowered communities through education and performance. No, really. We need you now more than ever.The need for community like this is now more important than ever. The Shakespeare Forum strives to be the constant in a changing world and in order to remain constant, we need constant support. How you can help us:
Donate to our campaign
Tell people you love about the work we do and encourage them to donate
Tell people who you expect to love in the not-too-distant-future that they should consider donating and then come to an open workshop together. Many a relationship has blossomed at The Shakespeare Forum.
Tell people who you like but who don't have money to pay for classes, that they should come to a workshop (since they are free). Then they might love it and ask people to donate.
Share our campaign far and wide with friends and strangers alike.
  The Shakespeare Forum, Inc. is a 501(c )3 charity and, as such, all donations are fully tax deductible. If a perk is chosen with your donation, the value available for tax deduction is mentioned in the description.

story:
Who We Are:

Ellen and Julienne became friends through mutual passion for Permaculture practices, and work together to proceed forward toward self-sufficient livelihoods that benefit the person, plant, animal, insect, air, water and soil communities around them.

Ellen grew up in the mountains of western NC with a strong love and connection to the land, and after 15 years dreaming about having a homestead, finally began to see it come to fruition beginning in 2015 with the purchase of 5 acres in Haywood County. Ellen's experience stems from lots of book learning, some years spent working for a plant nursery and garden center, years working in the natural health/food industry and studying nutrition in school, years spent volunteering with a group of Food Not Bombs towards helping alleviate hunger in urban food desert neighborhoods, in addition to WWOOFing and other workshops related to Permaculture and other sustainable agriculture modalities.

Julienne grew up in/around farming communities in PA. After going to school for environmental studies and becoming discouraged at the rate in which our civilization at large on this planet is destroying the planet's ecosystems faster than the rate at which they can recover, she decided the best way she felt she could make a direct impact on sustaining and preserving life on the planet would be to strive towards living with a lighter foot print, and permaculture practices became the framework in which to do so. She left school to travel around the country living with various intentional communities learning hands-on sustainable farming skills and how humans can have a more positive impact on one another and the earth we all share.

 

The Way Forward:

North Carolina is ranked as one of the worst regions for food desertification in the country - there are over 380 determined food deserts across 80 counties. Many of the state's inhabitants still live in rural areas and yet have stopped farming and gardening as the generations carried on, or they have no time to do so when they have to drive however far just to get to their place of employment. This means that many people live without easy access to affordable or healthy foods.
Statistically the median age range of farmers in this country is currently 55 and getting older. We face the potential of a dying profession, one which no country can afford to lose if it seeks to feed all of its people. Within the past few years there has been a small revival of sorts, as many young people try to break into the business, preserving this way of life and even improving upon it, yet many budding young farmers are a generation or two removed from farming families and come to the profession with no life-long learned skill or farmland inheritance. Getting started in farming isnt easy, getting started coming into it from nothing and with nothing makes it exceedingly difficult for this good and important work to continue on successfully, even by those willing to carry the torch.
Still, statistics seem to be on our side, the percentage of women-owned farms is growing, the interest level in agricultural practices that go against the mono-crop, industrial agriculture grain is also on the rise (all puns intended). We seek to definitely be an active part of the change we wish to see in the world. We wish to continually learn ever more so we can be at our most proficient, as well as be able to share our knowledge to help others lead more sustainable and healthy lives as well.

 

The Means:

The Asheville Organic Growers school came into existence out of the recognition and understanding that some sort of help and training needed to be facilitated in order to support young people exploring how they could viably get into a sustainable farming enterprise. Their short weekend long workshops have garnered much success and pull together some of the highest caliber teachers in western North Carolina in matters of sustainable agriculture, homesteading, green building, food rights and policy etc... Last year they launched the first round of their Farm Beginnings year long training program designed for the start-up farmers who are just getting their feet wet and needing an extra framework for guidance towards success. Now it has come time for the second run of the program to choose its students.

http://organicgrowersschool.org/farm-beginnings/


Ellen and Julienne see this as an invaluable opportunity to learn more about business start up and management in farming from local experts already walking the walk and talking the talk. It is a networking and educational opportunity wherein the content of the program far exceeds the more than fair price asked to register and join in.

Alas, being young start-ups, even this relatively meager tuition total of $2500 is not something we have lying around. To pay for this training program will necessitate debt on both of our parts, and while debt may be virtually just part of our "way of life" getting by in this country, the less we must place ourselves in financial debt now, so early out the starting gate into this world of farming, the better off we will be to launch our enterprise off the ground in the months and years to come.

Any and all help provided is most graciously appreciated. Any funds we can raise will go towards affording this program's tuition.

story:
My Story

When I lived in Spain, one of my children went missing in a local Carrefour supermarket. The moment we realized we didn’t know where he was, we all panicked. In an instant, every possible terrible outcome flashed through my mind. What if he had been taken? What if he wandered out into traffic? What if I never saw him again?


Fortunately, the store staff were eventually able to locate him, but the shock had already had a lasting effect on me. I never wanted to have that feeling ever again. If we had had BodiBeacon, we would have known about it as soon as he wandered too far away, and I would never have had to worry.


Mobile beacons are an emerging type of technology. BodiBeacon is a small physical device, typically the size of a 2 -4 cm coin, which can be attached to anyone or anything to transmit important information to nearby mobile devices. To date, they’ve been used mostly in the commercial retail space, making it easy for shop owners and manufacturers to highlight their products to shoppers. We’re bringing this amazing technology to the next level, and creating a way for every concerned parent to protect their children.


What is BodiBeacon?

BodiBeacon is a new type of micro-sized device which can be embedded in the bracelet, necklace, backpack, or even clothing of a child. The iBeacon technology has been trademarked by Apple, and runs on modern “low energy” Bluetooth technology to act as a tracking and monitoring device synced to a parent’s mobile device. Never again will parents panic at the realization that their kids have wandered off in a crowded store or an outdoor space. Immediate action can be taken to recover the child, because people will know where they are at all times.


How BodiBeacon Works

The technology behind BodiBeacon has been available for about a year, but never applied quite this way before. Most other beacons on the market work through outdated GPS technology, which only operates through direct line of site with the device on a very limited range. Breaking line of sight can instantly invalidate everything the beacon has to offer. Tracking with GPS can also be wildly inaccurate. This obviously won’t work when dealing with lost children. GPS also relies on a SIM card and contract with a provider, making the whole thing unnecessarily expensive and complicated to use.


Any item equipped with our beacon will be paired with a mobile device with its own specialty app installed. It will constantly transmit a signal through low energy Bluetooth technology to track its location. Because the device is small enough to be integrated into everyday items like clothes and jewelry, the child will not even know he or she is wearing it, and any person with harmful intent would not know to remove it.



The App

We currently have an app for Android & iPhone that is able to receive a proximity based message however it is more geared towards business use. Our objective with funds raised using this campaign is to enhance it to be used for child safety.



This entails providing a real-time child radar to enable you to see your kids and other kids trusted to you via a trusted parent group. We also wish to add the social features such as "Trusted Parent Groups" so that other adults can also keep an eye on your kids on their radar within your community.



Where We Are in Development

We already run a popular platform for networking of beacons called iLaunch (www.iLaunch.com), and have developed some similar functionalities for wearable beacons before. Our main challenge right now is getting the hardware small enough to be embeddable in anything worn by a child and cheap enough to be as useful as possible to everyone. Eventually we would like to get manufacturing costs down to a point where we can charge $30 for a BodiBeacon and just a few dollars for the bluetooth radio that could be embedded in other jewelry or clothing.


We’d like to offer as many incentives as possible for those who are able to pre-order BodiBeacons. The more BodiBeacons we can produce in a single run, the cheaper the price per unit will be! Take advantage of the special low prices we are offering during this campaign, because you won’t always be able to get BodiBeacon this cheap. 

It’s important to note that BodiBeacon and its use for tracking lost children is only the beginning of what this technology can do. By funding the project at this stage, you are directly opening new doors for what we will be able to do with wearable beacons tomorrow for child safety and protection.

 

Product Timeline

We already have a working prototype for BodiBeacon and the alpha version of our iOS and Android app developed. Our timeline includes everything we will need to be able to produce BodiBeacons. We’ve given ample time to complete everything, and accounted for potential delays. Here’s the breakdown for our hardware & software :



Use of Funds

The main use of funds will be dedicated to creating an end-to end child safety network consisting of cheap, small & powerful ibeacon transmitters that can be placed in anything from jewellery and clothes in conjunction with a smartphone app that allows you and your trusted friends to form a monitoring network to ensure that children are safe.


Manufacturing

BodiBeacon has been designed in the UK. We have a partner in Guangdong, China that is able to produce to our specification on a large scale at low cost. Our partner
is already one of the largest producers of bluetooth transmitters in the world and has been established for 10 years.
Our devices will undergo an intensive QA process that will aim to ensure 100% quality to our requirements.
The FREE mobile app will be available for Apple iOS and Android.


About Us

BodiBeacon is the latest product in a line of mobile beacon technology called iBeacon. We have experimented with putting all types of functionality into these devices, and we get better at making them smaller and more efficient with each passing day. Our company, iLaunch (www.ilaunch.com), focuses on getting people involved in the wearable beacon market as part of a living, breathing social network of beacon wearers for different functions.

This hardware, combined with the functionality of the accompanying app software, has the potential to be a complete game-changer in the world of mobile devices and social networking. Owners of beacons register with our site to have their devices configured and integrated with our global platform, giving them complete control of how their beacons are activated and used.


Frequently Asked Questions

How does BodiBeacon work with the app?

BodiBeacon uses a new kind of low energy Bluetooth technology to track your child and send his or her location to an app on your phone. You are notified immediately if your child wanders past the distance away from your phone that you determine as acceptable.


What smartphones does the BodiBeacon app work for?

The BodiBeacon app will run on Apple iOS version 7 & above and Android version 4.3 & above. A Windows Phone version will also be available as soon as Microsoft implement Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) in their mobile operating system.


What is the range of BodiBeacon?

Our old model had a range a 20-50 meters, but we are currently implementing a new model which can extend up to 70 meters.


How long is the battery life for BodiBeacon?

The battery will last up to 3 years depending on usage.


Can BodiBeacon be used in wet weather?

Yes. The BodiBeacon will be housed in a waterproof case.


Are there any mobile Telco costs?

No. BodiBeacon does not rely on GSM therefore it doesn't need a SIM card.


Tell Your Friends

If you’ve ever wished it was easier to know with certainty that you would never lose track of your child, then you should already see the enormous value of BodiBeacon. We’d like to serve as an inspiration for other entrepreneurs and startup enterprises to get out there and release their innovations to the world through the crowdfunding model. We know a lot of people who need a solution like this, so tell your friends to contribute so we can promote it to the world. Sharing this campaign on your social media profile is just as valuable to us as an actual financial pledge.

story:
Summary

Do you know what it feels like when you are about to sneeze? Your eyes start to water, your nose gets itchy, and your brain even has time to think - "I'm about to sneeze!" And there's not much you can do to stop it. That's the best way we know how to describe how a person with Tourette Syndrome (TS) feels when a tic is about to come on. Can you imagine being a college student, in class, or studying in the library, dealing with constant vocal or motor tics that keep you from focusing?

College students with Tourette Syndrome (TS) have enough distractions without worrying about college costs. Dollars 4 Tic Scholars is a brand new non-profit established to help kids with TS  attend college and stay in college. 


My daughter, Kelsey Diamantis, has Tourette Syndrome. 


When she started college, we could not find nationally available college scholarships specifically for kids like her -- students with Tourette Syndrome. With the learning challenges these students face due to distractions from tics, plus potential associated conditions including OCD and ADHD, these students deserve many different types of support and encouragement. 

Since there were no scholarships for kids with TS, we decided to start a family foundation to provide college scholarships as financial encouragement for students with Tourette Syndrome to attend and complete college --and as an investment in their future contributions to society. 

Kelsey earned her Education degree and has become a teacher. She's making a difference, and now, we want to help other students with Tourette Syndrome do the same - by making it easier to attend college.  We believe in the potential of TS scholars!

We are raising funds to award our first scholarships in 2015. We are very enthusiastic about providing a service that many are seeking. But as a small, new foundation, we need your help. Do you know someone who has Tourette Syndrome? Then you know how important this financial encouragement is. Please read through our page and help.


Media We Have Received

-- 5 minute Radio interview on 900 AM Talk of the Palm Beaches:  https://soundcloud.com/jvcbroadcasting/diane-dianmantis-2-24-15

--20 minute podcast on OneAwesomeCommunity.com, 2-25-15:   http://www.oneawesomecommunity.com/4ticscholars

-- Fundraiser we are having locally to raise awareness in South Florida: 
http://www.pbglifestyle.com/events/d4ts-crowdfunding-campaign-kick-off/

-- Article about Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign and fundraiser on February 27 in Sun-Sentinel:

http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/palm-beach/boca-raton/fl-brf-tourettes-0218-20150218-story.html

-- PR Newswire:

http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/dollars-4-tic-scholars-new-tourette-scholarship-non-profit-to-launch-indiegogo-crowdfunding-campaign-february-23-300037407.html


--Palm Beach Society Scene, Sun-Sentinel, Feb 17 & 25:


--Article about crowdfunding campaign in Community News page of March 1, 2015 Sun-Sentinel: http://bit.ly/1C5cCfb


What We Need & What You Get

Through our scholarships, we will encourage students with Tourette Syndrome to pursue a degree, regardless of the learning difficulties they will face.

So far, our organization has been self funded and supported by donations of family and friends. However, this is not going to be enough. We need scholarship funding as well as minimal amounts for continuing operations - fundraising and communications to spread the word about our new foundation.
-- For 2015, we plan to award between one and four scholarships in the amount of $1000 each. Our goal in the next five years is to be able to provide 16 $1000 scholarships per year. Scholarships are designated for tuition, books and fees.

THE BREAKDOWN


-- Communications: News releases, brochures, marketing -- 24%

-- Operations: Website, organizational dues and fees, printing --14%

-- Fundraising: Two events per year and associated costs -- 8%

-- Scholarships: Four $1000 scholarships -- 54%


WHAT YOU GET

Check out our perks - they represent our appreciation for your donation. Your financial support will help Dollars 4 Tic Scholars make an impact in the life of a student who just wants to earn a degree and share their talents with the world! You'll have the satisfaction of helping launch a foundation that is filling a gap - providing national access to scholarships where they did not exist before. And, your donation will provide financial encouragement - our student applicants will know that you are rooting for them to focus on their abilities, not their disability!


The Impact

According to a study by the CDC done in 2011, 1 in every 360 children in the United States between the ages of 6 and 17 have been diagnosed with Tourette Syndrome based on parent report. That's about 138,000 children nationwide at that time, and of course doesn't count the older college students up to age 21 or 22.

People with Tourette’s are just as intelligent as others and deserve a chance to gain an education and make something of themselves.

In addition, 86% of people with Tourette's also have associated disorders, including ADHD, OCD, anxiety disorder, anger issues, and more. Just think what encouragement your support will provide to our student applicants!

We are accepting applications for our scholarships from students who want to know that someone recognizes the incredible effort they must put forth to learn while overcoming distractions. We're spreading the word - wherever we get a chance to speak! 

Our scholarships for 2015 will help students who will be chosen based on financial need and that "Go-getter" X-factor.

Our campaign will benefit high school seniors and students already in college who have Tourette's who find out that now, there is a scholarship program just for them.


Risks & Challenges

Tourette Syndrome recently received  a lot of press during the world cup soccer match thanks to US goalie Tim Howard who has TS. It is more top of mind than it ever has been. However, there is still a lot of education required regarding Tourette’s. Many people do not understand the condition, or associate Tourette's with coprolalia, or cursing, which really affects only about 15% of people with TS. 
One of the challenges that we face with this campaign and with our foundation is that people do not understand what TS is. Through promotions about the foundation and the availability of the scholarships, we will, in our own way, help spread the word about Tourette Syndrome.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell others about this campaign - share our link with your friends on Social Media.,. and use the Indiegogo "share" tool. You'll feel good about letting others know that you've helped ease the financial burden for a student who already has enough to worry about.
story_txt:
Summary Do you know what it feels like when you are about to sneeze? Your eyes start to water, your nose gets itchy, and your brain even has time to think - "I'm about to sneeze!" And there's not much you can do to stop it. That's the best way we know how to describe how a person with Tourette Syndrome (TS) feels when a tic is about to come on. Can you imagine being a college student, in class, or studying in the library, dealing with constant vocal or motor tics that keep you from focusing?
College students with Tourette Syndrome (TS) have enough distractions without worrying about college costs. Dollars 4 Tic Scholars is a brand new non-profit established to help kids with TS  attend college and stay in college. 



My daughter, Kelsey Diamantis, has Tourette Syndrome. 



When she started college, we could not find nationally available college scholarships specifically for kids like her -- students with Tourette Syndrome. With the learning challenges these students face due to distractions from tics, plus potential associated conditions including OCD and ADHD, these students deserve many different types of support and encouragement. 
Since there were no scholarships for kids with TS, we decided to start a family foundation to provide college scholarships as financial encouragement for students with Tourette Syndrome to attend and complete college --and as an investment in their future contributions to society. 
Kelsey earned her Education degree and has become a teacher. She's making a difference, and now, we want to help other students with Tourette Syndrome do the same - by making it easier to attend college.  We believe in the potential of TS scholars!


We are raising funds to award our first scholarships in 2015. We are very enthusiastic about providing a service that many are seeking. But as a small, new foundation, we need your help. Do you know someone who has Tourette Syndrome? Then you know how important this financial encouragement is. Please read through our page and help.


Media We Have Received
-- 5 minute Radio interview on 900 AM Talk of the Palm Beaches:  https://soundcloud.com/jvcbroadcasting/diane-dianmantis-2-24-15

--20 minute podcast on OneAwesomeCommunity.com, 2-25-15:   http://www.oneawesomecommunity.com/4ticscholars

-- Fundraiser we are having locally to raise awareness in South Florida: http://www.pbglifestyle.com/events/d4ts-crowdfunding-campaign-kick-off/

-- Article about Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign and fundraiser on February 27 in Sun-Sentinel:http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/palm-beach/boca-raton/fl-brf-tourettes-0218-20150218-story.html

-- PR Newswire:http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/dollars-4-tic-scholars-new-tourette-scholarship-non-profit-to-launch-indiegogo-crowdfunding-campaign-february-23-300037407.html

--Palm Beach Society Scene, Sun-Sentinel, Feb 17 & 25:


--Article about crowdfunding campaign in Community News page of March 1, 2015 Sun-Sentinel: http://bit.ly/1C5cCfb



   What We Need & What You Get Through our scholarships, we will encourage students with Tourette Syndrome to pursue a degree, regardless of the learning difficulties they will face.

So far, our organization has been self funded and supported by donations of family and friends. However, this is not going to be enough. We need scholarship funding as well as minimal amounts for continuing operations - fundraising and communications to spread the word about our new foundation.

-- For 2015, we plan to award between one and four scholarships in the amount of $1000 each. Our goal in the next five years is to be able to provide 16 $1000 scholarships per year. Scholarships are designated for tuition, books and fees.


THE BREAKDOWN






-- Communications: News releases, brochures, marketing -- 24%
-- Operations: Website, organizational dues and fees, printing --14%

-- Fundraising: Two events per year and associated costs -- 8%-- Scholarships: Four $1000 scholarships -- 54%

WHAT YOU GET
Check out our perks - they represent our appreciation for your donation. Your financial support will help Dollars 4 Tic Scholars make an impact in the life of a student who just wants to earn a degree and share their talents with the world! You'll have the satisfaction of helping launch a foundation that is filling a gap - providing national access to scholarships where they did not exist before. And, your donation will provide financial encouragement - our student applicants will know that you are rooting for them to focus on their abilities, not their disability!  
The Impact According to a study by the CDC done in 2011, 1 in every 360 children in the United States between the ages of 6 and 17 have been diagnosed with Tourette Syndrome based on parent report. That's about 138,000 children nationwide at that time, and of course doesn't count the older college students up to age 21 or 22.
People with Tourette’s are just as intelligent as others and deserve a chance to gain an education and make something of themselves.
In addition, 86% of people with Tourette's also have associated disorders, including ADHD, OCD, anxiety disorder, anger issues, and more. Just think what encouragement your support will provide to our student applicants!
We are accepting applications for our scholarships from students who want to know that someone recognizes the incredible effort they must put forth to learn while overcoming distractions. We're spreading the word - wherever we get a chance to speak! 


Our scholarships for 2015 will help students who will be chosen based on financial need and that "Go-getter" X-factor.
Our campaign will benefit high school seniors and students already in college who have Tourette's who find out that now, there is a scholarship program just for them.

    Risks & Challenges  Tourette Syndrome recently received  a lot of press during the world cup soccer match thanks to US goalie Tim Howard who has TS. It is more top of mind than it ever has been. However, there is still a lot of education required regarding Tourette’s. Many people do not understand the condition, or associate Tourette's with coprolalia, or cursing, which really affects only about 15% of people with TS. One of the challenges that we face with this campaign and with our foundation is that people do not understand what TS is. Through promotions about the foundation and the availability of the scholarships, we will, in our own way, help spread the word about Tourette Syndrome.


Other Ways You Can Help 
Tell others about this campaign - share our link with your friends on Social Media.,. and use the Indiegogo "share" tool. You'll feel good about letting others know that you've helped ease the financial burden for a student who already has enough to worry about.

story:
Hello,

My name is Matt Budzyn, the Founder/President/CEO of IMPACT-LLS Inc. This is very exciting time for our organization, as we are beginning our second year as a nonprofit. After a successful summer in Ronda, Spain, we are pleased to offer another exciting program in 2015.

I have over twenty years of language teaching experience, and I am the Modern Language Department Chair at Germantown Academy, a private day school in Fort Washington, Pennsylvania. I received my M.A. from Middleburg College, and I worked for Middlebury's MMLA program before creating this organization. I have also worked with various service organizations such as Habitat for Humanity, the Humanitarian Foundation, the Children's Wellness Foundation to name a few. 

 "I created IMPACT-LLS because I believe that Language Learning, Cultural Literacy and Awareness, and service to the community are important global skills to have in the 21st Century." 

According to Allie Tidwell of U.S. News and World Report-November 17, 2014, "fewer than 1% of all American students study abroad."  A very startling statistic while other developed and underdeveloped countries are sending higher percentages of their children abroad every year. To remain competitive in a global market, American students have to invest time in meaningful language training outside of the traditional American classroom and in a country where the target language is spoken. 

Many people tell me, "I did not learn a thing in my high school language classes." Immersion based learning is the only way to truly learn a language.  . Our program offers students a chance to reinvent themselves in the target language. 

What is IMPACT-LLS?  

We are an educational nonprofit organization that is committed to: (1) Enhancing and improving language proficiency in the four skill areas of speaking, reading, writing, and listening; (2) providing a deeper understanding of Spanish and Latino culture, literature, and history; and (3) providing meaningful programming opportunities either through local cultural activities, community service, or practical career training to middle school and high school students. These objectives are accomplished through an intensive immersion-based approach, combining a family home stay, traditional classroom learning, and meaningful experiential-based learning in a five-week summer program. 

Contributing to our organization means that we have the funds to provide financial assistance to our students and families in need, establish local connections so that we are able to provide service and experiential opportunities for our students, and to hire and train the most talented staff and families who work, mentor, and care for the students during their stay. Like most nonprofit programming, tuition covers most of the operating budget.  Infrastructure costs, financial assistance, and marketing funds come from donations and outside sources, which makes your participation crucial to supporting a premier and personalized language immersion  and service program. 

Why Donate to IMPACT-LLS?

There are many language and travel programs out there; all of them offering some tour of museums or hike through tribal villages. These programs provide a nice vacation, but do not provide true language immersion, effective community service or career training opportunities. IMPACT-LLS provides a transformational learning experience.
IMPACT-LLS hires local host families, teachers, and mentors, works with local businesses, and contracts local transportation companies, which means that all of this money is put right back into the local economy. We are committed to making an economic difference in local communities.

Service Initiatives such as environmental improvement, housing solutions, care for the elderly, medical volunteering, educational programs, and agricultural initiatives are incorporated into our curriculum, which teaches and empowers our young people to make a difference through participation. Students have to witness and experience misery, suffering, and injustice with their own eyes so that they can be a part of a greater solution when they become future policy makers in the world. It is through this kind of experiential learning that students develop empathy and compassion for those less fortunate, and can really make difference in their lives.

Where your money will go:

Financial Assistance (FA): $20,000 or about 60% of all money earned will go to building our Financial Aid Fund. Last year's FA fund only covered two partial scholarships, so we would like to offer much more to struggling families in 2015.  $20,000 will be able to provide 3.2 full scholarships or 10-15 partial scholarships. IMPACT's program goal is to offer financial assistance to 20% of our students over the next five years. Needless to say, we are working to realizing this goal, but you could make a huge difference for a student that loves language, but cannot afford this program. 

Capital Improvements (CI): $15,000 or 40% of all money earned will go to our Capital Improvements Fund, which will go to teacher and staff training, hiring expenses, travel expenses, health and safety training, school and facility improvements, and other expenditures in the program's infrastructure. 

In 2016, we are planning on offering a similar program in France, which will add to the capital needs of IMPACT-LLS Inc. Your donation in this area provides our board with more resources to produce the finest language immersion program experience.

Future Expansion will also include sites in Montevideo, Uruguay, Quetzaltenango, Guatemala, San Jose, Costa Rica, China, Haiti, and other French speaking countries in Africa.

Please have a look at our program video and visit our website. We are looking to change how language is learned and we hope that you choose to be an agent for change with us. Help us expand our offerings and be a part of the solution!

story:
Hi friends and family! As most of you know, my name is Leah Hodgkiss and this summer, I'll be spending three weeks of my time in Costa Rica through an organization called Global Leadership Adventures (they're closely associated with the Peace Corps). There, I will be working in local schools and orphanages to help educate kids on basic learning essentials in school as well as in life. Not only will I get to completely broaden my horizons into a totally new culture, but I'll get to establish new relationships and connections that will resonate with me for the rest of my life.

What I need:

  • Specifically, I need to raise $4,899. There's an extra $800 or so for airfare.
  • I'm not just going to Costa Rica to spend time in the beautiful region and sightsee. I'm going to be working, and living with the local people. Every little bit you could donate to my cause would mean the world :)

The Impact

A lot led to me signing up for this trip. Again, as most of you know, this year has been quite a rollercoaster for me. I've had my ups and my downs, but I've spent the majority of this year in treatment for an array of internal monsters pestering away at me. From my journey, I've learned a lot. About myself, the world around me, and my peers. I've learned how far a little kindness can get you. I've learned how much a little kindness can mean to someone else. And I've learned how a little bit of compassion can make a big difference. Also, from this journey, I've discovered that I have an innate pull to help people. I want to educate others in every way I can; I want to spend my time brightening other people's days and futures as much as I am possibly able to do. This strong pull that I've felt is what led me to signing up for this trip. I want to make a difference in the lives of these kids, whether it's just giving them a fun, care-free few hours, or teaching them some educational necesseties that could further their progress and help them for the remainder of their educational career. I'd appreciate it immensely if you all wouldn't mind donating any amount at all; every little bit counts! If you choose not to, or you are not able, thank you for taking the time to read this and please keep me in your thoughts as I travel! 


Risks & Challenges

  • I know it's an incredibly large amount of money. 
  • Like I've mentioned, I've struggled with an array of monsters. One of these is anxiety. As I'm sure a lot of you know, anxiety is an incredibly crippling disorder. I've been working to get a grasp on my anxiety and I've been doing really well, but this trip will still be a challenge for me. I believe the impact I will make on these kids' lives will overpower any anxiety I may face along the way, and I'm excited to rise to the challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share my message and spread the word about my fundraising campaign!
  • Keep me in your thoughts and send me, and my group, good energies!

Thank you all SO MUCH for taking the time to visit this page, and thank you in advance for any donations or thoughts you send my way!

story:
Anyone that I've ever discussed animal training with, on any level, knows my dedication and passion not only to be the best and most effective, but to continue to advance the profession of animal training, by finding the least invasive methods, always.

If you have ever been a client of mine or a friend, family member, or coworker that had to sit through me explaining the process by which I'm crate training my gecko, station training my leopard tortoise, or using functional rewards to tame a uromastyx, you know this passion extends beyond dogs, to which I have given 15 years of my heart, to all species, big and small.  

There are two conferences that I will be attending mid April. These two conferences will provide a tremendous amount of educational growth for me personally and professionally. They are The Ethics for Creating Motivation in Animal Training Symposium, in Sweden, April 11 & 12 and the ABMA Conference in Denmark, April 13-18.

Every year, it seems like the world shrinks a little more, and incredible learning opportunities are more and more found outside of the states, This is one of those opportunities for me.   The Ethics Symposium hits on so many topics that are so close to my heart, I feel like it was created just for me.  The ABMA Conference is packed with information that will help me grow professionally.  I need to do this and am willing to work my butt off in the next two months to make this happen. 

Please, help me get there!

My love and understanding of animals has long informed my art.  Now I'm counting on my art to help me further inform my knowledge regarding animals.   I can't wait to create something for each of you.

story:
Sunday Times article about Oceanic Conservation Murals!
http://www.sundaytimes.lk/150222/plus/bringing-...

Two steps to Marine conservation in Sri Lanka.

1 - Painting huge scale Oceanic conservation murals in public places.
2 - Workshops in schools about marine Life.

109 children make a full scale 30m blue whale!  

By educating the people and helping them to recognise marine life, you are helping Marine conservation.

Please donate to this project!

Fact!

Most Sri Lankan's don't swim in the sea, and those that do can't afford a mask to experience the beauty of the underwater world. Most Sri Lankan's can't recognise the animals who inhabit their oceans. They don't know about the blue whale, the whale shark, the leather back turtle... They don't know about the pollution that is slowly killing the animals and us ... They don't know about conservation and what they can do to save their oceanic heritage.

For the next year I will be working hand in hand with Ocean Heritage Trust - OHT, on an Oceanic Conservation Murals project all over Sri Lanka.

'Rose Robin has joined forces with a Sri Lankan Organization, ‘Ocean Heritage Trust’ (OHT), a group of scientific oceanic researchers from Sri Lanka. The OHT was founded by Roshan Abeywickrama, coral ecologist, whose ambition is to encourage a greater understanding in Sri Lanka about the ocean that surrounds it. He believes that an understanding of marine life will inspire love and appreciation for the ocean, then conservation will follow naturally.' - See more at: http://www.nation.lk/edition/fine/people-and-events/item/38080-french-artist-rose-robin-joins-forces-with-sri-lankan-organization.html#sthash.HzfB7IPu.dpuf

The Plan of action!

  • Painting huge scale Oceanic conservation murals, with images of marine life and it habitats.  Like this one in Colombo: 
  • Teaching artistic projects in schools about marine life around Sri Lanka. painting oceanic murals with the children.
  • Working with the private sector: hotels, businesses, tourist agencies... using their public walls for the murals.
  • Working with government agencies: hospitals, schools, universities... Getting permission to paint along the highways and busy roads. 

Help!

Don't be embarrassed to send this fundraiser to your friends. It's about doing something by helping innocent people understand why it is important today, to change certain ways of life. So that endangered animals don't disappear forever. 
Please donate what you can, it will make a difference!   
You will be making a difference not just to today but for generations to come... And not just in Sri Lanka, some of these animals visit your lands and your waters as well, the water in the ocean surrounding the island Sri Lanka comes to your shores also.

budget for one year.

3 day workshop - 100 euros    x 12 =  1200 euros
mural - 250 euros     x 12 = 3000 euros
travel, room and broad   = 800 euros
total = 5000 euros
