KANGA FABRIC / NOTEBOOKS / POUCHES

KANGA - COVER KIDS PROJECT

The cover kids program will officially launch in September, 2015 and you will be receiving the first notebooks made by a collaboration of women and students in the United States and Tanzania.  Cover Kids will be launched for sale for the 2015 holiday season to support women and girls projects in Tanzania, and a sustainable to business - proceeds to fund the secondary education of Sinai school graduates, other schools in Tanzania and Babati students.

ARAFA INTERACTS WITH A WOMAN IN HER GHENT COMMUNITY WHO TRAVELS TO TANZANIA, PURCHASES KANGA FABRIC FROM STREET WOMEN AND CREATES TOTES AND POUCHES PICTURED ABOVE.

MASSAI EARRINGS/ BLANKETS / BOWLS


LIMITED EDITION CHRIS MARTIN PRINTS

(IMAGE 1 - TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK SUNSET - BLUE SKY)

(IMAGE 2 - TARNAGIRE NATIONAL PARK - SUNSET)

(IMAGE 3 - LAKE BABATI SUNSET)

(IMAGE 4 - JEEP IN BABATI, TANZANIA)

(IMAGE 5 - GIRAFFES - THE NATIONAL ANIMAL OF TANZANIA)

(IMAGE 6 - ELEPHANTS AT TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK)

(IMAGE 7 - LION AT TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK)

Background - The Sinai School
story_txt:
The Education of Arafa and the Sinai Scholars Program, Babati, TanzaniaWhen Arafa's father Jumanne gave permission for Arafa to leave her village in Tanzania and travel to the United States, he told her "be like an open door for other girls to pass through." Arafa - only 13 years old then, has worked hard, and is indeed living up to that blessing and challenge. She is now in ninth grade and on track to graduate with her class in 2018. We need help to keep the door open for Arafa and open doors for girls to get quality secondary education in Tanzania.  THIS FUNDRAISER WILL BE THE ONLY ONE FOR ARAFA AND THE SINAI SCHOLARS PROGRAM TO REACH THE END OF THEIR HIGH SCHOOL - end of 2018!
This November, 2013 picture is at the doorway of Arafa's home in Babati, next to the Sinai school.  I am speaking with Arafa, her mother Tatu and father Jumanne are in the doorway (holding on to her 2 year old brother Omari), and a Hawthorne Valley student Ali Reinhold is kneeling next to Arafa's sister, Sabrina (who is now a 1st grader at Sinai school).  On this trip, Arafa was Skype interviewed by the Hawthorne Valley School and a formal acceptance letter was sent the next day.Arafa's Commitment to You - In Her Own WordsI promise to study hard and to be kind.  I will stay grateful every day.  I miss home but I need this chance.  I want this chance and know one day I'm gong to change the world.My husband and I founded WaterPowerPeace, a sister school initiative that connects schools and students in the United States with schools in Tanzania.  We launched the program by building a playground that generates power, able to pump clean water and provide lights and charging ability for a school in the developing world.  I met Arafa in 2008 when she was 7 years old, a student at the Sinai School Primary School, in Babati, Tanzania. She became my daughter Grace's pen pal.On our first visit to Sinai school, the "round trip" to the nearest water source was over one mile - it didn't have a sanitary seal, flooded and was shared by many users.  The children ages 4 - 13, lost hours of class time walking for water each day.  The school didn't have electricity, kindergarten classroom, teacher training, gardens or books.  We selected the Sinai school for our pilot program because of kids like Arafa - the 900 Sinai school students had something special - curiosity, problem solving, joy, and a love of school.  The Sinai school happened to have a devoted principal, Mr. Walter, involved parents and dedicated teachers.  They lacked resources but were rich in the qualities we felt mattered: trust, integrity, work ethic and optimism.  I have never heard a Sinai student say, "I don't want to go to school today" and we knew that our kids could learn a lot from this culture, these kids and this community.  It has always been our philosophy that we are not "helping" them but we are enriching each other - building bridges through a shared purpose and our priority remains Water First, then Power (in the form of electricity, playground, solar or simply education), then Peace follows (in the form of friendship, love and joy).My husband John meeting Arafa for the first time in 2008 at the Sinai Primary School in Babati, Tanzania.   At this point, these students had never encountered an English speaking person from America!In our first year of the sister school model curriculum, the students at Woodland Hill Montessori School working with the students from the Sinai school in Tanzania created a movie, art exhibit, photography exhibit and held a ten item auction.  The model was a success and the 2009 Earth Day exhibit raised enough money for us get water for the school, but also donate books, build a library, hire a kindergarten teacher, support English lessons for the teachers and more.  Please take the time to view the original movies created by these pioneers.  Links below and feel free to share them - several of the student movies have since won awards and one 14 year old American student won a prestigious National Geographic award for his photo of a Sinai school student taken in 2012 while he volunteered on a summer project trip.THE WATER PROJECT MOVIE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ti5i0j0tRnQOn our third trip to Babati in 2009, we brought 5 middle school age students from Woodland Hill Montessori School in East Greenbush, New York and installed the first pump to bring water to the Sinai school. One of those students, Ali Reinhold, returned to Babati in 2012 - this time with 18 students from the Capital Region.  The 2012 projects included a drip irrigation system, a new library, an art and movie room, computer lab and lessons, reading and spelling programs.  A garden was planted to sustain the lunch program.  By the end of 2012, the Sinai school was unrecognizable and its progress was reflected in what mattered most, the students' grades and future educational opportunities and connected communities. This photo from 2009 shows Sherrie Clune, an upper elementary teacher we sponsored (one of four) to visit the Sinai school and gather information to bring back and inspire their students to undertake "the Water Project."   Working with the students (Arafa pictured) we renovated several classrooms, installed a hand washing station and conducted a geographical survey to find suitable water source.

We have sponsored teachers from Sinai school to visit the United States in 2009 and 2011.  During one of those visits, the Hawthorne Valley School offered a scholarship to a deserving Sinai school student. Ali Reinhold, a senior at Hawthorne Valley, spearheaded a campaign to bring Arafa to the United States and we helped make that happen. Arafa successfully completed 8th grade and is now a thriving ninth grader. 



Ali Reinhold, now a college freshman at Wells, travelled to Tanzania in 2009 with the first middle school volunteer trip.  A true ambassador for girls education, she has returned four more times, and spearheaded a campaign to help bring Arafa to study in America on a full scholarship at Hawthorne Valley Waldorf School.
In Ali's words:When I first visited the Sinai School at the age of thirteen, I immediately knew that my life was going to change. Little did I know how much. I have now traveled to Babati five times and, throughout these journeys, I have gained a little sister in Arafa, an extended family on the other side of the world, and a passion for empowerment through education. Arafa has truly inspired so many people, both in the US and in Tanzania. I am so thankful that she is part of my life, and to all of the people who have made made it possible thus far. I have grown to care so much for her and all of the students at the Sinai School, and I want opportunities (like those of the scholarships) to remain possible.
If you would like to see how this all transpired, please click the link below and spend a few minutes watching this video I compiled to document the process: https://youtu.be/_8W3x2zc8H4


Arafa pictured here at her 8th Grade Graduation with her first tutor, Kevin Wade, who spent over four months in Tanzania to prepare Arafa for her visa and to travel, and spent her first summer vacation to visit her family in Babati so Arafa didn't lose her progress on learning English.

In connection with Arafa's scholarship, we began a Sinai scholars program so that the top girl and boy of each class can attend private secondary eduction. Ten other children receive bicycles, allowing them to get to the secondary school which is over 10 kilometers away.  The kids know that beginning year 5, their grades are being counted for these awards and we push them to grab the brass ring - an education!

Arafa not only dreams of graduating High School here in the United States, she is aiming for University and Law School! It's her dream to empower girls from her village, her country, and here in the United States to dream big and start small, study hard, and get an education.  
Arafa graduated 8th grade and is currently getting all As and B+ during her 9th grade.  Pictured below - a very proud community celebrates her 8th grade graduation last June.





What Your Donated Funds Will Cover:
1st Priority:  School Fees
Hawthorne Valley School donated a five year scholarship to Arafa, allowing her to complete eighth grade and four years of High School.  Arafa's school fees for High School are $2,500 per year. (total $10,000).  
2nd Priority:  Summer School and Tutoring
Although Arafa's English improves everyday, she needs help to fill some gaps in her primarily education and improve her English.  She now understands and speaks fluently, but needs tutoring and summer programs to assist her English skills.  We'd also like to hire a computer and math tutor.  $2,000 per year. (total $8,000)
3rd Priority:  Arafa's Direct Expenses 
When Arafa came to upstate New York, she'd never owned a winter coat or a textbook.  Arafa loves sports and is a talented athlete, member of the soccer team and interested in swimming, dance and theater.  She also calls home to her family every Sunday. Her current host family generously provides room and board and more importantly their love and support.  $2,000 per year. (total $6,000)

4th Priority: Educating Girls, Inspiring Excellence
Sinai Scholars - We've been working with the Sinai school for over seven years and the selection of one student to study in the New York was balanced with the unmet needs of all children graduating.  There are approximately 100 Sinai students each year who graduate 7th grade and can't afford secondary school or lack access to quality secondary education.  Working with community leaders, we put in place selection criteria to choose one boy and one girl to attend a private school in Tanzania - cost $1,000 per year (including room and board).    At full strength, the program requites $9,000 per year.  (total for 2 years - $18,000)


5th Priority: Bicycles for Babati Secondary Scholars
Sinai Scholars - A program inspired by our daughter Grace, who saved her change for one year to help Arafa.  This was enough to fund 10 bicycles for the graduating 7th year primary students (12-13 years old).  The public secondary school is located over ten kilometers away, without water or electricity.  The bicycle program provides transportation, and inspiration for the the three years prior to graduation for the students to study and perform.  Many students, especially girls end their education at age 13 because it is difficult to get to school.  This helps. $800 per year (total $2,400).
6th Priority:  Arafa's Travel to be Home for Ramadan 
We don't let Arafa travel alone, but will volunteer our time and expenses, including our airfare to accompany her.  The average airfare to Tanzania is $1,750 in the summer and her village is several hours from the airport.  $2,000 per year (total $8,000).
Always A Priority - Sinai School Girls
There are multiple projects that need support and our goal is to make them sustainable.  The girls are in need of new latrines, washrooms and while the school now has water, solar panels would help reduce the cost of the pump.
Total: $50,400  (will cover programs until 2018)
Funds raised in excess of our goal are needed and we commit to spend them on continued support of Arafa and the Sinai Scholars and in particular, supporting the education of girls.  The Sinai school is in desperate need of new latrines / toilets for the girls as well as books.  We aim to install solar panels to decrease electricity costs next summer.  If at all possible, we'd like to make it possible for all Sinai students to gain access to secondary education.  We remain open to questions and accountable, and welcome volunteers for current and future projects.  Our Commitment to You: Every dollar donated will be put to the use stated here and for the education of Arafa and the children of Babati.  If you'd like to provide us your email, we will send regular updates and keep you informed of the students' and Arafa's progress to graduation from High School and beyond.




Perks Photo Section
Karma - watch the movies and help us spread the word and be sure to check out the gallery for more videos, pictures and updates on the campaign!

KANGA - COVER KIDS PROJECT
The cover kids program will officially launch in September, 2015 and you will be receiving the first notebooks made by a collaboration of women and students in the United States and Tanzania.  Cover Kids will be launched for sale for the 2015 holiday season to support women and girls projects in Tanzania, and a sustainable to business - proceeds to fund the secondary education of Sinai school graduates, other schools in Tanzania and Babati students.

ARAFA INTERACTS WITH A WOMAN IN HER GHENT COMMUNITY WHO TRAVELS TO TANZANIA, PURCHASES KANGA FABRIC FROM STREET WOMEN AND CREATES TOTES AND POUCHES PICTURED ABOVE.

The Aaronjiii Book Scholarship Program was created to assist students with the high cost of textbooks & study materials. The awards of up to $500 will be offered each semester (beginning Spring 2015) and are open to individuals attending Jackson State University who are members of the Sonic Boom of the South Marching Band. The scholarship will be awarded based on review of essays and the demonstration of need.

Students can apply for the book awards at aaronjiii.com/scholarships

story:
Who Am I?

My Name is Afrikanus Kofi Akosah, I’m the Founding President of Africa Youth Peace Call, (AYPC), an independent, non-profit, research and educational organisation devoted to the principles of individual liberty, secure private property rights, free markets, the rule of law, limited government, and government non-interference in the economy.


Since 2008 we have been running the Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camps in Winter & Summer. The camps create the platform for young Africans to discover the philosophy of Liberty, and gain knowledge of entrepreneurship skills. In an era where youth unemployment has become a chronic headache in Africa as a result of weak Economic Liberty. The camp offers a rare opportunity for the youth to start businesses & institutions for political reforms.


Short Summary

Northern Ghana is the poorest part of the country. Although there’s rich land in
abundance, people cannot leverage their land to, for instance, borrow money for education or starting businesses, or secure it for their children or spouses if something happens, because they have no land titles to prove the ownership of the land. This creates a lack of financial mobility, and often violent conflicts. Land titles can be done on the Bitcoin blockchain, at a very minimal costs, and without the involvement of centralized institutions. It's an unprecedented opportunity to free millions of people from poverty.


Therefore our Summer Camp is focusing on how the Blockchain Technology can be used to issue land titles. It will take place from May 31 - June 5, 2015 i n the Northern City of Tamale (Pronounced Tamal3) and the theme is 'Liberating Northern Ghana Economically: The Blockchain to the Rescue’.

The Impact

We are working together with BITNATION, the traditional rulers, and the people of the North to use the Blockchain Technology to issue land titles in the north this year. BITNATION has completed the first Land Title Test on the Bitcoin Blockchain in Ghana, and is working together with Ilocater, a Danish Land Survey company, to find the best model to build the BITLAND DApp including cheap survey equipment, which will be available on the BITNATION platform. AYPC will educate the youth, so they can do these DIY Governance blockchain applications themselves. 


Throughout the week participants will learn entrepreneurship skills, explore the social and economic benefits of a secure private property regime, coupled with land titles, corporate incorporation, smart contracts and more, and how the Blockchain Technology can deliver that on the cheap. They will be assisted to draw an Action Plan to educate their communities to facilitate their cooperation and smooth implementation of the Land Title Project.

 Our Blockchain Titles Ambassadors will form a network to educate the communities about the Bitcoin Blockchain Technology, and how to use it. Time will be set aside as Cryptocurrency/Blockchain Business Opportunities Day. This will enable participants to explore the business side of Bitcoin/Blockchain, and how to start their own profitable ventures with it.
Movement like Prof. Steve Horwitz, Roger Ver (BitCoin Jesus), Susanne Tarkowski Templehof, Dr. Tom G. Palmer, Dr. Lawrence Reed, Prof. Ken Schoolland, Kwadwo Afari, Jacob Hornberger, Rui Nobre Pinheiro, Afrikanus Kofi Akosah, Narigamba Mwinsuubo, Ajibola Adigun, Lode Cossaer, Chris Lingle, Gregory V. Diehl, Noel Berge, Max Borders, and Jeffrey Tucker etc. Some of them will be at the location whilst others will teach via video conference. 
AYPC has years of experience organizing conferences and seminars together with ATLAS Network, Students For Liberty etc. 

What We Need & What You Get


 It will cost $12,000 USD to provide accommodation, Food, Transport & Learning materials for 40 students throughout the week. Students are contributing half of the cost with half coming from your kind donations. We are therefore raising $6000 to make the camp a reality.

300 friends of Liberty & Bitcoin donating $20 each will see us through. Don't forget, if you can't donate you can spread the word. 
Bitcoin donations are also accepted: 1Ne4pw8swxcpWfZhKpkXE5UYphUyBhGBXT. 
Thank you good people! Help us Absolish Poverty & Tyranny in Africa.

story:
About The Clay School

The Clay School of Ithaca is committed to providing a vibrant, creative space for community members to work with clay and learn alongside fellow artists from professional to emerging potters. Our goal is to foster a sense of community among students of all ages and enrich their continuing education through shared experiences around making art.

Enlisting a cadre of well established potters in the area, who have decades of combined teaching experience, The Clay School of Ithaca is able to offer a variety of class descriptions, techniques, and approaches to working with clay. Students may choose to concentrate on wheel throwing, hand-building methods, surface decoration, and functional work. Monthly shelf rental is available to experienced students. And there are weekend and one-day workshops offered throughout the year for locals and out of town students as well.

Community Impact

After the closing of the Cornell Ceramics Studio in 2011, the Ithaca community lacks a place to bring students of all ages together to learn from a collective group of professional and emerging potters as teachers. The Clay School of Ithaca is being established to offer an open and collaborative environment for beginner and experienced ceramists, of all ages, to learn and creatively express themselves.

After a long search for adequate and affordable square footage, Julia Dean, a former instructor at the Cornell Studio, is moving her own ceramic production studio, JULIA e. DEAN, Inc., from the basement of her home to a new space large enough to support her business and The Clay School of Ithaca’s teaching studio. 

Meet The Staff 

Julia Dean:

My love affair with clay started at the age of 10 when I watched a potter work on the wheel.  It wasn’t until college, however, that I took my first pottery class. With a degree in Education from Murray State University, I combined a passion for creating and love of teaching by sharing this craft in studios in Texas, North Carolina and New York. I have continued my education over the years at Texas Christian University, Penland School of Crafts, and Chautauqua Institution.  

As a designer, I am committed to creating quality, stylish and affordable handmade pottery. As a loyal member of my local community, I am proud to be a Certified Living Wage Employer.

Classes will also be taught by the talented Tess Lawlor, Diane Sullivan, Julie Crosby (not pictured), Hannah Graeper, Gary Rith (not pictured), Tiana Trost (not pictured), Cary Joseph (not pictured) David Kingsbury, Tom Roach,  and studio manager Bri Richardson.

Our Progress So Far 

I've found the perfect space to call The Clay School of Ithaca home! On February 5th, I signed a lease at the South Hill Business Campus on Danby Road in Ithaca. I’m now working with an architect to remodel and design the space into the ideal ceramic studio. While I’ll be the head teacher at The Clay School of Ithaca , I’ve put together a team of extremely talented artists to help teach classes and lead workshops. We’ve also developed a class schedule featuring ten to twelve classes per week.We are in the construction phase and will open and begin teaching in September 2015. 
 

Why We Need Your Help! 

Even though we’ve made great strides towards opening The Clay School, we still need your help. In order to fully equip the new space, we’re going to need $40,000 for equipment. This is our last step towards opening The Clay School of Ithaca. 

Equipment List: 

  • Bats
  • Extruder
  • Tools
  • 11 wheels
  • 3 kilns
  • 20 Carts
  • 10 Barstools
  • Boards for Carts
  • Slab Roller Canvas
  • Stand-up Slab Roller
  • Glazing Table
  • Industrial Vacuum
  • 12 Glaze Containers
  • Clay Mixer
  • Pallet Jacket
  • Security Fencing
  • Sinks
  • Clay and Glaze Supplies
  • 3 Sets of Replacement Elements and Thermocouples
  • Shipping Fees

story:
What is GlowSaber Physics

As technology becomes more entrenched in our everyday lives, the need for scientists, engineers, and designers increases. We believe that using our fun hands-on approach to introduce physics and engineering will inspire more young men and women into these careers.

Unlike traditional teaching methods, our innovative approach simultaneously teaches students physics, design, and engineering while they create a project right out of pop culture.

Students grades 7-10th will construct their own working GlowSaber swords, all while learning about electronics, light, sound, design, and programming. By getting hands-on experience building their own GlowSaber, students will be able to better relate to applied science, physics, and engineering, motivating them to pursue more advanced projects.

Having tested and completed 6 different GlowSabers, we have developed a curriculum that introduces students to the field of physics, engineering, and design and we have a pilot program scheduled with the Alameda Education Foundation this Fall where we will lead two classes with 12 students each.

We need $15,000 for the pilot

To ensure that the pilot program is successful, GlowSaber Physics needs $15,000 to fund the acquisition of the materials required to build the GlowSaber. We are the designers of the printed circuit boards (in purple above), and they are manufactured in the USA.

We also need to invest in a one time acquisition of a seven workstations that include required items like a soldering iron, multimeter, hand tools, prototyping board, assorted electronic components for experiments, etc.

The goal will then be to start promoting GlowSaber Physics across the SF Bay Area, California and beyond.


Our team

Carlos Vadillo, the creator and originator of the idea. Studied Civil Engineering and Computer Science in his native Mexico. He has been working as a software engineer mostly for start up companies for the past 42 years. He taught college level math and mechanics and led a model airplane project for elementary and middle school students in Alameda.
Bx Dawes, is a content creator and editor.  She is a User Experience (UX) designer by trade, having studied both Physics and Psychology.  Her work experience includes a physics internship at Jefferson Labs, fMRI and PET analyst at NIMH, and a Project Lead for Wells Fargo UX standards documentation.  A lover of math and science, she jumped at the opportunity to help inspire the next generation of scientists and engineers.
story_txt:
What is GlowSaber Physics
As technology becomes more entrenched in our everyday lives, the need for scientists, engineers, and designers increases. We believe that using our fun hands-on approach to introduce physics and engineering will inspire more young men and women into these careers.
Unlike traditional teaching methods, our innovative approach simultaneously teaches students physics, design, and engineering while they create a project right out of pop culture.Students grades 7-10th will construct their own working GlowSaber swords, all while learning about electronics, light, sound, design, and programming. By getting hands-on experience building their own GlowSaber, students will be able to better relate to applied science, physics, and engineering, motivating them to pursue more advanced projects.
Having tested and completed 6 different GlowSabers, we have developed a curriculum that introduces students to the field of physics, engineering, and design and we have a pilot program scheduled with the Alameda Education Foundation this Fall where we will lead two classes with 12 students each.
We need $15,000 for the pilotTo ensure that the pilot program is successful, GlowSaber Physics needs $15,000 to fund the acquisition of the materials required to build the GlowSaber. We are the designers of the printed circuit boards (in purple above), and they are manufactured in the USA.We also need to invest in a one time acquisition of a seven workstations that include required items like a soldering iron, multimeter, hand tools, prototyping board, assorted electronic components for experiments, etc.The goal will then be to start promoting GlowSaber Physics across the SF Bay Area, California and beyond.Our team

Carlos Vadillo, the creator and originator of
the idea. Studied Civil Engineering and Computer Science in his native Mexico. He has been working as a software engineer mostly for start up companies for the
past 42 years. He taught college level math and mechanics and led a model airplane project for elementary and middle school students in Alameda.

Bx Dawes, is a content creator and editor.  She is a User Experience (UX) designer by trade,
having studied both Physics and Psychology.  Her work experience includes a physics internship at Jefferson Labs, fMRI and PET analyst at NIMH, and
a Project Lead for Wells Fargo UX standards documentation.  A lover of math and science, she jumped at the
opportunity to help inspire the next generation of scientists and engineers.

story:
Друзья, мы просим Вашей помощи в организации и проведении Тотального Диктанта 18 апреля 2015 года в Лондоне. Из-за масштабов организуемой нами акции мы нуждаемся в спонсорской поддержке этого проекта. Все собранные средства пойдут на:

- необходимые материалы для проведения Тотального Диктанта (бланки, ручки)

- поддержку волонтеров во время проведения Тотального Диктанта (питание, транспортные расходы)

- поддержку филологов во время проверки диктантов (питание, транспортные расходы)

- освещение события (сми и рекламные материалы)


Вы можете поддержать нас здесь или обратиться по за дополнительной информацией о сотрудничестве по totaldictlondon@gmail.com 


Что такое Тотальный диктант?

Тотальный диктант - ежегодная образовательная акция, призванная привлечь внимание к вопросам грамотности и развить культуру грамотного письма. Суть акции - добровольный бесплатный диктант для всех желающих, который проходит одновременно в сотнях городов России и мира (с поправкой на часовые пояса).

Тотальный диктант - это своеобразный флеш-моб. Незнакомые друг с другом люди узнают об акции в Интернете, собираются в одно время в одном месте, совместно делают нечто странное и расходятся.

http://totaldict.ru/cities/london/

https://www.facebook.com/events/458455097639511/

Цель Тотального диктанта - заставить людей задуматься, насколько они грамотны, и привить желание эту грамотность повышать.

Если раньше начитанность и навык грамотного письма были связаны с понятием «высокого», «элитного», «уважаемого», то теперь потребительская культура изменила ориентиры: «культурность» и, в частности, грамотность стали принадлежностью образа «неудачника», «зануды» и связаны в представлении молодежи со скукой и школьной «обязаловкой», в частности, с пресловутой формой диктанта.

Тотальный диктант призван разрушить этот стереотип и распространить моду на грамотность. Мы хотим показать, что писать грамотно - круче, чем неграмотно. Что умение правильно расставить запятые - обязательный признак по-настоящему успешного, уверенного в себе человека.

Задачи проекта: 

  • привлечь внимание СМИ и общества к проблеме грамотности;

  • дать возможность всем желающим проверить свою грамотность в ходе добровольного диктанта;

  • повысить уровень грамотности участников с помощью «пятиминуток ликбеза» и разбора ошибок;

  • повысить статус владения языковыми навыками, распространить моду на грамотность.

Девиз Тотального диктанта: «Писать грамотно – это модно!»


Being literate is cool! Will you accept the Russian language challenge? 

 Total Dict is Russian language quiz! It is a program aimed at promoting literacy among Russian speakers. Designed by students of the Novosibirsk State University in 2004, the event has been attracting an increasing number of participating cities and this year, on April 18, it is expected to bring together over 30 thousand people from more than 450 cities across the world - including the Russian Antarctic Expedition! 

 It is free, anonymous (if desired) and voluntary. Professional approach of the expert board and enthusiasm of the organizing committee make the Total Dict a great event to take part in. What is more important, it allows people to re-think the value of the Russian language in their life and test their knowledge. 

 For those who live outside their motherland it is quite hard to maintain a high command of the language: you do not have access to the great variety of books publish in Russian and quite often do not have anyone to practice speaking Russian with. This is why we see the Total Dict event as a great opportunity to make people more engaged with their language and culture.

 Total Dict will be held simultaneously in all participating cities around the world (with time zone adjustment). Moreover, it will be broadcast live on the Internet so that anyone who cannot make it to the designated venue on the day could still take part and get their language skills tested. 

 After the event the works will be marked by the expert committee comprised of linguists, teachers and academics and the results will be made available online (every participant will receive a special code allowing them to access their marks). Besides, there will be an opportunity for everyone to consult an expert about the mistakes they have made!

About EWIAP!

Association football, better known as football or soccer, is the world's most popular sport. English is the most useful language in the world, without competition. Also Spanish is the second language most studied around the world and the third one among the most popular on the Internet. What if you could combine all three? I am humbled to be able to have created the combination. 

I love education and It is amazing how for maybe 10 years or more, my personal slogan has always been, "Educator/Entrepreneur". To be able to combine the two is always my goal and I believe that EWIAP soccer ball is a great part of this. 

About Murice Damion Miller!

My name is Murice Damion Miller. My family and I work and Volunteer at DayStar Adventist Academy in Castle Valley/Moab, UT. It has been a great blessing to reside here the last three years. This town is a seasonal town and from March to October of each year thousands from around the world visit for various outdoor activities. With this product, I plan to create year round jobs for the residents. They have been a blessing to my family and I seek to continually be a blessing to them as well. Thank you for helping us in this journey. 

How you could help!

With your contribution, I will accomplish the following:

1. Order the customized soccer balls with the english and spanish phrases as well as the product information.

2. Order the packaging for the soccer balls for professional delivery.

3. Process the rewards which are below:

Perks:


 

Acerca EWIAP!

El fútbol de asociación, más conocido como fútbol o fútbol, es el deporte más popular del mundo. Inglés es el idioma más útil en el mundo, sin competencia. También el español es el segundo idioma más estudiado en el mundo y el tercero entre los más populares en Internet. ¿Y si pudiera combinar los tres? Me siento muy honrado de poder han creado la combinación.

Me encanta la educación y es increíble cómo durante unos 10 años o más, mi lema personal siempre ha sido, "Educador / Emprendedor". Para ser capaz de combinar los dos es siempre mi objetivo y creo que el balón de fútbol EWIAP es una gran parte de esto.

Acerca Murice Damion Miller!

Mi nombre es Murice Damion Miller. Mi familia y yo trabajamos y voluntario en DayStar Academia Adventista en Castle Valley / Moab, Utah. Ha sido una gran bendición para residir aquí los últimos tres años. Esta ciudad es una ciudad de temporada y de marzo a octubre de cada año a miles de todo el mundo visitan para diversas actividades al aire libre. Con este producto, tengo la intención de crear puestos de trabajo durante todo el año para los residentes. Ellos han sido una bendición para mi familia y yo tratar de estar continuamente en una bendición para ellos también. Gracias por ayudarnos en este viaje.

story:
You can help Rick, Guy and Vince fly to the opening of the Spaceship Institute in Bari, Italy, and meet with Mr Keshe of the Keshe Foundation!

We three friends have been dedicated volunteers with the Keshe Foundation for several years, and we produce the Knowledge Seekers Workshops series...

Now, we have the honour of being personally invited to the official opening ceremonies of the new Keshe Foundation Spaceship Institute (KFSSI)  near Bari, Italy!

What a great opportunity, as this event will mark the beginning of great changes        to be brought forward by KFSSI in its interactions with the world.

The opening is on April 23 2015, so we need funds immediately, for airfare to Europe and associated expenses, of at least $2000 per person.

Many thanks to those generous souls who choose to support this trip!

Cheers, Rick


A note from Vince...

It has been my honour to spend the last couple years with the friends here.  With helping to spread the knowledge, we try to help all understand a little more about the universe (that includes YOU).  We have dedicated ourselves to understanding the universe, and where we come from, and we find ourselves finding friends from all over the world.  We thank you for the journey so far, yet there is much more to come!

The opening of the Keshe Foundation Spaceship Institute, is something that Rick, Guy and myself have dreamed of happening for a very long time, to be able to have the resources and ability to have the technology taught to everyone.  As we have helped with the spreading of the knowledge, getting to participate in the opening ceremonies would be a proud moment in my life, as well as Rick and Guy, I'm sure.

Thank you all for your support along the way, and know that the cause is JUST and for humanity, not for us as individuals!

Love from my Soul, 

Vincent

story:
Good News, Bad News and Where I fit

The amazing software that is ArcGIS from Esri, is used throughout the world to manage agricultural practices, food security, climate change, national parks, conservation efforts, infrastructure mapping, disaster planning and recovery, and much, much more!

The cost of developing such software is high, so the software is expensive, which leaves few funds for training in critical skills.

I can do nothing about the software cost, but I can deliver, through the Discover Spatial eLearning platform, online training of high quality at a lower cost than traditional GIS vendor offerings. 

Opportunity

ArcGIS Pro has just been released, and in the next few years, over a million ArcMap users in the developing and developed worlds will be looking to upskill or re-skill in that next generation software.

Availability and cost of training in current versions of ArcGIS is typically a big problem for developing nations. Consequently, those who can least afford it usually pay the highest price for geospatial education.

I'm hoping that through your generous support, I may be able to create a library of affordable learning content and publish it online at Discover Spatial. My goal is to reach a world-wide audience - practically everyone with internet connection.

Why me?

I have been supporting, consulting and training in Esri’s flagship products for over 25 years, and have started my own sole trader business with that as my mission.

With 15 instructor-led one-day courses and half-day workshops, and 10 eLearning videos, already developed and released, I believe I have the right formula to rapidly provide English-speaking ArcGIS users, with the online ArcGIS Pro training that they need.   In the near future, with like-minded partners, I plan to begin releasing these same courses in other widely spoken languages such as Spanish.

My Proposal

To maintain quality, it takes me 5-10 hours, and often more, to develop each hour of training material.  Balancing the need to earn a living means that I am unable to bring these courses to market as quickly as I would like to. 

To help complete six new eLearning ArcGIS Pro videos, each of 60-90 minutes duration, I hope to raise $2,500 from your contributions.  That will allow me to keep training videos at very affordable prices - which is my main objective.  The ArcGIS Pro courses listed below (by their working titles) will sell via Discover Spatial for $19 each, or as a bundle, with a 12 minute Flying Start to ArcGIS Pro course that is already released, for just $79:

  1. Working with Projects and Maps in ArcGIS Pro - released on 14 May 2015!
  2. Layouts, Symbology
  3. Editing
  4. Geoprocessing, Tasks, ModelBuilder
  5. ArcPy, Python
  6. Sharing, ArcGIS Online

Your Perks

Just a $5 contribution entitles you to a coupon for free access to an already released twelve minute course: Flying Start to ArcGIS Pro. 

Contributions of $10 and over receive coupons on Discover Spatial eLearning courses developed by me, on a sliding scale of discounts from 48% to 67%. 

Now that could make quite a difference to your, or a not-for-profit’s, ArcGIS training budget!

The first of the six new courses (Working with Projects and Maps in ArcGIS Pro) has already been released to offer a way to redeem a $10 contribution without needing to wait:

Plus there are a few surprise perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute, you can still help by using the share tools of Indiegogo to help spread the word about my campaign!

story:
Do You know What Is the most common cause of Infertility in women worldwide ??? Awareness is the first step in fighting with any disorder ? the medical condition is called PCOS ??Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is the most common hormonal disorder among women of reproductive age. Infertility is one of the most common PCOS symptoms. Because the symptoms of PCOS are seemingly unrelated to one another, the condition is often overlooked and undiagnosed.

The World Health Organization estimates that it affects 116 million women worldwide as of 2010 (3.4% of women). One community-based prevalence study using the Rotterdam criteria found that about 18% of women had PCOS, and that 70% of them were previously undiagnosed. 

Now why awareness rearding the PCOS is needed ??

Signs and symptoms of PCOS usually appear at the onset of puberty when there’s a normal increase in insulin levels as part of human development. PCOS is linked to the development of chronic diseases later in life such as the metabolic syndrome type 2 diabetes, heart disease, hypertension, and endometrial cancer, so early recognition and treatment are critical to prevent these conditions. Because most adult women with PCOS aren’t diagnosed until after seeking help with infertility, early detection in adolescence could prevent financial and emotional hardships down the road. Many of the signs and symptoms of PCOS can be detrimental to a young woman’s body image, particularly weight gain, excessive hair growth on the face and body, dirty looking patches on the skin called acanthosis nigricans (all of which are clinical markers of hyperinsulinemia), and acne. Such symptoms can negatively impact the emotional health of adolescents at a time when self-image is developing. In addition, mood disorders are common among adolescent girls with PCOS.4 Such disorders typically stem from hormonal imbalances or struggles with body image. Not surprisingly, many girls with PCOS suffer from eating disorders as they attempt to manage their out-of-control weight gain, mood, and body image issues.

The complications of PCOS might Include 
Endometrial hyperplasia and endometrial cancer 
Insulin resistance/Type II diabetes
High blood pressure
Depression
Dyslipidemia
Cardiovascular disease,
Strokes
Weight gain
Miscarriage
Sleep apnea
Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease
Acanthosis nigricans 
Autoimmune thyroiditis

I am researching about Poly cystic Ovarian syndrome and its treatment from 10 years and I can say that One of the best treatments for PCOS is a healthy lifestyle.Evidence suggests that a moderate weight loss of 5% to 7% of total body weight may significantly improve symptoms and regulate menstrual function A healthy Special type of diet low in refined carbohydrates is important, as this can help regulate blood sugar levels. Some herbs and Naturopathic Formulation can help the patient more than drugs,Exercise can also help the body regulate insulin and keep excess weight off. Losing weight is challenging with PCOS, but doing so can help reduce the male hormone levels in the body, and some women will begin to ovulate naturally. With a proper diagnosis, lifestyle changes and PCOS treatment, women can get relief from this condition and the overwhelming health problems it can cause.

 

If PCOS is not treated properly, it can put a girl at risk for lots of problems. Girls with PCOS are more likely to have infertility, excessive hair growth, acne, obesity, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure, abnormal bleeding from the uterus, and cancer.

The good news is that, although there's no cure for PCOS, it can be treated. The most important step is diagnosing the condition, because getting treatment for PCOS reduces a girl's chances of developing serious problems.We can help many girls in leading a happy and normal life if it is diagnosed early,

Now let me introduce myself, Dr Surabhi Jain, Founder Of Nutriwell India , I am a Graduate from Medicine field  is one of the best nutrition and dietetics qualified in the business, with Ten plus years of academic exposure to the subject via formal, full-time, Bachelors and Masters Degrees. She also has in her credit MBA (Health care) and PGDPHN (Post Graduate Diploma In Public Health Nutrition from world acclaimed Institute Like PHFI ( Public Health Foundation Of India) and M. Sc ( Clinical Nutrition & Dietetics).    

I am a Nutrition activist and Nutrition advocate, I have the unique privilege of being the only nutritionist From Field of Medicine, with the most nutrition awards/accolades, amongst all the privately practicing nutritionists of the country.read some of the before and after  success stories here in PCOS http://www.nutriwellindia.com/before-after.aspx .I have done intense research in last ten years on PCOS Diet and Now my complete management of PCOS is simple , natural and easy. 

My Nutritional Consultancy Nutriwell ,has a key motto to provide comprehensive solutions to lifestyle and lifecycle related medical conditions through provision of Nutritional and Naturopathic Therapy. My unique Nutritional diet therapy is backed with guidance on use of Naturopathic formulations and easy to follow exercise regimes .My diet therapy is based on Regularizing, Detoxifying and rejuvenating every cell of the body. At the interventional level we provide Therapeutic and Preventive choices for weight management & common health related disorders .In Nutri well I help individuals to fight against specific illnesses as well as help them to change their day to day life style . One thing that this therapy does unlike most other therapies is to eliminate the very cause of an ailment rather than treating the symptoms.

How your Money will make difference 

Basically we want to create awareness regarding the condition. Prevention is always better  than a cure :)

If you Donate 100 $

We will arrange a Awareness activity for 20 girls and will send you all the details.

If you Donate 200 $ 

We will be more than happy to arrange a awareness Activity for one school.We will send you the complete details of the activity and its photographs.

If You donate 500 or 1000 $.

We can arrange an screening camp for PCOS. 

If we reach our goal of 20000 $ then we would run an extensive campaign regarding PCOS awareness and will be aable to reach and help more girls.We Plan to Open a complete PCOS center where Ladies/girls suffering from PCOS gets complete and Comprehensive treatment. Clinical Examination, Early Diagnosis, Dietary Modification , Motivational Counselling to address their emotional issues , and complete fitness guidance to be included in the PCOS Program. I am treating the PCOS clients from last ten Years and Results are very encouraging. My special Low glycemic Index diet does wonders in this condition. But as this condition is most neglected and Undiagnosed I want to create more awareness about it.I have set up my center 5 years back and It has gained lot of faith from the people. Now I want to help More ladies to fight with their PCOS naturally and Live a longer and happy life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially to our campaign but wish to help, please help us spread the word about our project.  Please share our campaign link via social media (using the Indiegogo share tools), by emailing a friend, or by using good old-fashioned word-of-mouth.

The time to act is now… If you know someone who is Infrequent or prolonged menstrual periods, excess hair growth, acne, and obesity can all occur in women with polycystic ovary syndrome. In adolescents, infrequent or absent menstruation may raise suspicion for the condition.take her to a doctor and get all the necessary tests done. Early diagnosis and treatment along with weight loss may reduce the risk of long-term complications, such as type 2 diabetes infertility and heart disease.You can gift her a healthy and happy future :)

We can only effect change by working together; we hope you’ll join us.

Our sincere thanks,

Surabhi jain
story_txt:
Do You know What Is the most common cause of Infertility in women worldwide ??? Awareness is the first step in fighting with any disorder ? the medical condition is called PCOS ??Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is the most common hormonal disorder among women of reproductive age. Infertility is one of the most common PCOS symptoms. Because the symptoms of PCOS are seemingly unrelated to one another, the condition is often overlooked and undiagnosed.The World Health Organization estimates that it affects 116 million women worldwide as of 2010 (3.4% of women). One community-based prevalence study using the Rotterdam criteria found that about 18% of women had PCOS, and that 70% of them were previously undiagnosed. Now why awareness rearding the PCOS is needed ??Signs and symptoms of PCOS usually appear at the onset of puberty when there’s a normal increase in insulin levels as part of human development. PCOS is linked to the development of chronic diseases later in life such as the metabolic syndrome type 2 diabetes, heart disease, hypertension, and endometrial cancer, so early recognition and treatment are critical to prevent these conditions. Because most adult women with PCOS aren’t diagnosed until after seeking help with infertility, early detection in adolescence could prevent financial and emotional hardships down the road. Many of the signs and symptoms of PCOS can be detrimental to a young woman’s body image, particularly weight gain, excessive hair growth on the face and body, dirty looking patches on the skin called acanthosis nigricans (all of which are clinical markers of hyperinsulinemia), and acne. Such symptoms can negatively impact the emotional health of adolescents at a time when self-image is developing. In addition, mood disorders are common among adolescent girls with PCOS.4 Such disorders typically stem from hormonal imbalances or struggles with body image. Not surprisingly, many girls with PCOS suffer from eating disorders as they attempt to manage their out-of-control weight gain, mood, and body image issues.The complications of PCOS might Include Endometrial hyperplasia and endometrial cancer Insulin resistance/Type II diabetesHigh blood pressureDepressionDyslipidemiaCardiovascular disease,StrokesWeight gainMiscarriageSleep apneaNon-alcoholic fatty liver diseaseAcanthosis nigricans Autoimmune thyroiditis
I am researching about Poly cystic Ovarian syndrome and its treatment from 10 years and I can say that One of the best treatments for PCOS is a healthy lifestyle.Evidence suggests that a moderate weight loss of 5% to 7% of total body weight may significantly improve symptoms and regulate menstrual function A healthy Special type of diet low in refined carbohydrates is important, as this can help regulate blood sugar levels. Some herbs and Naturopathic Formulation can help the patient more than drugs,Exercise can also help the body regulate insulin and keep excess weight off. Losing weight is challenging with PCOS, but doing so can help reduce the male hormone levels in the body, and some women will begin to ovulate naturally. With a proper diagnosis, lifestyle changes and PCOS treatment, women can get relief from this condition and the overwhelming health problems it can cause.
 
If PCOS is not treated properly, it can put a girl at risk for lots of problems. Girls with PCOS are more likely to have infertility, excessive hair growth, acne, obesity, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure, abnormal bleeding from the uterus, and cancer.
The good news is that, although there's no cure for PCOS, it can be treated. The most important step is diagnosing the condition, because getting treatment for PCOS reduces a girl's chances of developing serious problems.We can help many girls in leading a happy and normal life if it is diagnosed early,

Now let me introduce myself, Dr Surabhi Jain, Founder Of Nutriwell
India , I am a Graduate from Medicine field  is one of the best nutrition and dietetics qualified
in the business, with Ten plus years of academic exposure to the subject via
formal, full-time, Bachelors and Masters Degrees. She also has in her credit MBA
(Health care) and PGDPHN (Post Graduate Diploma In Public Health Nutrition from
world acclaimed Institute Like PHFI ( Public Health Foundation Of India) and M.
Sc ( Clinical Nutrition & Dietetics).    
I am a Nutrition activist
and Nutrition advocate, I have the unique privilege of being the only
nutritionist From Field of Medicine, with the most nutrition awards/accolades,
amongst all the privately practicing nutritionists of the country.read some of the before and after  success stories here in PCOS http://www.nutriwellindia.com/before-after.aspx .I have done intense research in last ten years on PCOS Diet and Now my complete management of PCOS is simple , natural and easy. 
My Nutritional
Consultancy Nutriwell ,has a key motto to provide comprehensive solutions to
lifestyle and lifecycle related medical conditions through provision of
Nutritional and Naturopathic Therapy. My unique Nutritional diet therapy is
backed with guidance on use of Naturopathic formulations and easy to follow
exercise regimes .My diet therapy is based on Regularizing, Detoxifying and
rejuvenating every cell of the body. At the interventional level we provide
Therapeutic and Preventive choices for weight management & common health
related disorders .In Nutri well I help individuals to fight against specific
illnesses as well as help them to change their day to day life style . One
thing that this therapy does unlike most other therapies is to eliminate the
very cause of an ailment rather than treating the symptoms.
How your Money will make difference 
Basically we want to create awareness regarding the condition. Prevention is always better  than a cure :)
If you Donate 100 $
We will arrange a Awareness activity for 20 girls and will send you all the details.
If you Donate 200 $ 
We will be more than happy to arrange a awareness Activity for one school.We will send you the complete details of the activity and its photographs.
If You donate 500 or 1000 $.
We can arrange an screening camp for PCOS. 
If we reach our goal of 20000 $ then we would run an extensive campaign regarding PCOS awareness and will be aable to reach and help more girls.We Plan to Open a complete PCOS center where Ladies/girls suffering from PCOS gets complete and Comprehensive treatment. Clinical Examination, Early Diagnosis, Dietary Modification , Motivational Counselling to address their emotional issues , and complete fitness guidance to be included in the PCOS Program. I am treating the PCOS clients from last ten Years and Results are very encouraging. My special Low glycemic Index diet does wonders in this condition. But as this condition is most neglected and Undiagnosed I want to create more awareness about it.I have set up my center 5 years back and It has gained lot
of faith from the people. Now I want to help More ladies to fight with their PCOS naturally and Live a longer and happy life.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate financially to our campaign but wish to help, please help us spread the word about our project.  Please share our campaign link via social media (using the Indiegogo share tools), by emailing a friend, or by using good old-fashioned word-of-mouth.
The time to act is now… If you know someone who is Infrequent or prolonged menstrual periods, excess hair growth, acne, and obesity can all occur in women with polycystic ovary syndrome. In adolescents, infrequent or absent menstruation may raise suspicion for the condition.take her to a doctor and get all the necessary tests done. Early diagnosis and treatment along with weight loss may reduce the risk of long-term complications, such as type 2 diabetes infertility and heart disease.You can gift her a healthy and happy future :)
We can only effect change by working together; we hope you’ll join us.
Our sincere thanks,Surabhi jain

story:
GHANA'S PROBLEM:

In Ghana, all secondary schools are fee-paying which means that almost 60% of children have to quit school after junior education. A lack of education leads to poor public health, extreme highs in unemployment, food insecurity and a host of other issues. This problem is further exaggerated in the rural communities, where subsistence farming means that the majority of people survive on less than $2 a day.

Ghana is rich in it's own resources but without the education or infrastructure to develop, it is trapped by poverty. 

            

 


WHY THIS PROJECT IS DIFFERENT:

Most NGO's rely solely on donations from the public and struggle continuously to raise their annual running costs. Our aim is to establish schools that last forever and are not reliant on donations to exist. Once we have raised enough money to set a school up - it will be fully sustainable and continue to teach the community forever. 

Quite simply, your support now will allow us to start this ambitious project, which we believe can provide a blue-print for sustainable schooling. 
For more information, please see www.almamatereducation.com  

OUR APPROACH:

Alma Mater Education is a UK registered charity (1159983) and soon to be registered in Ireland also.
Our unique 'Business-NGO' approach means that fifty percent of our students pay fees at below the normal rate, allowing the remaining fifty percent (from the most impoverished backgrounds) to study on full Alma Mater scholarships. The money generated from the fee-paying students will mean that running costs of the school are completely covered annually. 
We are also working with a local agricultural University to develop a farm that will feed the students and teach them and the local community how to grow and sell produce. 
We intend to use this pilot project, which will eventually have a student population of 480, as a model for expansion both in Ghana beyond.

IMPACT:

Education is a fundamental human right. However, we see everyday how unattainable this is for the World's poorest.
Estimated wage returns per additional year of schooling in Ghana increases from 4% per year for those with primary education, to 10% per year for those with secondary education. Furthermore, in a country that is fortunate to have excellent climates and extremely fertile lands, knowledge of farming is key to food security.

The three classrooms that we are campaigning for, will benefit between 105 and 120 students per year, over an expected period of forty years. 

Potentially this resource therefore could be used by over 5,000 students

      


WHERE WE ARE NOW:
The total cost of the Wioso project in Kumasi, is £762,000. This will build a fully equipped secondary school for 480 students, with ICT facilities, library, science lab, sports fields and school offices. It will also construct and consistently manage a 25 acre farm that will provide food and further education to our students and the wider community.
We have already secured a little over £300,000 (over the course of three years),  and construction began in March 2015.  £60,000 will enable us to build three classrooms, fully kitted out with fans, lights, desks and all necessary teaching apparatus.
 The Kumasi Institute of Tropical Agriculture are planning the first crop rotations on our 25-acre farm and we will welcome our first 160 students in September 2015. 

WHY ALMA MATER EDUCATION?

Our team has years of experience in the charitable, business and academic sectors. This includes experiences of running similar projects in Ghana, Kenya, China and India. James Riggs (CEO) worked with the EDP-TRUST (edp_trust.org) in 2009, to open the only fee-free secondary school in Southern Ghana. These students now go onto University and have high employment rates within their communities. They are changing their generation

   


How you can help?
As a new organisation, our key challenge is to secure the income for our pilot project so that we can demonstrate that this model can be replicated throughout Ghana, and other developing countries. 
Building up our reputation takes time, but we are relentless and we know we will prove it to you that this can and will work.
Of course we hope that you contribute through this campaign, and would like to thank you immensely for doing so. However, there are plenty of other ways you can get involved. From spreading the word, running an event, sponsoring students and teachers, or volunteering your time with us. We would be delighted to hear from you, and you can contact us at info@almamatereducation.com or you can visit our website at www.almamatereducation.com
Thank-you all in advance, and for taking the time to learn a bit more about us. We sincerely hope that you share our vision of a world of equal opportunities for all, and hope you can contribute to our vital work.

story:
RAISING FUNDS FOR PUBLIC LIBRARY PROJECT

On June 20, 2015 the Bafut Manjong Cultural Association (BMCA) Calgary will be hosting a cultural night to showcase the unique culture of the Bafut People. For over 6 years, the BMCA has engaged in active public performance of traditional music and dances originating from the Bafut people of Cameroon. Our unique and sought-after "Juju" and "Njang" dances have captured massive attention among many audiences in Alberta.

This cultural night will be an opportunity for the public to witness more of our culture, and helping us preserve that heritage.

The Library Project

In the past years, we have engaged in a number of volunteering activities in Alberta, and launched a few development projects. Currently, we are raising funds to help establish a public library for the Bafut community hosted at the Bafut Council. At the moment, the association has donated over 2000 books towards this project (with the support of WorldServeThrift), and our target is 10000 books and computers. This cultural night will enable us raise funds to push this project ahead.

We are counting on everyone's support to raise the funds we need for this project.

See details of the Library Project here and our Association here.

story:
Short Summary

Neutral Fundamentals is a company that teaches the fundamentals of being an adult. Classes discuss topics such as money management, job searching, resume help, how to make large purchases such as a car or an apartment and how to get involved in their communities. 

I started this company because I feel there is a large gap between high school graduation and being an adult in the real world. As the youngest in my family, I was outgoing and adventurous, but was also rather mischievous and troublesome at times. After some turbulent adolescent years, I went on to graduate high school and joined the United States Navy where I spent 4 years stationed in San Diego, CA. After 7 years in California, I returned home and finished my college degree while working full time.

Throughout my personal mistakes, choices, decisions, partying, studying, traveling and countless personal encounters with people from all walks of life, I discovered this gap and I am determined to bridge it. I was raised with a strong sense of personal responsibility and have faith that there are young adults, just as determined as I was, to become independent and self-reliant. 

Getting this information to them has become my mission. 

Contributing to this business will help fund marketing costs and supplies costs for participants so that the can gain the knowledge they need to pursue success and independence.

What We Need & What You Get

All contributed funds will go to:

  • Marketing supplies; Envelopes, stamps, brochure paper, labels, business mailbox, advertising fees (digital, local magazines and newspapers). 
  • Supplies for classes: Full folder for each student with worksheets, resource sheets, helpful handouts, bottled water and snacks.
  • If I do not reach my goal, all other funds raised will still go to marketing supplies and supplies for classes.

The Impact

It is my belief that everyone feels their best when they are independent, self-reliant and well rounded members of society who do their best to provide for themselves. 

I feel strongly about personal responsibility and believe that unbiased and truthful education is the best way to promote accountability. I am in no way a "certified expert" in any one of these fields, but I do feel as though the things that I have learned in my life so far could really help someone. 

The sense of accomplishment that you get from taking care of yourself and being productive can be life changing; I do have experience in that.

That is what I am here to promote.

Risks & Challenges

Great reward comes only from taking a great risk... there has to be some risk involved!

Yes, yes, it all sounds good in theory. But what is no one buys it?

There is a risk that every single person that I send a letter and brochure to will throw it away. However, based on the feedback that I have received and the current facilities willing to host classes, it is unlikely that this idea will go unnoticed. 

And if it does... I will not stop.

I will teach for free. I will teach to those who have nothing to give, but everything to gain. If there is a will to be better- I have the will to help. 

I am working hard to cultivate lasting relationships with future hosts and participants.  My ideal locations are high schools, community colleges, GED testing facilities, family and individual counselors, churches, YMCAs, and Park and Recreational Facilities around the St. Louis area. 

I will do everything in my power to continue my mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ok, so you feel SUPER strongly about this idea, but you just aren't in a place where you can contribute financially. No problem.

If you feel as though this is a beneficial program and you would like to help make it successful, please share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr- anywhere!  There are brochures available online for you to print or share with friends, schools, families and colleagues. 

If you have any questions or want more information, please visit my website, call me, email me or send me a letter!

Thank you so much!!

Fair Winds and Following Seas,

Olivia
