story:
Support us in setting up a space to create in South West France

We are a Scottish husband and wife team, who have a dream of setting up a creative retreat in South West France, which offers people a change of pace, and the space to create.

Colin is a digital media professional, portrait photographer and drummer. Julia is a mixed media visual artist and web designer, who has also been involved in coordinating open submission exhibitions for Scottish arts societies for many moons.

We work hard and play hard, with a very blurred seam in-between, spending much of our free time on cultural pursuits, or volunteering to help friends with their own creative businesses. One of our mottos is ‘It’s nice to be nice’. Truth is, we both get a kick out of knowing that we have helped another creative person progress.

It's nice to be nice!

With this in mind we have devised Studio Faire.

Studio Faire will allow us the opportunity to combine our extensive experience to offer a supportive environment for the development of ideas and the production of new work through residencies for national and international contemporary artists, designers, performers, writers, musicians, makers and other creative professionals, in the beautiful surroundings of the Lot-et-Garonne (47), France.

Tout ce que vous voulez faire…faire en France au Studio Faire.
(Whatever you want to make…do it in France at Studio Faire.)

We have our aims and objectives written, over forty years combined experience in the creative industries and over 1,000 relevant contacts. We have also spent the past two years scouting out the best location in the South West of France that can offer the desired pace and space. 


We are ready to make Studio Faire a reality!
But we need your support.

We are self-employed, with no existing property to sell or significant inheritance in the bank and, therefore, little chance of saving the amount required for a deposit on a property with living accommodation and workshop space suitable for the creative residencies.

So, we have developed a three-pronged plan: spend less and save, make more and save … ask for support and save!

By spending less and working harder to make more, we are able to raise half of the required deposit for the property but we need your support to reach the necessary target that will bring Studio Faire to life. 


What we need and what you get.

Having spent some time now looking at properties, we have projected that we need a minimum of €210,000 (£176,220) to purchase a property, which provides the accommodation and workspace required for Studio Faire.

For a property at this price, the cash needed to close (incorporating the down payment, notaire, legal, bank & broker fees) is €48,343 (£40,576)

Through this IndieGoGo campaign, we are aiming to raise: €23,767 (£20,000)

This is just under half of the deposit required. We will (more than) match-fund this amount to end up with the €48,343 (£40,576) that we need for the deposit.

Once purchased, Studio Faire (the business) will cover the monthly mortgage payments, all running costs & maintenance of the property, with both of us managing the company and the property. We will also help residents with their own funding applications or crowdfunding campaigns, if desired.

€210,000 (£176,220) will allow us to purchase a property in the Lot-et-Garonne that has:

  • Self catering accommodation for a minimum of three residents (3 double bedrooms, plus shared living room/kitchen)
  • Private accommodation for Colin & Julia (1 double room, plus small living room/kitchen)
  • Barn/Garage to be converted into suitable workshop space
  • Garden
  • Easy access to Bordeaux, Bergerac and Toulouse airports


The Impact!

If you have watched some of the testimonial films (shown in the links just under the main film at the top of this page), or have had a read of the blog at www.studiofaire.co.uk, then you’ll already know that we have both been preparing for a business like this for the majority of our lives and have been gearing up for Studio Faire itself for the past two years.

We have already committed to this business and are way too far down the road to turn back now! If we do not reach our goal through this campaign, the money raised will go in to a designated business savings account and be added to until we do. We will spend less and make more and save and save and save!

But we can’t wait too long … we are ready … we are still young enough and energetic enough to work hard on preparing the premises and building this business now … we have committed to the project already by moving to France … we are now looking for the ideal premises … people are desperate to come … it is the right time!

We need your support to make this happen now!

By making a contribution to this new business, you will not only be helping us raise the deposit to set up our ideal business, a business that we will work day and night on to ensure it’s a success, a business that we will be invested in for the rest of our lives, but you will also be helping to set up a valuable opportunity for creative people from all disciplines and from all over the world.

You will be helping to nurture collaborative thinking, personal reflection, exploration of new processes and inspiration from the surroundings!

All you need to do is choose a ‘perk’ that suits your pocket.

If you are unable to support us financially, then support us by telling your friends about this campaign. We need just 1,000 people to contribute £20 or more and we’ll be on our way. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word and …

Support us in building a place where original ideas will be born.

Join us on our journey to create Studio Faire.

THANK YOU!




More detail:

The Perks!

Small is beautiful!

Just want to add a small amount to show us you support this venture? Please choose a perk for £2 or more. All support gets us closer to our goal and is extremely welcome!

20's Plenty

We need just 1,000 people to contribute £20 to reach our target, so we are offering several lovely perks at this price.

Whether you love music, food or the idea of a little piece of you being present in sunny South West France, we have the perk for you.

Your name will appear on our funder’s page at www.studiofaire.co.uk (anonymity is also cool).

Live Bespoke Drum Solo - £25

Colin will perform a live 2-minute drum solo, just for you, via Skype.

This solo will also be recorded and sent to you for keeps.

Once purchased, Colin will contact you to arrange a time for the solo and to find out if there is a drum beat for a song you love that you may want featured in the solo.

Your name will also appear on our funder’s page at www.studiofaire.co.uk (anonymity is also cool).

Your name set in stone - £50

We will find a great spot within the Studio Faire premises to create a wall to publicly thank our permanent collection of supporters.

Your name will be added to this wall so that all future residents and visitors will know of your generosity!

We will also add your name to our funders page at www.studiofaire.co.uk.

Discounted Deposit and Discounted Visits

We think we should just get cracking on pre-booking visits to Studio Faire. Makes sense huh?

Whether you’re looking for an affordable creative residency that provides all that we have mentioned above or are just looking for a cheap holiday in the South West of France for the near future, these perks will float your boat, with whopping great discounts on visits:

Deposit for 1 week = £100 + remaining discounted amount of £270 on arrival for your week at Studio Faire. TOTAL = £370 (you save £100 and get a really great deal!).

1 Week = £300 (you save £170 and get a totally amazing deal!)

1 Week for 2 Sharing = £385 (This breaks down to only £55 per night for the two of you... bargain accommodation!).

Or … why not learn a new skill during your stay by purchasing 1 Week with Tuition for only £200 more? You choose from our list of skills… we’ll show you how and support you while you practice … result!

1 Month = £1,000 (you save £400. I don’t think we even need to tell you that you’d be lucky to find any cheaper accommodation in the South West of France than that and Studio Faire offers so much more than just accommodation!).

1 Month for 2 Sharing = £1,350 (By far the best deal. This perk offers a massive £550 off and breaks down to just £45 per night.)

NEW - Discounted Website for Artist or Designer - £500

For this campaign only, Julia Douglas is offering to design and build your bespoke website for an extremely generous price! 

Because they take many hours to make, her web design prices normally begin at £1,000 for a small business and she already offers a discounted price of £600 to artists and designers, as their's are her favourite types of websites to work on.

Purchase this perk for just £500 and Julia will work closely with you over the next few months to design and build your bespoke WordPress website, then teach you how to update it for future development. 

Julia specialises in creating websites for artists and designers. Her style is clean, crisp and minimal, a style which ensures your artwork is the main focus. 

To see some examples of her websites, read some testimonials and have some FAQ’s answered, please visit: www.juliadouglas.co.uk/designer

Then come back to this page and grab one while you can. Only four available.



RSA - Award For An Artist - £2,400

You will fund a 1-month residency award for an artist selected from the Royal Scottish Academy Open Exhibition. (www.royalscottishacademy.org), which runs for six weeks during the summer in Edinburgh city centre’s Royal Scottish Academy.

The award will include return travel expenses between Scotland and France, communal meeting and workshop space, self-catering accommodation, a stipend and suitable space and marketing support for a public presentation of their work (an exhibition or talk for example).

The award will be co-branded: The 'Your Name or Company Name' Studio Faire Award.

The co-branded award will be named on the Royal Scottish Academy (RSA) website, in the RSA Open Exhibition’s marketing materials, on the Studio Faire website and alongside the public presentation of the artists work.

The RSA showcases a unique selection of collectible artworks by artists from Scotland & beyond. As it runs during the world famous Edinburgh Festival, the exhibition always attracts a colossal footfall!

The RSA Open Exhibition showcases around 400 works annually and features a wide range of small and medium sized works selected through open submission including paintings, drawings, sculptures, prints and photographs.

Julia Douglas is proud to have had work selected for this exhibition on three occasions, winning a prize herself in 2007. We thank them wholeheartedly for their support with this campaign.

Should you require further information about this ‘perk’ please do not hesitate to contact us by email at: info@studiofaire.co.uk.




SSA - Award For An Artist - £2,400

You will fund a 1-month residency award for an artist selected from the Society of Scottish Artists Annual Exhibition (www.s-s-a.org), which runs for one month each year during winter in Edinburgh’s city centre, at the Scottish National Galleries Academy Building.

The award will include return travel expenses between Scotland and France, communal meeting and workshop space, self-catering accommodation, a stipend, and suitable space and marketing support for a public presentation of their work (an exhibition or talk for example).

The award will be co-branded: The 'Your Name or Company Name' Studio Faire Award.

The co-branded award will be named on the Society of Scottish Artists (SSA) website, in the SSA Annual Exhibition’s marketing materials, on the Studio Faire website and alongside the public presentation of the artists work.

The SSA was founded in 1891, and now has almost 700 active members. Always willing to show the controversial, the unique and the most adventurous and challenging work available. The SSA’s network of artist members and contacts throughout the world gives it access to some of the most interesting work by contemporary artists, which it endeavours to bring to a Scottish public.

With over 250 exhibits selected from open submissions, plus invited professional and graduate artists, the SSA Annual Exhibition is made up of the controversial, the unique and the most adventurous and challenging work available from Scotland and beyond, annually attracting over 20,000 visitors to it’s exhibition.

Julia Douglas was awarded Honorary Life membership at the end of July, following her position as Administrator and Exhibition Coordinator for the past four Annual Exhibitions. She thanks them for their support with this campaign.

Should you require further information about this ‘perk’ please do not hesitate to contact us by email at: info@studiofaire.co.uk.


VAS - Award For An Artist - £2,400

You will fund a 1-month residency award for an artist selected from the Visual Arts Scotland Annual Exhibition (www.visualartsscotland.org), which runs for one month each year during winter in Edinburgh’s city centre, at the Scottish National Galleries Academy Building.

The award will include return travel expenses between Scotland and France, communal meeting and workshop space, self-catering accommodation, a stipend and suitable space and marketing support for a public presentation of their work (an exhibition or talk for example).

The award will be co-branded: The 'Your Name or Company Name' Studio Faire Award.

The co-branded award will be named on the Visual Arts Scotland (VAS) website, in the VAS Annual Exhibition’s marketing materials, on the Studio Faire website and alongside the public presentation of the artists work.

VAS is a leading platform for national and international contemporary fine and applied artists.

With over 250 exhibits selected from open submissions, plus invited professional and graduate artists, and shortlisted artists for the Cordis Trust Prize, the largest existing award for tapestry, the VAS Annual Exhibition consistently provides an exciting and stimulating exhibition which continuously attracts a footfall of over 20,000 visitors.

Julia Douglas is proud to be a Professional Member of Visual Arts Scotland and thanks them for their support with this campaign.

Should you require further information about this ‘perk’ please do not hesitate to contact us by email at: info@studiofaire.co.uk.
story_txt:
Support us in setting up a space to create in South West FranceWe are a Scottish husband and wife team, who have a dream of setting up a creative retreat in South West France, which offers people a change of pace, and the space to create.
Colin is a digital media professional, portrait photographer and drummer. Julia is a mixed media visual artist and web designer, who has also been involved in coordinating open submission exhibitions for Scottish arts societies for many moons.
We work hard and play hard, with a very blurred seam in-between, spending much of our free time on cultural pursuits, or volunteering to help friends with their own creative businesses. One of our mottos is ‘It’s nice to be nice’. Truth is, we both get a kick out of knowing that we have helped another creative person progress.
It's nice to be nice!
With this in mind we have devised Studio Faire.



Studio Faire will allow us the opportunity to combine our extensive experience to offer a supportive environment for the development of ideas and the production of new work through residencies for national and international contemporary artists, designers, performers, writers, musicians, makers and other creative professionals, in the beautiful surroundings of the Lot-et-Garonne (47), France.
Tout ce que vous voulez faire…faire en France au Studio Faire.(Whatever you want to make…do it in France at Studio Faire.)
We have our aims and objectives written, over forty years combined experience in the creative industries and over 1,000 relevant contacts. We have also spent the past two years scouting out the best location in the South West of France that can offer the desired pace and space. 




We are ready to make Studio Faire a reality!But we need your support.

We are self-employed, with no existing property to sell or significant inheritance in the bank and, therefore, little chance of saving the amount required for a deposit on a property with living accommodation and workshop space suitable for the creative residencies.
So, we have developed a three-pronged plan: spend less and save, make more and save … ask for support and save!
By spending less and working harder to make more, we are able to raise half of the required deposit for the property but we need your support to reach the necessary target that will bring Studio Faire to life. 






What we need and what you get.
Having spent some time now looking at properties, we have projected that we need a minimum of €210,000 (£176,220) to purchase a property, which provides the accommodation and workspace required for Studio Faire.
For a property at this price, the cash needed to close (incorporating the down payment, notaire, legal, bank & broker fees) is €48,343 (£40,576)
Through this IndieGoGo campaign, we are aiming to raise: €23,767 (£20,000) 
This is just under half of the deposit required. We will (more than) match-fund this amount to end up with the €48,343 (£40,576) that we need for the deposit.
Once purchased, Studio Faire (the business) will cover the monthly mortgage payments, all running costs & maintenance of the property, with both of us managing the company and the property. We will also help residents with their own funding applications or crowdfunding campaigns, if desired.
€210,000 (£176,220) will allow us to purchase a property in the Lot-et-Garonne that has:



Self catering accommodation for a minimum of three residents (3 double bedrooms, plus shared living room/kitchen)


Private accommodation for Colin & Julia (1 double room, plus small living room/kitchen)


Barn/Garage to be converted into suitable workshop space


Garden


Easy access to Bordeaux, Bergerac and Toulouse airports







The Impact!

If you have watched some of the testimonial films (shown in the links just under the main film at the top of this page), or have had a read of the blog at www.studiofaire.co.uk, then you’ll already know that we have both been preparing for a business like this for the majority of our lives and have been gearing up for Studio Faire itself for the past two years.
We have already committed to this business and are way too far down the road to turn back now! If we do not reach our goal through this campaign, the money raised will go in to a designated business savings account and be added to until we do. We will spend less and make more and save and save and save!
But we can’t wait too long … we are ready … we are still young enough and energetic enough to work hard on preparing the premises and building this business now … we have committed to the project already by moving to France … we are now looking for the ideal premises … people are desperate to come … it is the right time!
We need your support to make this happen now!
By making a contribution to this new business, you will not only be helping us raise the deposit to set up our ideal business, a business that we will work day and night on to ensure it’s a success, a business that we will be invested in for the rest of our lives, but you will also be helping to set up a valuable opportunity for creative people from all disciplines and from all over the world.
You will be helping to nurture collaborative thinking, personal reflection, exploration of new processes and inspiration from the surroundings!
All you need to do is choose a ‘perk’ that suits your pocket.
If you are unable to support us financially, then support us by telling your friends about this campaign. We need just 1,000 people to contribute £20 or more and we’ll be on our way. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word and …
Support us in building a place where original ideas will be born.



Join us on our journey to create Studio Faire.
THANK YOU!



More detail:

The Perks!

Small is beautiful!
Just want to add a small amount to show us you support this venture? Please choose a perk for £2 or more. All support gets us closer to our goal and is extremely welcome!
20's Plenty
We need just 1,000 people to contribute £20 to reach our target, so we are offering several lovely perks at this price.
Whether you love music, food or the idea of a little piece of you being present in sunny South West France, we have the perk for you.
Your name will appear on our funder’s page at www.studiofaire.co.uk (anonymity is also cool).
Live Bespoke Drum Solo - £25
Colin will perform a live 2-minute drum solo, just for you, via Skype.
This solo will also be recorded and sent to you for keeps.
Once purchased, Colin will contact you to arrange a time for the solo and to find out if there is a drum beat for a song you love that you may want featured in the solo.
Your name will also appear on our funder’s page at www.studiofaire.co.uk (anonymity is also cool).
Your name set in stone - £50
We will find a great spot within the Studio Faire premises to create a wall to publicly thank our permanent collection of supporters.
Your name will be added to this wall so that all future residents and visitors will know of your generosity!
We will also add your name to our funders page at www.studiofaire.co.uk.
Discounted Deposit and Discounted Visits
We think we should just get cracking on pre-booking visits to Studio Faire. Makes sense huh?

story:
Dear Money Friends,


My name is Coco Blignaut and I LOVE children. Please see my FB page: Coco's French Theatre & Art School Fleuris Where Children Bloom, for all info on how I teach and what we do in class. 

I also write healing children's books in which I use photography and vivid colorful collages to illustrate my stories. My first book, My Bantu Blankie, tells the true story of my sister growing up in South Africa, and a horrible incident of abuse that happened to her. The story is raw and truthful, but teaches a beautiful lesson of sharing, and ends in a magical, inspired way, giving the reader HOPE.

My second book, Puss in Boots in Provence, is inspired by the original fairytale of Charles Perrault. But my story has a modern message in which the young hero  is instructed by his muse, Puss, to grow in wisdom and character and to follow his dream, no matter what. My story takes place in Provence, introducing the reader to the language and culture of this wind-swept land in southern France. The book also has a page to page glossary of French words used in the text, and entices children to learn a foreign language.

I have a wonderful team that is working on creating and donating this book with me. A graphic artist who has been working on the vision I have for the images, my producer and editor, and my two sisters in South Africa who will distribute my books to schools in poor areas, orphanages and townships.  The cost of our endeavor, is as follows:  $3699 to publish and market the book through Dog Ear Publishing, $800 for copy editing,  $700 for a book trailer, $1000 for the printing of 100 books for donation purposes,  $1000 to ship 100 books (shipping cost per book: $10) to South Africa, $750 for a launching party, $2000 for perks, and $200 for a session with a shrink to recover (just kidding!)

Can you help us publish, market and donate Puss in Boots in Provence?

Once the book is published, my team pledges to begin a charity project - AFRICA OUR CHILD - that will help educate poor, neglected and abused children in South Africa through storytelling, by donating 50 copies of Puss in Boots in Provence and 50 copies of My Bantu Blankie to the following places: our old friends, and partner school, Zamani Daycare Centre in a poor township in South Africa, This school provides a safe haven and basic education to poor, abused and orphaned African children. Many donations have helped them extend and renovate their shack, clothe the children and give them toys and educational tools. Our aim is to help educate and INSPIRE them with story books. Books are very expensive in South Africa, and not affordable to these children. Our other outreach targets are Angels in the Dust, a home for orphaned African children in northern South Africa, and a Montessori school in Westbank, a poor neighborhood in East London, South Africa. 

Extra money raised will go towards our longterm goal, which is to ultimately have various functioning mobile libraries in South Africa, carrying an inventory of the most inspirational children's story books in the world. Imagine old-fashioned brightly painted ice cream trucks crammed with books. A loudspeaker playing children's songs announces its arrival in these neighborhoods, where poor children can loan an inspirational book and return it the next week for another one. Of course, many copies will be lost, but we think it is well worth the effort, trying to educate and inspire a third world child. The mobile library will also offer storytelling time with puppets by a volunteer. Wouldn't you look forward to this service if you were a poor, orphaned or abused child?

Help us bring magical storytelling to children who need it the most. Help them create a better life for themselves, by starting with how they think and see the world.

story:
SuccessfulAttitude.com/aviation-camps-Of the Nation ... 


Counting down, only 14 students still need your help. April 6th Camp at the Charlotte Douglas International Airport has a cool day planned out that is totally amazing. Donate with PayPal, any amount appreciated.
Don' miss: 

Interview with Brenda on the CW Channel


Brenda Robinson is the First African American Female Navy Pilot:
  • Pilot of 35 years from aircraft carriers to widebody 767's
  • We were all confused as teenagers, now I can mentor, teach, and inspire the motivated as well as struggling young person.
  • Students come away with a new found appreciation of aviation, life confidence and awareness, and what aviation careers are available in the industry.
  • Even adults find this camp just as exciting as it sounds.

Any and every student should have the opportunity to be exposed to what could be a memory of a lifetime, including the clear path to any chosen career destination.

What We Need & What You Get

To continue to make this program available to young people we need your help:

  • To run this program we must charge a fee. But there are so many more deserving students that MUST be exposed to all they can do, be and reach, who need your help to cover those costs.
  • Our programming is launched on the airport of a local town in which coordination with the local tenants make it a success. Help us get interested students in the air on their orientation flights.
  • Students that ARE interested in aviation will surely get an eye and earful of information. Followed by the steps most adults do not realize aviation holds.
  • This intense full one day program (normally spread out over 2 weeks) allows me to offer the complete motivational campaign I am known for through out the country.
  • Any amount will assist us in creating this program nation wide. But every possible student deserves this exposure and a one on one opportunity to dialog with a pioneer. 
  • Contact us (the organizers) to tell us where we can be of assistance in your community. This after all is for your students.


The Impact

I have sent out a survey for the students to answer. And every time we hear:

  • Students can't wait to tell their friends and family.
  • My favorite student is the one who is disengaged with the world. Or the student that does not imagine a cool life away from their current normal surroundings.
  • Some of the students that had the opportunity to learn more about me (Navy's First Black Female Pilot) are full of questions and are amazed that a woman of color loves this great job and more importantly, they see themselves now in a different light. 
  • My students are of all races and backgrounds. Shy students transcends economics. I teach goal achievement, self confidence and body language. I teach equality and meeting new people. I teach what bullys think and how to diminish their control. I teach what I wish I knew when I was 13 years old. And the kids love it. They talk to me. They talk to each other. It is impressive and it is lasting.
  • Math and science are explained (by an ordinary person) not to be feared and why. My students learn why our place in the world needs their help.
  • Often parents want me to talk to their child, especially the shy ones. I ask them how about their school? One on one or a whole classroom or a whole school; no one is ever put on the spot. And I never use a word without making sure everyone understands the definition of that work. I am not trying to prove how much smarter I am than they are. I am trying to prove I am just like them. And what I have achieved, they too can repeat in their own life.

Risks & Challenges

I run the full camp day on my own and sometimes with volunteers to help with logistics.

  • It would be wonderful to hire the supporting crew members to make this seamless with the focus directed only toward the students. We need t-shirts, hats, someday flight suits. We need an accountant, web designer, marketer, photographer, scheduler, We need transportation funding,
  • Fully funded we could create 4 fully functioning camps this year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Other things we need for the kids:

  • We need your help with letting the local middle and high school Principals and
    Councilors know about this event. Any student that doesn't believe they have a future... needs to be in this camp.
  • Ask sponsors in your local community to help provide lunch during this fast paced day, We need sandwiches, fruit, water and healthy snacks. 
  • Please link with friends on your personal and professional network using these Indiegogo share tools!

I should have said this earlier, but with this, you will help change the world, one engaged student at a time. Notice my Fun Meter...is Pegged!

Even adults find this camp just as exciting as it sounds.  Any and every student should have the opportunity to be exposed to what could be a memory of a lifetime, including the clear path to any chosen career destination.   What We Need & What You Get To continue to make this program available to young people we need your help:  To run this program we must charge a fee. But there are so many more deserving students that MUST be exposed to all they can do, be and reach, who need your help to cover those costs.  Our programming is launched on the airport of a local town in which coordination with the local tenants make it a success. Help us get interested students in the air on their orientation flights.
Students that ARE interested in aviation will surely get an eye and earful of information. Followed by the steps most adults do not realize aviation holds.
This intense full one day program (normally spread out over 2 weeks) allows me to offer the complete motivational campaign I am known for through out the country. Any amount will assist us in creating this program nation wide. But every possible student deserves this exposure and a one on one opportunity to dialog with a pioneer. 
Contact us (the organizers) to tell us where we can be of assistance in your community. This after all is for your students.    

The Impact I have sent out a survey for the students to answer. And every time we hear:  Students can't wait to tell their friends and family.
My favorite student is the one who is disengaged with the world. Or the student that does not imagine a cool life away from their current normal surroundings.
Some of the students that had the opportunity to learn more about me (Navy's First Black Female Pilot) are full of questions and are amazed that a woman of color loves this great job and more importantly, they see themselves now in a different light.  My students are of all races and backgrounds. Shy students transcends economics. I teach goal achievement, self confidence and body language. I teach equality and meeting new people. I teach what bullys think and how to diminish their control. I teach what I wish I knew when I was 13 years old. And the kids love it. They talk to me. They talk to each other. It is impressive and it is lasting.
Math and science are explained (by an ordinary person) not to be feared and why. My students learn why our place in the world needs their help. Often parents want me to talk to their child, especially the shy ones. I ask them how about their school? One on one or a whole classroom or a whole school; no one is ever put on the spot. And I never use a word without making sure everyone understands the definition of that work. I am not trying to prove how much smarter I am than they are. I am trying to prove I am just like them. And what I have achieved, they too can repeat in their own life.    Risks & Challenges  I run the full camp day on my own and sometimes with volunteers to help with logistics.  It would be wonderful to hire the supporting crew members to make this seamless with the focus directed only toward the students. We need t-shirts, hats, someday flight suits. We need an accountant, web designer, marketer, photographer, scheduler, We need transportation funding, Fully funded we could create 4 fully functioning camps this year.    

Other Ways You Can Help Other things we need for the kids:  We need your help with letting the local middle and high school Principals and Councilors know about this event. Any student that doesn't believe they have a future... needs to be in this camp.
Ask sponsors in your local community to help provide lunch during this fast paced day, We need sandwiches, fruit, water and healthy snacks. 
Please link with friends on your personal and professional network using these Indiegogo share tools!   I should have said this earlier, but with this, you will help change the world, one engaged student at a time. Notice my Fun Meter...is Pegged!

story:
Who We Are

New Testament Christian Academy was founded in 1991 by Dr. William Hohman, Senior Pastor of New Testament Church and Faye Marquardt. We are a private Christian School that offers classes from Three Year Old Pre-kindergarten all the way through twelfth grade. Our mission is“Training leaders of tomorrow with moral strength and Godly wisdom.” We have a dedicated staff that has made fulfilling this mission a priority. Our school motto is “Good, better, best, I’ll never rest, until my good is better, and my better is best.” Our students and staff lovingly refer to us as “The Academy” and look forward to our annual end of the year “Academy Awards and Graduation Ceremony” where they receive honor and trophies for all of their hard work.

We hold to an attitude of excellence and require higher grade performance than most other schools. We also have mandatory participation in every event, so each student learns to help one another in their strengths and weaknesses. Our graduates have gone on to excel at universities, colleges, and in the labor force. Our alumni include lawyers, engineers, pastors, teachers, nurses, and police officers, just to name a few. We are proud of who we are, the education we offer, and what we do in our community, but realize that we cannot do it alone.

We Need Your Help

NTCCA has gone through many changes over the years. A new Gymnasium and modern kitchen and cafeteria, as well as both boys and girls locker rooms were added in 2000. Our gym was used for our own Physical Education classes, indoor recess, and weekly chapel meetings. It was also used for our team sporting events including regional tournaments. We have also made the gymnasium available to the community. We have hosted food distributions (after a tornado came through our town), expos, concerts, and it is still currently being used by a local basketball team for practice.

At the time of the addition we purchased a “state of the art” gym floor. Unfortunately the floor had issues within a short time of installation. After months and years of trying to solve the issues with the company that sold us the floor, our hands were tied as they went out of business. So we made due with a gym floor that has “dead spots” (the basketball will not bounce), tiles that have warped, and a floor that is almost impossible to keep clean but cannot live with it as it is any longer. Through much prayer and hard work, we have negotiated a great price on a replacement floor and installation with a company.

We also had two furnaces installed on the roof of our gym; when the addition was complete, to heat such a large area in our cold Wisconsin winter months. Both of these units were used but they were donated to us and we were very grateful. Even though they were used they have worked very hard for the past fourteen years, providing heat in the winter and cooling in the summer. Over those years we have had to have much work done on both furnaces and eventually one of them has outlived its usefulness, and the other not far behind. Our service man told us “There is nothing else we can do to repair the unit” and they politely asked us not to call again.

So, in addition to replacing the gym floor we need to replace at least one of our roof furnaces.

We are completely funded by donations, fundraisers, along with a small amount of tuition from our families. We have made it a point of keeping our tuition as low as possible during this time of economic uncertainty, trying to keep as many children enrolled as possible.

What We Have Already Accomplished

Through fundraising and local donations we have been able to raise one-tenth of the money needed for our Gymnasium renovation project. NTCCA students and staff will continue to work hard to reach our financial goal but we are asking that you partner with us.

How You Can Help

Your monetary donation- After the funds we already raised, we need an additional $63,000.00 to reach our goal. All giving is tax deductable and greatly appreciated. We have special “perks” for each level of giving, but they are only a small token of our gratitude. There is no gift too small and no matter the size of the contribution each one will be used well.

Your social network- Help us spread the word. “Follow” or “like” our Facebook page. Please share our campaign as well.

Your prayers- Lift us up in your prayers.

story:
TheNewHappyMe Story of Gratitude

I founded TheNewHappyMe just over 4 years ago. It was part of my own personal journey as I documented what I learned and inspired my growing audience through my stories.

In September of 2014, the adventure culminated to the publication of my first book "I Will NOT Forgive" which received 5 star feedback and helped support many women through their trials of abuse and negative patterns of life.

I realized I could do more in contribution by offering an online support venue, with videos, webinars, group discussions and an opportunity for participants to share their own story. 

Imagine the ripple effect of healing!


This launch starts
with the publication of a new ebook,
yours for a tiny 1$ contribution. 

 
It is the first of a series called "7 Little Things". You can sample the launch edition in short e-version through this crowdfunding campaign right here, with a tiny contribution of 1$!

Inside you will find 7 simple techniques to help you enjoy your journey of happiness in the now! These same concepts will be part of TheNewHappyMe School of Life.


Be Part of the Healing Revolution
with TheNewHappyMe School of Life!

Through TheNewHappyMe.com blogs, daily social media posts, program recommendations and especially through #GratitudeChat on twitter every Sunday evening at 7:30PM eastern, I have worked persistently to crack the code of healing slowly but surely, to break individual and generational cycles of negativity.

Today, I want to push it further into a Healing Revolution and I need your help!

Support the wave of positivity by becoming part of the movement, make your contribution to help me put together the online program *TheNewHappyMe School of Life* accessible to all (and grab your favorite PERK).

The closed membership site will offer a safe haven for individuals seeking a group coaching environment and support. Through live and recorded modules, in addition to a discussion forum, each participant will learn basic techniques to stop negative patterns and replace them by healthy mindfulness. 

The program will be offered at a very low $27 a month to allow anyone access for as little or as long as they wish, with full group coaching support in addition to video and audio programming. 


Your Gifts with Gratitude

I thank you for your contribution and I want to give back by offering you a sample of the incredible energy and light TheNewHappyMe community has already created. Choose a perk and make a contribution to be part of the team and receive your gift. 

Every dollar will help us make the VISION a reality. 

With great support from a beautiful circle of friends and family, the original idea is slowly coming to fruition. I can't wait for you to see the launch!


Spread the Word!

Whether you can make a financial contribution or not, I appreciate you stopping by. If you like the idea of this Healing Revolution and TheNewHappyMe School of Life, please use the Indiegogo share tools and make some noise about this project!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

- Carmen Marie

story:
You know those old conference bags you have sitting around at your house? We collect those and give them to underprivileged schoolchildren around the world.

Thousands of conferences happen every year where attendees receive quality conference bags that typically go unused after events. At the same time, many schoolchildren don't have a quality bag to hold their stuff in. Bags to Riches bridges the gap between these problems.

Our partnerships with event centers and conferences allow us to set up donation boxes at events, where attendees have the option to donate their bags. We also offer a pickup program for conferences that have excess bags. We donate the collected bags to the developing world through our parter charities. To date, 14,000 bags have been donated to schoolchildren across the world—from Peru to Gambia to Salt Lake City.

Shipping is rather expensive and a lack of funds is the only thing keeping us from scaling up. Bags to Riches has the potential to prevent hundreds of thousands of bags from being wasted. And in doing so, we would promote the educational goals of kids around the globe.

Please donate and help us make a difference—one bag at a time.

story:
My name is Rachel Whetstone and I'm a returned Peace Corps Volunteer (Burkina Faso, 2009-2011, Girls Education and Empowerment). In '09, I met a passionate Burkinabe educator by the name of Frederique Koala. Mr. Koala had the dream to start a girl-friendly school in Burkina - one where he could be the principal and ensure equal educational rights for boys and girls. After I returned to the states, I started a nonprofit called Schools for Change in Africa. Since then, we have been working to build a middle school in a small village in the southwest of Burkina - right now the village only has an elementary school. Overall, we need about $270,000 to build an amazing boarding school and train all of the educators (the school will ultimately be self-sustaining, without needing our dollars to operate)...but right now we just need to visit and do some work. It's crucial, particularly in Burkina (where friendships are among the highest of currencies), that we maintain good working relationships with Mr. Koala, his family, and the village of Tolotama (future location of the school). We will visit for about ten days - during that time we will re-establish our personal connections, make new friends and partners in the village, begin researching contractors, and gathering physical resources. 

All money raised will be used to buy plane tickets for two workers (myself and Christie-Anne Edie, the board President) and cover our in-country expenses. If there are any funds left over, they will be used to help build the school. 

You can learn more about our nonprofit and/or donate towards the school fund at www.schools4change.org. If you'd like to get involved in other ways, let us know!

story:
Every year, after coming back from summer camp, Serozh prepares his backpack for the next year’s camp — and does not let his mother touch it. All those campers with special needs, such as Serozh, and their families relish the memories of summer camp:

“This is the only place where we, as parents, can relax and be happy. Here our children enjoy the atmosphere with their friends. Devoted volunteers work hard to make every moment of the camp special,” said Osanna, whose son, Eduard, suffers from severe cerebral palsy.

In Armenia, people with special needs are considered disabled, and are segregated and excluded from society. Faith and Light camps seek to change that, to remind society that all of us are gifts of God, with unique graces and blessings, and that we need to accept one another for the way we are born — this is the only way to achieve integration and harmony. Many times, outsiders have spent some of their vacation joining Faith and Light activities. This is a way we convey our message, by acting and integrating.

Faith and Light is a faith-based community for children with special needs, their parents and an amazing group of volunteers, who really know the importance of love-inspired service. At Faith and Light, every person knows we all are created different, and that is the beauty of life. Here, everyone knows that God-given abilities are to be shared and utilized, where everyone may experience the joy of life, regardless of the hardships we all have to face. Faith and Light encourages parents, and reminds them that are not alone.

We need 8000$ to organize 8 days summer camp for 80 people. 

The summer camp takes place near Lake Sevan and lasts 8 days in the month of August. Some 30 volunteers and 35 children and up to 20 parents join the camp. Parents run the kitchen with the help of assigned volunteers; the rest of the volunteers organize the daily activities. There is no paid staff, which cuts down on operating expenses considerably. Expenses include rent, transportation, food and recreational materials.

We need your support to make this year’s summer camp a reality.

Please help our special children and their parents — your generous assistance will help them live with dignity and joy.  

Committing in happiness!!! 
The best future for a child is when he/she is in the family. We sometimes commit much in orphanages with children with special needs, but we also need to invest in keeping them in their families. This investment is when we share the responsibility of the parents letting them know that they are not alone. Our mothers love their kids and they take good care of them 24 hours a day. Camp is a time when mothers get the time to regenerate their energy to go for another year. Every penny that you invest in the camp will highly commit in happiness of children with special needs and their families. This is the greatest motivation of Faith and Light volunteers. Committing in happiness by acting!!! And you have the chance to participate in this commitment. 
Families with special needs children need continuous support!
The accessibility of the buildings and roads in Armenia is very low and it is the hardest part of volunteer work. There are stairs everywhere without ramps, and moving wheelchairs great part of the time requires enormous volunteer work. That is why parents just prefer to stay home. And being in a camp with volunteers solves this issue for them. 
You can find us also on facebook https://www.facebook.com/FaithAndLightArmenia 
Looking forward to hearing from you!

story:
Keine Reformpolitik ohne Demokratie-Reform!

Lang ist die Liste der überfälligen und von der Bevölkerung, auch von der KAB, eingeforderten politischen Reformen. Ob in den Feldern der Sozial- und Bildungspolitik, der Wirtschafts-, Finanz- oder Verteidigungspolitik – die parlamentarischen Entscheidungen orientieren sich mehr an den Marktinteressen als am Wohl des Volkes; als seien diese Marktinteressen identisch mit dem Wohl des Volkes.

Fast 50jähriges durch CAJ und KAB geprägtes Engagement lehrten mich: Neue Spielregeln für die Entwicklung politischen Willens des Volkes hin zur demokratisch legitimierten Entscheidung sind nötig, damit die Kompetenz der Zivilgesellschaft in den politischen Entscheidungen fruchtbar werden kann.

Solche Spielregeln zu entwickeln und gemäß Art. 146 Grundgesetz dem deutschen Volk als Verfassungsentwurf vorzulegen, ist Aufgabe eines Verfassungs-Konventes, an dessen Konzeption die www.initiative-verfassungskonvent.de  seit ihrer Gründung 2011 in mehreren bundesweiten Tagungen arbeitet.

Über Wege und Möglichkeiten zu einem solchen Konvent zu beraten, dazu lädt die Initiative alle zivilgesellschaftlichen Akteure ein, die sich für gemeinwohlorientierte Politik engagieren.

Eine weitere bundesweite Bürgerwerkstatt in Neustadt an der Weinstrasse vom 1.-3. Mai 2015 soll zum Schulterschluss dieser Akteure beitragen.

Auch Ihre Unterstützung ist nötig, damit eine modernen Ansprüchen gerechte Demokratie die überfälligen sachpolitischen Reformen ermöglicht.

Die bisherige Arbeit (Tagungen, Konferenzen, Web-Auftritte etc.) wurde durch die privaten Mittel der Teilnehmer und Koordinatoren - bislang ca. 25.000 € - finanziert. Nun sind unsere Reserven erschöpft.

Zwar zahlen auch für die Tagung in Neustadt die Teilnehmer ihre Beiträge, doch sind unsere Reserven zu erschöpft, um Reisekosten oder Honorare für die Referenten zu zahlen, Materialkosten zur Tagung oder auch eventuelle Ausfallkosten beim Tagungshaus zu sichern.

Mit Ihrer Unterstützung sichern Sie diese Tagung ab und weiterführend die Arbeit der Initiative.

Konvent für eine deutsche Verfassung

Artikel 146 GG beschränkt die Geltung des Grundgesetzes auf die Zeit, bis eine Verfassung in Kraft tritt, die vom deutschen Volk in freier Entscheidung beschlossen wird. Eine solche Verfassung sollte von der Zivilgesellschaft in Ruhe und mit den Erfahrungen von inzwischen 66 Jahren GG-Wirksamkeit entwickelt werden.
Als Weg dazu sehen wir den zivilgesellschaftlichen Verfassungskonvent, der den Bürgern einen Entwurf für ein Referendum vorlegt.

Risiken der Initiative

Immer häufiger und deutlicher werden Souveränitätsrechte des Volkes und Verfassungsrechte der Bürger vorgeblich übergeordneten Interessen (Märkte, Bankenrettung, Welthandel, Globalisierung etc.) geopfert. Der Art. 146 GG kann auch von den Vertretern solcher Politik zum endgültigen Abbau demokratischer Souveränität mißbraucht werden.

Dem wollen wir durch unsere Kampagne entgegentreten und die Kernfragen aufwerfen:

Welche Verfassungsregeln braucht es, dass demokratische Willensbildung und politische Entscheidungen dem Anspruch der Menschenwürde und dem Gemeinwohl dienen?

Welche Verfassungsregeln braucht es, um basisdemokratische sowie regionale Ansprüche, repräsentativen Parlamentarismus und demokratische Kontrolle optimal zu verbinden?

Es geht um die Demokratie

Der angestrebte Verfassungskonvent soll moderne demokratische Verfahren entwickeln, in denen sachpolitische Reformen im Dialog mit der Zivilgesellschaft beraten werden und durch die Bürger legitimiert werden.
Demokratie ist mehr als ein Urnengang, bei dem die Bürger auf Jahre ihre Stimme abgeben. Moderne Demokratie ist die staatsrechtliche Selbstorganisation einer Gesellschaft freier Bürger.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Sollten Sie unsere Kampagne nicht materiell stützen können, bitten wir Sie um die aktive Verbreitung unseres Anliegens. Helfen Sie uns, die für eine Demokratie lebensnotwendige bürgerliche Unruhe ins Volk zu tragen.

Mit Ihrer Unterstützung tragen Sie bei, dass das Engagement zur Entfaltung der demokratischen Idee nicht umsonst ist.
story_txt:
Keine
Reformpolitik ohne Demokratie-Reform!
Lang ist die Liste der überfälligen und von der Bevölkerung, auch von
der KAB, eingeforderten politischen Reformen. Ob in den Feldern der Sozial- und
Bildungspolitik, der Wirtschafts-, Finanz- oder Verteidigungspolitik – die parlamentarischen
Entscheidungen orientieren sich mehr an den Marktinteressen als am Wohl des
Volkes; als seien diese Marktinteressen identisch mit dem Wohl des Volkes.
Fast 50jähriges durch CAJ und KAB geprägtes Engagement lehrten mich:
Neue Spielregeln für die Entwicklung politischen Willens des Volkes hin zur
demokratisch legitimierten Entscheidung sind nötig, damit die Kompetenz der
Zivilgesellschaft in den politischen Entscheidungen fruchtbar werden kann.
Solche Spielregeln zu entwickeln und gemäß Art. 146 Grundgesetz dem
deutschen Volk als Verfassungsentwurf vorzulegen, ist Aufgabe eines
Verfassungs-Konventes, an dessen Konzeption die www.initiative-verfassungskonvent.de  seit ihrer Gründung 2011 in mehreren bundesweiten Tagungen arbeitet.


Über Wege und Möglichkeiten zu einem solchen Konvent zu beraten,
dazu lädt die Initiative alle zivilgesellschaftlichen Akteure ein, die sich für
gemeinwohlorientierte Politik engagieren.
Eine weitere bundesweite Bürgerwerkstatt in Neustadt an der Weinstrasse vom
1.-3. Mai 2015 soll zum Schulterschluss dieser Akteure beitragen.
Auch Ihre Unterstützung ist nötig, damit
eine modernen Ansprüchen gerechte Demokratie die überfälligen sachpolitischen
Reformen ermöglicht.
Die bisherige Arbeit (Tagungen, Konferenzen, Web-Auftritte etc.) wurde durch die privaten Mittel der Teilnehmer und Koordinatoren - bislang ca. 25.000 € - finanziert. Nun sind unsere Reserven erschöpft.
Zwar zahlen auch für die Tagung in Neustadt die Teilnehmer ihre Beiträge, doch sind unsere Reserven zu erschöpft, um Reisekosten oder Honorare für die Referenten zu zahlen, Materialkosten zur Tagung oder auch eventuelle Ausfallkosten beim Tagungshaus zu sichern.
Mit Ihrer Unterstützung sichern Sie diese Tagung ab und weiterführend die Arbeit der Initiative.
Konvent für eine deutsche Verfassung
Artikel 146 GG beschränkt die Geltung des Grundgesetzes auf die Zeit, bis eine Verfassung in Kraft tritt, die vom deutschen Volk in freier Entscheidung beschlossen wird. Eine solche Verfassung sollte von der Zivilgesellschaft in Ruhe und mit den Erfahrungen von inzwischen 66 Jahren GG-Wirksamkeit entwickelt werden.Als Weg dazu sehen wir den zivilgesellschaftlichen Verfassungskonvent, der den Bürgern einen Entwurf für ein Referendum vorlegt.Risiken der Initiative
Immer häufiger und deutlicher werden Souveränitätsrechte des Volkes und Verfassungsrechte der Bürger vorgeblich übergeordneten Interessen (Märkte, Bankenrettung, Welthandel, Globalisierung etc.) geopfert. Der Art. 146 GG kann auch von den Vertretern solcher Politik zum endgültigen Abbau demokratischer Souveränität mißbraucht werden.
Dem wollen wir durch unsere Kampagne entgegentreten und die Kernfragen aufwerfen:
Welche Verfassungsregeln braucht es, dass demokratische Willensbildung und politische Entscheidungen dem Anspruch der Menschenwürde und dem Gemeinwohl dienen?
Welche Verfassungsregeln braucht es, um basisdemokratische sowie regionale Ansprüche, repräsentativen Parlamentarismus und demokratische Kontrolle optimal zu verbinden?
  Es geht um die Demokratie 
Der angestrebte Verfassungskonvent soll moderne demokratische Verfahren entwickeln, in denen sachpolitische Reformen im Dialog mit der Zivilgesellschaft beraten werden und durch die Bürger legitimiert werden.Demokratie ist mehr als ein Urnengang, bei dem die Bürger auf Jahre ihre Stimme abgeben. Moderne Demokratie ist die staatsrechtliche Selbstorganisation einer Gesellschaft freier Bürger.
  Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
Sollten Sie unsere Kampagne nicht materiell stützen können, bitten wir Sie um die aktive Verbreitung unseres Anliegens. Helfen Sie uns, die für eine Demokratie lebensnotwendige bürgerliche Unruhe ins Volk zu tragen.
Mit Ihrer Unterstützung
tragen Sie bei, dass das Engagement zur Entfaltung der demokratischen Idee
nicht umsonst ist.

story:
Nederlands 

Short Summary


Photography by Jens Mollenvanger voor ELLE België

“What once was a green scenery, now are hundreds of wild edible plants growing all around, all year round.”- Ben Brumagne  


  • What an honor to have you watch this brand new project ! Whatever you choose to do, know that you can watch all of our online series for just €10, and that you can follow our Daily updates on our Social Media for free!! My team and I are so happy to introduce you to Forest To plate, a new series about wild edible plant specialists from around the world. Our goal is to entertain You, by showing something so unique yet completely natural, and to amaze you with the beauty of our edible planet earth. 

    In the following lines, you will be introduced to the whole project, so please read on if you want to learn something more about wild edible plants in an easy and vibrant way ! 

    Here we go ! 

    Studying herbalism and Organic farming for three years, I specialised in wild edible plants. It is my everyday thought, it is my passion. Everywhere I go it constantly provides me with wild edible food, a real joy for a boy that grew up in the city of Brussels ! I Decided to share my passion while on my last 6 month project “biking to india in the search for edible plants” and will now continue to do so in a brand new Tv series. It is time to make something accessible for they who are interested in the subject and want to learn more in an easy and vibrant way.  

  • Partnering with edible plant specialists from around the world, we plan to share their knowledge and expertise with the ever growing global edible plant enthusiasts. The series will touch upon our edible history in nature as well as to demonstrate new ways that chefs are incorporating age old fauna into modern cuisine. Forest to Plate will be produced in various countries across the globe to highlight how each country has a different history and culture in regards to edible plants. The show will also highlight local culture and cuisine. In each destination, we will hike, kayak, bike and camp our way across the country looking for the finest locations where we will find these wild edible plants. We will meet with local herbalists, foragers and chefs in each location. Help us reach this goal, so we can bring this information available to all of you.
  • By contributing to this project, you will help the spreading of age old and new edible knowledge around the world. What is getting more lost by the day, will be revealed again to the eye of the people. You will learn about easy yet stylish ways of cooking with wild herbs, in a way so you can start thinking about going into the forest yourself and experience what I feel on a daily base!!! 

Edible plants shown to me in (left to right) Iran, Serbia and Nepal on my last project "Biking to India in the search for edible plants" ( www.facebook.com/forestfoodies)

What We Need & What You Get

  • Being a Tv project about nature and adventure in foreign countries, it comes with a lot of expenses.

    We need hiking and country maps, books ( Flora/Culture), find hotels, activities ( Kayaking/Horseriding/...), contact persons, Guides, translators, permissions, transportation in and to the country ( Plain, Bus,…) , we need all the social media updated on a daily base on Facebook/Instagram/twitter and our website. Of course we must make all of these first ! We need to Design them, take pictures, built the website… Definitely check them out and find daily news on wild edibles from around the world! www.foresttoplate.com and www.facebook.com/foresttoplate
  • And these are just the preparations before going to the country !
    Once we are there, we need to pay for food from time to time ( we are not eating wild herbs all the time!!) ,  and of course, get the filming done ! This demands most of the work. It needs to be produced, written, directed, edited, sound recorded to eventually realize the finishing a top class product, made by the finest and most adequate people . 

  • We didn't want to tell our first destination at first, but is too hard not to tell you ! 
    Our first Destination will be in one of the last undiscovered countries in Europe, Serbia. With its mountainous landscape, Serbia's nature is more then beautiful, it is stunning. The people are friendly and the culture so enriched. Here, where wars have played a big role in the last century, many of the age old edible wild plant traditions have still remained. For one month, we will hike/kayak/and horseride our way across Serbia to look for our more than ten wild plant specialists.  We will bring you our trailer, which will represent the show for future projects, and ten 7 minute shows that talk about different people around Serbia demonstrating us wild recipes. 
  • If we don't manage to reach our entire goal, we will find last minute solutions to go and film in Serbia anyway. We have already put so many time in creating this project what makes it impossible not to realize it!
  • What you get besides the most awesome show on edible plants of the year ?? 
    Well, check out our PERKS on the right. Here you can find additional "Forest to plate" Activities and products. 
  • Really Awesome is the t-Shirt that says "EAT THE FOREST", Just drop in your size, and you will receive, a locally and ecologically printed T shirt made by Organic cotton. 


    Another great option: Organise a wild food dinner and show your friends something completely original in your own living room! This way you will bring wild food in your own house and spread the news that wild things are edible!!
    Below are some pictures of Wild food dinners in Brussels. 





The Impact

  • Forest to plate is a tv series that will gather edible information from around the world, safeguarding age old traditions and showing you modern cooking possibilities. It will be a manual for all those who look for deeper connection with their food and will teach you how to use wild food in an easy and safe way. 
    As a starting online series, our public is worldwide. I want to make a maximum effort, to make people around the world realize that wild edible food grows everywhere, all the time and that it has so much to offer. 
     
  • On my last project "Biking to India in the search for edible plants", it was clear that people were interested in the subject, especially in the combination with traveling and adventure, which is one of the reasons why the show will be around the world. People were constantly astonished by the diversity of wild edible foods, which I found everywhere. 
  • Together, we can make this project real, but it needs your help! 
    Providing us with the sum of money presented, our team will do all the best to produce and deliver the best product of its kind, so we can entertain you in a way you have never experienced before !

    Becoming part of this project, will not only make my dream come true, it will enable people to dream about a new world, the world of wild edible plants, the world I dream about everyday. ( Really, I dream about going in the forest and harvesting greens!!!) 

Risks & Challenges

  • All three being experienced in traveling around the world and having visited many developing countries, we know how things can go wrong whether governmental, or person to person. Already having to cope with many minor problems myself in India, Nepal, Iran, Turkey, Guatemala, Belize and so on… There is always a solution and it always gets solved if you have the patience to do so. 
  • This is what is so great about our team, is that we have been through many of these unexpected challenges, and that we always manage to get through. 

  • Want to know our team members ?! Let me present to you:  Zach Ashton, experienced in a variety of skills acquired on one of his many adventures, he will be our Second camera man, photographer and general co-producer.
    Check out his videos on Youtube. Or just google him. 

    And Yaeer Eldar. Working for years in Israelian television, he also makes adds for a variety of companies and has shot a lot of short movies. 

    Check out some of his work on Vimeo


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you wish to help, but you can't contribute, there are a variety of ways in which you can help us ! One is by getting out the word and share our Social Media updates, so we can create a global network of plant specialists. 
  • Second, if you think you can help us, or want to join this project, do not hesitate to contact me personally ! .

story:
Earthquake Casualties are NOT a Forgone Conclusion!

We know how to build earthquake resistant buildings. We know how to retrofit existing buildings to minimize risk to life. Unfortunately, however, earthquake engineering is a first-world phenomenon. One does not have to look far to see that damages in the western world are measured in dollars, whereas in developing nations they are measured in lives (official estimates are of over 300,000 deaths due to the 2010 Haiti earthquake alone). 

Political corruption and sub-standard building codes have prevented the third-world from benefiting from significant advancements in earthquake science and have created a scenario where hundreds of millions of people are at undue risk to earthquake induced damage and loss of life. The problem is exacerbated daily by skyrocketing urban densification in developing countries. What is the solution? How can we help?



My name is Robin Bruce. I am an earthquake engineer based out of Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. I have an undergraduate degree in Geological Engineering (University of British Columbia, Canada) and a master's degree in Engineering Seismology (Joseph Fourier University, France & University of Pavia, Italy). I have traveled to nearly 40 countries in my life, in particular spending significant amounts of time in earthquake prone areas of the world including the Pacific Northwest, Central and South America, the Mediterranean and the Balkan states.

The first step in earthquake preparedness is risk assessment - identifying which infrastructure is most vulnerable. My goal is to develop an international consultancy providing low-cost/sliding-scale earthquake hazard assessments to impoverished nations. These hazard assessments will allow local engineers to prioritize limited public funds to maximize cost benefits.

Hands down, the main cause of death due to earthquakes is from building collapse. Schools, hospitals and critical infrastructure are thus the obvious choices for seismic retrofit prioritization, but which of these are at the greatest risk in a given community? When it comes to earthquakes, all ground was NOT created equal. Just as important as how well the buildings were constructed is what kind of ground they are sitting on. Even in the case of identical buildings built adjacent to each other, the position of the building and the characteristics of the underlying subsoil could mean the difference between catastrophic and fatal collapse or safe egress (see photo).



Traditionally, hazard assessments required expensive drilling operations to evaluate subsurface soils, followed by laboratory testing of soil properties and time consuming computer modelling. Cutting edge technology, however, allows us to quickly and accurately record and interpret background vibrations in the earth called microtremors. These microtremors hold key information about how infrastructure (buildings, roadways, dams, power plants) will react to seismic events. Once we know which areas are at the greatest risk, we are then able to prioritize earthquake retrofits. With only limited funds available for seismic improvements, a quick and easy low-cost solution is desperately needed to provide help where help is needed the most.


What We Need

The current state-of-the-art technology for fast, reliable and inexpensive earthquake hazard assessments is called the Tromino (www.tromino.eu). The Tromino is an ultra-portable seismometer which records microtremor vibrations from inside buildings and on the ground surface. It can be operated by a single person. Each reading takes just a few minutes, allowing for rapid assessments of relatively large areas.


The Tromino sells out of Italy for 10,800 EUR. This equates to $15,000 CAD + taxes, shipping/insurance and applicable duties. Factoring in crowdfunding and credit card fees results in a required total of $19,500 CAD. I am happy to provide a detailed accounting of how I arrived at this figure. Please email me at earthquakephilanthropy@gmail.com.

I am solely looking to crowdfund the purchase cost of the Tromino. All other startup costs I will incur myself. If I do not reach my crowdfunding goal I will fund the project through further depleting my savings and incurring personal debt. I have quit my job as a geotechnical earthquake engineer and am focusing full-time on developing this consultancy. I plan to operate locally and regionally while actively pursuing international humanitarian assignments. 


    The Impact

    Earthquake vulnerability is well understood. Our only limitation is access to educated practitioners and proper technology. I can provide the manpower, if you help me provide the technology.

    Seismic hazard is generally well known worldwide on a macro level, however that information holds little meaning without incorporating the details of site specific building and ground conditions. 

    Cheap, accurate and readily available risk assessments will allow local governments to put their money toward essential improvements to the most critical infrastructure and thus the people in the most need. 

    Ultimately, my goal is to provide communities in developing nations with the information they require to best prepare themselves for a crippling natural disaster.

    Transparency

    I am currently developing a website to better disseminate progress updates and facilitate open communication, as well as advertise the consultancy to those in need. As the consultancy develops and projects are completed, I will post case study summaries on the website. In the meantime, I can be contacted via email at earthquakephilanthropy@gmail.com. I welcome your comments, questions and suggestions, and look forward to the opportunity to communicate with you personally.

    Our success is wholly dependent on getting the word out, so please remember to share this page on your personal social networking site. Together, we can help to bring state-of-the-art earthquake engineering to the developing world. Thank you for visiting my campaign.

Cheap, accurate and readily available risk assessments will allow local governments to put their money toward essential improvements to the most critical infrastructure and thus the people in the most need. Ultimately, my goal is to provide communities in developing nations with the information they require to best prepare themselves for a crippling natural disaster.
  TransparencyI am currently developing a website to better disseminate progress updates and facilitate open communication, as well as advertise the consultancy to those in need. As the consultancy develops and projects are completed, I will post case study summaries on the website. In the meantime, I can be contacted via email at earthquakephilanthropy@gmail.com. I welcome your comments, questions and suggestions, and look forward to the opportunity to communicate with you personally.Our success is wholly dependent on getting the word out, so please remember to share this page on your personal social networking site. Together, we can help to bring state-of-the-art earthquake engineering to the developing world. Thank you for visiting my campaign.

story:
CECOSNE NGO

Cecosne is an educational center that provides free bakery courses for teenagers to help them finding a job in their future.
To do so the NGO needs money in order to expand itself and buy new and better materials for the students.
Supporting the project means helping the children to have a better future.
Don't waste your opportunity to change their life. Be a better person! Help us out!

What We Need

We set as minimum amount 2000$. 

In fact with them we would be able to launch new courses, more detailed, and hopefully longer (since they last just 6 months right now our project is to make them last 9 months). 

We will buy new ovens,baking sheets, racks and mixers. We need a bigger work table and a new sink since our is not working most of the time.

With more founds we would be able to expand ourself, hire new teachers and include more and more students in our school (to do that we wil use advertisments for the first time in order to reach every part of the city). 

The final idea of our project is to create a bakery shop to sell all the products made by the children

We are using this opportunity as a starting point. We want this project to grow and became really huge in the future.

To do so we need you.

The kids need you, their life won't be the same without this school.

story:
Help coffee farmers break into the specialty market

We are Café Internacional, an initiative aimed at driving direct trade relationships by allowing importers and roasters to buy green coffee online directly from farmers.

By contributing to this project you are helping us to train farmers to use the internet as a business resource.  This February we launched an online marketplace where coffee farmers can showcase their farms and sell their coffee directly to importers and roasters.  Now, we need your help to train farmers to use our website and other tools, like email and social media, to market their farms and reach out to potential buyers.

We need YOUR support to succeed

Together we can create the conditions that are necessary for farmers to succeed in the specialty coffee market.   

Our training campaign will use three teams to train farmers in El Salvador, Honduras, and Guatemala.  We need your support to give our teams the resources they need to succeed. 

Each team, made up of two people, requires $1,500 per month to operate. In order for 3 teams to carry out successful 6 month training campaigns, we need $27,000. Funding will go to our training teams who will be organizing meetings & farmers and teaching classes in strategic regions that permit the highest number of farmers to participate.     

The Impact

Our training program will have a significant impact on the specialty coffee industry.  

  • If our teams reach only 10 farmers each per month, then after 6 months, 180 farmers will be sharing their farm info and promoting their coffee online.
  • If our teams reach 15 farmers each per month, then after 6 months, 270 farmers will be sharing their farm info and promoting their coffee online
During the month of March 2015, one team of two people was able to work with 12 farmers helping them learn to use email and Café Internacional's website to promote and sell their coffee.  Each farmer/cooperative that we worked with is capable of producing, processing, and selling between 5,000 and 20,000 lbs. of green specialty coffee per year.  
Selling coffee in the specialty market means higher earnings for farmers, which means a better livelihood for the people responsible for bringing you some of the world's most excellent coffee.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily, no worries, feel free to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, email, good old fashioned word of mouth, etc.  Thanks for your support.  We hope you continue to follow the progress being made at Café Internacional.
